Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: We couldn't find any negatives with Re Di Roma, the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good english, we were served tea with delicious biscuits after checking out, free wifi and internet in lobby, rooms tastefully decorated and comfortable with a balcony, and the location is dead quiet yet within easy reach of the hustle and bustle of Rome (by metro, 2mins walk). Couple to this was the fact the hotel was a relative bargain and there are numerous restaurants and a McDs 8mins walk away, and there's simply no reason to look anywhere else when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProverbialYeti
Reviews.Content: This was base for a 3 day whirlwind trip of Rome. Great little hotel with among the friendliest staff I have ever met. Room was nice and clean. Small bathroom but it had a tub! There were some very personal touches that went a long way. It was raining one day and they had left an assortment of umbrellas at the front desk...pick one up, go sightseeing and bring at back at the end of the day! Our checked bags didn't show up and the front desk staff hounded the airline and the baggage handling office with phone calls every day, and gave us progress report when we came back in the evening. Metro stop Re di Roma is a 5-7 minute walk, and then you can pretty much travel to any major sight within 30 mins max. And the room was less than $100/day. What a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little find......”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireWeasley
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Re Di Roma for 5 nights for a city break to Rome. Having received overpriced recommendations for other hotels in and around the city, I decided to do some research of my own, set a budget and then checked the reviews for the hotels I could afford. I stumbled across the Re Di Roma and it seemed too good to be true, but I decided to take a chance and went for it and i'm so glad we did! There is a train that goes directly to the Leonardo Da Vinci airport and for €8 you can get to the hotel very easily. You have the option of taking the train to the Termini, then get on the metro to the Re Di Roma stop which is literally at the end of the street or alternatively, get off at Tuscolana and it's a short walk to the hotel. The hotel itself is very boutique-like, stylish and modern, it really is quite pleasant and quite a contrast to the rustic, historic city of Rome. We checked in and got shown to our room which was on the 1st floor. The room wasn't huge but it was big enough for us, there's plenty of storage space, a mini fridge, complimentary toiletries in the bathroom and the safe is free to use. Breakfast is provided on a morning consisting of fruit, yoghurt, bread, meats, cheese, pastries and cereal as well as tea, coffee and juice. Rooms are equipped with sky television but most of the channels are pre-set to Italian, however, if the information box has a language option, you can change it to English and still manage to watch things! The road outside the hotel is fairly busy so if you go to sleep at night I wouldn't advise opening the window if you're a light sleeper but the rooms have air conditioning to help with this! There is a box for each room behind the reception desk so you can leave your room key there if you don't feel like carrying it round everyday and the staff are really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: vickie h
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel and had a very pleasant stay. The hotel is very modern and well furnished, our room was basic but very clean and provided everything we needed. The only negative we can think of is there are no English channels included on the TV and the walls of the room must be quite thin as you could hear the people next door, however it was not really an annoyance at any point. Fresh towels were provided daily and the breakfast was a basic continental but perfectly adequate. The staff were exceptionally helpful and were more than happy to offer advice about navigating around the city. The hotel is about a 2 min walk to the metro which we used regularly as it is about a 20 min walk to the Colosseum and about 30-40 min walk to the city center. If you do walk in to the city look out for the san giovanni basillica en route...its a magnificent church to wander around! We bought a three day ticket from the tobacconist shop opposite the hotel which gave us complete access to all the buses, trains and trams whilst we were there. We also made use of the number 87 bus which runs from a road nearby (about a 10min walk from the hotel) and took us close to campo de fuiri (near piaza navona) in the center of the city past the Colosseum. They do not run as regularly as the metro however and can be busy so watch out for pick pockets! The hotel provides a map of the city which we used consistently throughout our trip and can also arrange tours etc.They can also arrange transfers to the airport, however we got the train direct from fumicino to tuscolana station which was about a 10 min walk from the hotel and had no problems at all. I would avoid getting the fast train to the termini and changing there to get the metro to the re di roma stop as it is incredibly busy and you have to negotiate a lot of escalators! If you get the direct train aim for the corridor seating along the train rather than the seats of 4 as its easier to keep your luggage with you without getting in the way! It costs 8 euros each way for the train and you cant use the travel card for the Rome transport on these trains.

Reviews.Title: “just what you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: apbp2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for three night. Beds-firm, breakfast-standard continental, room-clean, location-right next to a metro station which is about 8 stops from the vatican and hotel is about 20 minutes walk from the colosseum, Shower-very good, just what you need after along day sight seeing. Staff-pleasant and fluent in english and very good at recommending places to visit and eat. Prices-good value especially for location and that it's ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla A
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, free wifi with a great connection on my iPad (there is a computer in the lobby as well). Fair breakfast. The beds were good and the bathroom was normal. The rooms were renovated. Far from tourist points, but only a 2min walk to the metro station. Not attractive neighborhood. Would stay here again, fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Metro and train to Fucimino Airport!”
Reviews.Author: Alex D
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel is within walking distance to main metro subway and train to airport. Tons of shopping, restaurant and bars within walking distance. Rooms and hotel are kept immaculate. Front desk staff is extremely helpful with directions and dinner ideas/reservations. Rooms have a very modern feel, nothing Italian about them, but still extremely nice. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: iancoady
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and it didn't disappoint. 2mins walk from Metro in a quieter neighbourhood, this hotel had all the benefits of city centre without the noise. Room was neat and tidy with a decent bathroom and they do a decent continental breakfast. I also made full use of the free wi-fi. My main criticism is that the walls are paper thin so if someone else in the hotel has a late one you can here them singing and talking. Other minor criticisms are the tv not offering any English speaking channels and some but not all of reception staff being a little grumpy. Overall though fantastic value and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! We will be back every time we come to Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Lalyv14
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its reviews. And we were not disappointment. We loved everything about this hotel. Location was perfect. Re Di Roma station was only 1 block away, 10 minutes to Termini station. Hotel was wonderful. Our room was the "cheapest one", but it was not cheap at all. It was very large in space, with a full bathroom and a queen size bed. We had lots of room to walk around our room and our room was always cleaned and with fresh/warm towels. I was amazed that out toiletries were always refilled. And we had slippers from the hotel. Breakfast, was just perfect. We had croissants, and other types of breaks. Butter, jelly. Cereal, milk, coffee, fruits, juice, cheese, jams, etc. We could eat as much as we wanted and even take a banana or apple for a mid-day snack. Our room had a mini fridge, and TV with cable as well as internet connection. The staff, was just wonderful. They tried to help us with every request, both at the breakfast area as well as the lobby area. They recommended us the best place to have pizza, and gelato. Funny cause we looked on goo.gle the #1 gelato place in Rome and we went there, and on our last day in Rome took the staff advice and visited the one on Re Di Roma Piazza, which was way better than the one recommended by goo.gle. Walking around Re Di Roma was wonderful, and having such a great hotel to come back every night made our stay even better. FYI, just keep in mind that the hotel price does not include a 2 euro charge per person per day, something with the city charges, so keep some cash in your pockets as you will need to pay this amount before you leave the hotel. Other than that, just enjoy your stay and the wonders that Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay at the Hotel Re di Roma”
Reviews.Author: Budge_8
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Re di Roma and there is one word which sums up my experience - Outstanding! The hotel is located in the mainly residential area of San Gionvanni, but don't let this put you off as there is a metro station only a minute's walk away from the hotel. If like me you prefer to stay above ground, the Colloseum is only a twenty minute stroll away. My room (503) was a good size, with a double bed, a well equipped bathroom and a terrace with patio furniture. I even managed to use the terrace as despite travelling in February the weather was so good. Breakfast was excellent and continental in style, but there was a varied choice of food available - yoghurts, fresh fruit, cheese, meat, bread, croissants, cereals etc. However, what makes a stay at this hotel special are the staff. All were very friendly and the reception staff spoke excellent English. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they always made me feel welcome. I will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Rome and so should you as you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0dd
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. One slight negative was the bathroom was cold but then we did have exceptionally cold weather for Rome. The location was excellent as this hotel is very near the metro. Lots of restaurants close by and we received a very good recommendation for a restaurant within walking distance from the receptionist. We also managed to check in early and leave our bags at the hotel on our last day. Breakfast was as expected although it would have been nice if the croissants and rolls were served warm.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieW69
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel, I booked it after reading the trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. A modern hotel, excellent decor. It is set in a residential area so away from the hustle and bustle which was nice. The hotel is a 2 min walk from the metro Di Roma stop which is really handy. It was approx a 10 min walk to a railway station where you can travel to and from the aiport very easily. The room was excellent, 502 has a lovely balcony, a good size with bath and shower. Cleanliness of the hotel was imacualte. The reception is open 24 hours along with a small bar area. Breakfast was continental and top quality. We paid 217 euro for 3 nights which for the hotel vs value was outstanding. Would highly recommend and can't say anything negative at all. Thank you hotel Di Roma!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Base for a Great Holiday in Rome....”
Reviews.Author: AllOverThere
Reviews.Content: With my wife now six months pregnant we decided we wanted to visit Rome whilst we could still move about without a pushchair! This hotel served our purposes entirely. Located a stone's throw from the Re di Roma Metro stop we were able to get around the city with ease (we purchased the one week Metro pass for €16 each) Our room was on the top floor and came with a small terrace (which we used despite the cold!) and was bright, modern and extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and very knowledgeable about the local area and the sights in the city. We used both of their restaurant recommendations and were very pleased with our meals on each occasion. Breakfat was a continental affair and was entirely satisfactory (though I am a sucker for a cooked breakfast when I am on holiday!) We brought out own kettle and tea as there wasn't one in the room. Unfortunately I can't really add anything that hasn't been said in the other reviews. This is a great hotel in a great city. You will enjoy your time here!

Reviews.Title: “We will use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: HeadLikeAFingOrange
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently close to the Re di Roma metro station, across the road from a local bar/coffee shop and close to a small supermarket type shop. The striking thing about this hotel is how modern and new everything is. Our room was immaculately clean as was the breakfast room and bathrooms. Some reviews on here describe the breakfast as average but we thought it was a very good buffet, continental style breakfast with juice and a good quality coffee machine as well as yoghurts and fruit to choose from with all the usual rolls, croissants and cheese and meat. Wi-Fi is free and there is an internet enabled computer to use in the bar area. We had a few drinks before bed in the bar and the prices were reasonable and the measures were huge, more like trebles than singles which made my night’s sleep even more sound than usual!! Staff all spoke excellent English and were friendly and polite and helpful. Our stay genuinely deserves 5 out of 5 and we would use this hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BradStraiton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 14th December till the 18th of December with our 2 teenage daughters and had great time, as has been said many times excellent price verse quality. The room was perfect for a family of 4 and very clean, not very spacious but then we spent very little time in the room. The breakfast room was a bit cramped when busy but no complaints about the breakfast itself, great continental breakfast. It was also very nice, after a full day, to come and sit in the lounge area and have a cup of tea or coffee, very relaxing. There is free wifi in the rooms and free internet access downstairs opposite the lounge area. The staff were great and always helpfull. The Re Di Roma metro station is down the road and trains come\go every 2 minutes with a one day ticket (24Hrs) costing 4 Euros, very cheap and can be used on the buses as well. Re di Roma station is 4 'stops' away from Termini (10 Minutes). We had great pizza's at Non Solo Pizza at Piazza dei Re di Roma very close to the metro. Will definitly be back... have unfinished business in Rome :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BingoSonoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Re di Roma for a total of 5 days in August 2011. We really enjoyed the room - really beautiful inside, very spacious, modern, everything was very clean and user-friendly (ie TV, air). The view from the windows - less beautiful. But it's a quiet area and it was good enough for who it was for! Loved that we had a patio with chairs and a table, it was perfect for sitting out OR drying the clothes we washed in our bathroom. The internet worked great there for our laptop and iPod touch. The breakfast was ok - nothing totally memorable but fine. While we were there, the metro wasn't working - that being said, the walk was too long to get to where we needed to go most of the time. It was definitely farther from most places than I expected. If the metro had been working, it would have been perfect though, because the distance meant it was a quiet area. There was a day where we wanted to stay in and get some laundry done and try to get in touch with our families, and we actually were asked to leave since we hadn't left by 11, but this was understandable because they wanted to clean our room - the only problem was that I had asked how long they expected it would take to clean the room, we were told about 30 or 45 minutes, and 45 minutes later I walked upstairs and there were like 3 people in our room just standing around. That was strange at the time, it threw me off a little, but looking back I think one was a manager talking to the cleaning people. Normal precautions about keeping your valuable stuff in your bags would suffice there. The showers drain very slowly - when asked if they could come clean it, the front desk staff explained that the way the showers are is different than other places and the slow draining is a result because they are trying to avoid having any weird smells enter the bathroom? It was confusing but they tried their best to explain it (even drew a picture). We didn't see this any other place we stayed at in Italy. We basically just had to turn the water off while we were soaping up, turn it back on when we were rinsing. As long as you're ok taking the metro or walking a pretty good distance to the main spots in Roma, this is a great place to stay for the value. We really couldn't beat the price and cleanliness, size of the room and friendliness of the staff. They frequently recommended good places to eat for my husband and I, and took the time to draw it out on the map.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place in rome”
Reviews.Author: FedericaC_83
Reviews.Content: I was quite satisfied for booking this hotel: the location is good with the metro just 2 minutes far from the entrance; staff is very nice; breakfast was very good with lots of choices and the room was wonderful; very nice also the bathroom, new and with all the comforts. Really great value for your money. If I come back to Rome I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: BiancaAB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for three nights at the beginning of our Italy trip. It's a great value for your money - big, clean rooms and modern. If you don't mind hopping on the metro (which is right down the street) it's a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckstar1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long weekend in the Hotel Re di Roma. The hotel was clean and the rooms were of a generous size, ours had a balcony which was a nice extra. The breakfasts were ample,with a good selection on the buffet table. The hotel offered free wi-fi which we made use of during our stay. The only downside of the hotel was the location, it was a good 20 minute walk to the Colosseum, which did make it a bit of a trek after a long days walk around Rome. Saying that there was a metro stop at the end of the street, so you could always take the train. The staff were welcoming and friendly, I would recommend this hotel to friends, just be aware it is not right in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from tourists”
Reviews.Author: kerin34
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with lovely furniture, floors and a very nice bathroom. Service is very pleasant and we got some great recommendations for food. We stayed on the 1st floor (2nd floor in reality) on the street and there was virtually no noise from occupants or outside. The beds were narrow (as is usual), but comfortable. A firmer mattress than I'm used to, but I like a very soft bed. The breakfast buffet was merely okay - I'll skip it next time. Steps to the re di Roma Metro station, 4 stops south of Termini. This is residential Rome - although metro is close, it's not near any of the sights, but I enjoyed seeing Romans live their daily lives and also not face a gauntlet of folks trying to sell me things every ten seconds. Would definitely stay here again. Price was more than a budget hotel, but I'm willing to pay a little more for this level of sophistication. Other notes: plentiful hot water at all times of day, (a bidet, if that float your boat), free wi-fi, some english TV channels in addition to Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Loving it so far”
Reviews.Author: Kelly N
Reviews.Content: This is my second night, and I am loving it so far. Good location ( easy to get from the airport and 50 meters from the metro station) , good breakfast, comfortable room with a honest prize. The staff is nice too, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: homin80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a hidden treasure for normal, budget-watching travelers like me. I believe that this is one of the best three star hotels in Italy. First of all, the room rates are quite reasonable (around 190 dollar per night in mid-May, 2011). The rooms are very neatly maintained, and many of them come with a pretty decent-sized terrace (mine had a rooftop terrace, which was lovely). Bathrooms are spacious and very clean. Daily cleaning service is impeccable. Sleep quality is pretty good as the hotel is located at the end of a rather quite street. The location isn't the best in Roma, but then it is only about three minute walk away from Line A's re di Roma station. As there aren't many exceptional restaurants nearby, you may want to dine somewhere else and come back while it is not too late. There is a brilliant tiramisu place called Bar Pompi near the re di Roma circle, however. The rooms come with continental breakfast, which isn't the fanciest in the world but still offers pretty much everything you would expect in a satisfying morning meal. Wifi connection is fairly strong, but I don't know if they offer wired connection. The staff are quite professional and friendly. Let me tell you how dedicated they are. I had to leave very early in the morning (one of those Ryanair flights at ungodly hours), but the concierge offered to prepare a breakfast just for me at 4am. 4am! More impressively, the guy set up the full breakfast buffet arrangement and didn't complaint or frown a bit. That's what I call true professionalism. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Good Good”
Reviews.Author: LeaoAlvalade
Reviews.Content: It always depends of what you're looking for, but if you're looking for a Hotel with good location (close metro and nice walking distance from some majorsights), confortable hotel (not luxury, but really confortable), good staff (not personal roomkeepers, but sympathetic and professional), good breakfast (not the heavens food, but a acceptable variety of cereals, bread, croissant, yogurts and fruit), this is undoubtably one of the best options in Rome. Close (really close) to Re di Roma metro station that is in line A which gives you easy acess to different points of the city. Besides the hotel, I would advise you to dinner in pizzeria da Ivo (trastevere), pizzeria da Baffeto and L'archetto (close to fontana de trevi). There's also a nice restaurant, near the hotel if want to stay close. Travelled as young couple but the hotel suits mature couple or families as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: We stayed ther for 3 nights and it was amazing. The room, the facilities, the location close to the tube station...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie2566
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned with the area when arriving at the hotel but could not have been more impressed with the hotel inside. The rooms are immaculate with all the facilities you would need. The location is good with only a minute walk to the nearest tube station and only 1 euro per journey. We walked to the Colosseum a few times and it only took just over half an hour. The staff in the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. The directions given on the hotel website for getting to the hotel from the airport were also really useful. Definitely the best 3 star i've ever stayed in, would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: CaroServigna
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this hotel for three nights during our Rome vacation and they were fantastic. The hotel is located a block away from the Re di Roma metro stop from where you can reach anywhere in the city. If you take the train from Fuimicino airport, you can also reach the hotel from the Tuscolana station. There are a lot of good places to eat at walking distance. There are also a couple of supermarkets where you can get water and snacks at reasonable prices. The hotel offers free breakfast which consists of croissants, bread, spreads, nutella, fruits, ham, cheese, cereals, yogurt and juices from 7 to 10 am. They offer free wi-fi in their bedrooms. The bedroom is spacious and very comfortable. Bed and pillows are soft enough for a great night sleep. Since there is no rug but hardwood floor, they give you complementary slippers. We went in November and their ac was set to heater, but the room had a very nice cool temperature so we didn't need to use it or open the window. The few minutes we did open the window the street was quiet. The room even had a balcony which we didnt have time to enjoy. The decoration is modern and beautiful. The service is excellent. Eleonora helped us with many things and questions, including to find an excellent restaurant a few blocks away. They even held a bag for us for a few days that we went to Florence. When going to the hotel, keep in mind that it doesn't have a big sign to indicate where it is. The name of the hotel is at the door. Also when planning dinner near the hotel, the restaurants in the area open for dinner at 7:30pm. This is a beautiful place in a nice location and I recommend it strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel within easy reach of all of Rome's sights”
Reviews.Author: Bounford
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay after booking based on other Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is in an ideal location, just a 2 minute walk from the Re Di Roma metro stop (from where you can get all over Rome.) The rooms are clean and modern, and include Sky tv, toiletries, slippers, towels, mini bar (which was very reasonably priced) and air conditioning. Breakfast was simple but contained everything you could want to set you up for the day. The price of the hotel was fantastic; I'm convinced that this is the best value for money hotel in the whole of Rome. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. What more can I say?!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: josef-uk
Reviews.Content: After days of looking on-line for hotels in Rome I feared that all the hotels were over-priced and dated...then I found Re di Roma! This place is a gem! This is definitely the best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were decorated and furnished to a very high standard. The reception staff were very helpful in advising us on places to visit, and the best times to miss crowds, etc. The gentleman on reception also advised me on where to get the best Tiramisu in Rome...Pompei...walking distance from the hotel and open until 2am! Amazing! The hotel is 2mins walk from the tube stop, only 4 stops from Termini. We did walk to the Colosseum which is around 20mins. Would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: john T
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff , from the main desk ,to the cleaning ladies were always cheerfull and although language was an issue sometimes, it was not a p[roblem. Close to the Metro stop and a short walk to 'Pompeii' [, A delicious cafeteria style, restaurant, don't need to know Italian, just point] We stayed 7 days and didn't need to go to a tourist center, the front desk had all the information we needed. Great location, quiet, clean, nice people. We would definitely book here again if in Rome. They have a deal with a local taxi co. for 45 euro, for 2 people and luggage to the airport. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: J01976
Reviews.Content: Really lovely boutique hotel really near the metro. Nicely decorated, clean and good selection for breakfast. Free internet and really helpful reception staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 star hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bxlcanuk
Reviews.Content: In stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in November 2011. I was in room 503, double for single use, which had an attached roof terrace with a nice view. It seesm that room 502 also has a terrace. The room and bathroom were spotless and very modern, bed was comfortable. TV included several english channels for news. The hotel provides free wifi. The breakfast was buffet style and included fresh croissants, rolls, cheese, ham, salami, juices, coffee/tea, yoghurt, fruit. All the public areas were modern and nicely decorated. The hotel is less than block from the metro stop Re di Roma, so its very easy to get around Rome from that location. The room rate I paid was 78 Euros/night including breakfast plus 2 Euros/night for Rome city tax (cash). This hotel provides good value for money for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Re Di Roma - Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Tourist001
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent - only a couple of blocks from the metro station Re Di Roma on Line A. The metro station itself is not too far from the central station termini. From the central "termini" station one can catch the regional/intercity/Eurostar trains to other places in Italy or other countries. The city tour buses (hop on hop off) can also be taken outside the Termini station. The hotel itself is location in a quiet neighborhood giving a real local feel/view of Rome. The staff at the reception is friendly, polite, efficient, and professional. I asked for the restaurants nearby and was provided with a few recommendations along with a local street map. The hotel itself is kind of small but very quiet and comfortable. The rooms are also small but again well appointed and comfortable. I liked the huge deck outside my fifth floor room which gave a glimpse of street life outside and fresh air and sunshine :) The only thing that can be improved in the room is the shower area. It was barely okay for a slim person like me but I could not imagine how someone with a bigger frame would fit in there. The room price included the wi-fi connection and morning breakfast which is a big plus. I know in Europe the hotels don't provide a coffee tea maker in the room but I wish they did as I love to have a cup of tea/coffee right after I wake up :) Overall, I was happy with my stay in Hotel Re Di Roma for three nights and would stay again in this hotel if my travel plans bring me to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Real delight, at home far from home”
Reviews.Author: Meir G
Reviews.Content: It's our second time at the hotel and we'll keep coming every time we're in Rome It's clean, comfortable, it has friendly and efficient staff & management Good deal M Green (Israel)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicole w
Reviews.Content: it is a nice Hotel, located a little outside the city center, but very close to the metro station, you have not to worry for the transfer as the metro can take you to the sites of Rome. Room was nice and clean and warm enough, as it was cold outside, The staff was helpfull and they replied to our questions, the breakfast was also nice, (they can make some changes hear) They have to put a label outside the building to find it more easy, the first time why arrive from the metro it was difficult for us to find the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sanjoy88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location is a 3 minute walk to the Re di Roma metro and there is agood choice of local eating venues around. the area. Stayed in a family room. The hotel is very cosy and the breakfast is adequate. The made to order cappucino's were a big bonus for me. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: calimiller
Reviews.Content: I have to start by talking about the service because it was top notch. The people at the front desk were very nice, very welcoming and happy to answer questions. ALSO (and this was big for me), they served us breakfast at 6am the day we were leaving. I went to the desk the day before to make sure someone would be available to check us out around 6am. They assured me there is always someone at the desk and then asked me about my plans for breakfast. The hotel serves a continental breakfast (more on that after) everyday from 7am to 10am. They offered to make the breakfast room available to us if we wanted it. So the day we checked out they opened up early just for us so we could eat before catching our flight. Now to the breakfast. It was continental breakfast included in the price of the room. It was one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had. There were pastries, fruit, yogurt, bread, meats and cheeses, juice, cereal, and a coffe machine that made everything from espresso to cappuccinos to hot chocolate. The rooms weren't huge but they were clean and comfortable. The beds weren't great (kind of hard for my tastes) but lots of pillows. The blanket was very thin and I thought that was going to be a problem but turned out it was warm enough at night I didn't want much more. The hotel is not central in Rome but it's like 200 feet from a subway station that can take you all over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I agree entirely with those who have emphasized the fine service you receive at the Re di Roma. Everyone on the staff treated us in a friendly, helpful way. For example, I wanted to find a workout facility with a swimming pool. The front desk staff cheerfully did research on the subject for me. You want a cappuccino to go with your breakfast? Just ask, and you'll get a very good one (as many as you like, actually). In addition, the room was quiet and comfortable, and had a nice balcony. And, as pointed out by so many others, the location is ideal. If and when we return to Rome, this is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Re di Roma”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the price. Good location, close to Metro, and attractions. We walked from the hotel to the Colosseum everyday, roughly a 30 minute walk, and close to San Giovanni in Laterno. Front desk, breakfast personnel and housekeeping were all very helpfull. We had a day tour at 7am and they made sure the breakfast was available before we left. Try the pizza and suppli at Pizza Re De Roma and take it to the park to people watch. Gelato and terramissu at Pompi is a must. All three of our couples liked this hotel and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, close to train”
Reviews.Author: letyoursoulglo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re di Roma was a real find for a great price. Just outside the Rome city walls, it's a short stroll to a Line A Metro station (at the end of the street), so very convenient and literally a ten to fifteen minute trip to a lot of major sights. It's only a few stops from Termini if you need to get a train to a neighbouring country. The hotel is boutique and quiet - nicely refurbished with comfortable beds, cable TV and a very efficient air conditioner (you need it in Rome in September!) It's got a nice modern feel and I found the room very clean and comfortable. The shower had a minor issue with drainage, but I find this is common to most cities with old buildings and ancient plumbing. The staff were very helpful (and French!!). The night clerk in particular was charming and helpful. Breakfast was your typical Italian breakfast of cold meats, bread, spreads, brioche and yoghurts which suited me just fine. In a city where it's hard to find comfortable and clean accommodation in a cheap price range, this hotel was a great find. Well worth the ratings given on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ks4pu
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. The bed, though still not nearly as comfy as what we are used to in the States, was the most comfortable of our Italy trip. The breakfast was good and the hotel was clean. Though the hotel is conveniently located a block from the Metro, its location as it relates to all the sites in Rome leaves a lot to be desired. Rome's metro line is not extensive, so while it will get you to some sites conveniently, you are left walking or connecting with buses to get to other sites. Keep in mind that the Metro and the buses get EXTREMELY crowded during parts of the day. I am talking barely room to breath kind of space. Also, the Metro line A closes at 9 pm. Bus lines MA1 and MA2 run along Metro line A and will get you back to the hotel until 11:30. You must plan for this and keep it mind when eating a traditional long Italian dinner in the heart of Rome. There isn't much going on around the hotel, so you will want to have dinner in the heart of Rome most nights. The hotel did have one dinner recommendation nearby that we tried. It was fine. Overall my husband and I both agreed that we would have preferred to stay in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, large corner room with king bed and patio. Clean and modern design, excellent soundproofing against city noise. Close to the Re di Roma Metro station, so getting into the city center was a snap. A few bus lines stop nearby, but it's a long bus ride to town; if you're going somewhere off the Metro it could take a while.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: dg5471
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Re di Roma for two nights. So much nicer than it appears on it's website photos we thought. It is located away from the main section of the city in a residential area, but you walk down the street a very short distance and you are right at an entrance to Rome's great Metro system. The rooms are very modern, clean, nice size by European standards, and upscale in every way in comparison to other places we stayed on our vacation. We were even able to get complimentary wi-fi in our rooms which was a real plus. Can't say enough good things about the staff. They went out of their way to be helpful and courteous. Free breakfast as well. I would certainly recommend this hotel to friends and will stay here again if I get the chance to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlton3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Re di Roma in August for 5 nights at the start of a one month Europe tour and it couldn't be faulted. Good size bedroom and bathroom (with bath). Very clean. Excellent staff. Good breakfast. It's couple of suburbs out of town but that's no problem. The Metro was closed for repair but a replacement bus was available and the front desk had tickets for guests. It was everything you want in a hotel. As others have said, there's no large hotel sign, just look for the red door. Would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - easy for 6 people”
Reviews.Author: linkfamily6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Re di Roma for one night before leaving Rome for the US. We had stayed in a flat near the Trevi Fountain for one week and then in Venice for one week. We took the train back to Rome the night before we left. Although I really liked staying in the center of all the tourist attractions for the first part of our trip, it was kind of interesting to stay in this hotel in a different part of the city. It was very near to the train station which would make it easy to get to all the attractions if need be. The hotel was kind of hard to identify, although close to the train station. I read up on this site and made sure I noted the "red door" of the hotel. We had dinner at a local restaurant suggested by the hotel staff (didn't love it but interesting experience), shopped in a department store, which my teenage daughter and I loved (visited lots of specialty shops before!), and had wonderful baths in nicely air-conditioned rooms. We stayed in two rooms - one slept 4 and the other 2. Very roomy for the most part - although the four person room had two twins in the "main area" which was right by the door. It got a little crowded in that area but since it was for 1 night we didn't care. The 2 person room was nice. The bathroom was lovely - great big tub that we all took turns using after subsisting on showers only for 2 weeks. The service was great - they arranged for two taxis to pick us up for our trip to the airport. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed...”
Reviews.Author: pshie
Reviews.Content: Useful information first: How to get to hotel: Take Metro line A to the Re di Roma stop. Go towards the Via Vercelli exit and take the one on the left. When you exit the metro stop, just walk down the street for about a minute, the hotel will be on the left. Great restaurant nearby: Da Bruttone. Pompi. My wife and I spent 11 days in 5 cities in Italy and this was our favorite hotel for a variety of reasons. Location: Very convenient... the hotel is less than a minute walk to the metro stop for Line A, which I think is the more useful of the two lines that they have in Rome. Line A will take you to the central train station, Spanish Steps, Vatican, and more. The hotel is located in a residential area, which is very safe even walking at night. The downside is that there aren't too many restaurants nearby, but the ones that are close are very very good. Decor: The hotel has a modern decor, very tastefully appointed. The room was large and very comfortable. Bathroom was clean with clean modern lines. Breakfast: Included... pretty simple with cereal, yogurt, croissant, bread... nothing real fancy but gets you on your way. Professionalism: We were impressed. The staff at the front desk were all very helpful and professional. They were very quick to help us. The staff arranged a 6 am taxi pick-up for us for the airport and there were warm croissants waiting for us in the breakfast room. That was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MS06
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being outside the center of Rome then Re di Roma is a good choice. It's in a quiet, safe area, less than 5 minutes walk from the subway station, and only 4 stops to Termini). (Until April 2012 the A line is shutting down at 9, other than Saturday night, but there is a bus.) A comfortable room, and the balcony was an added bonus. On some nights there was noise from the room above. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and made good recommendations for diinner in the area. Very effective airconditioning (which ran a few degrees colder than the setting.) The breakfast was adequate, but not great. There is a PC with Internet access for guest use. (The @ key isn't in the same place as on a US keyboard. ) There is a well-stocked supermarket on the Re di Roma circle, and you can buy bus tickets, postcards at a good price and stamps across the road from the hotel. (If you are going to be in Rome for at least 3 days than the Roma Pass is well worth it - costs 25 euros for 3 days unlimited bus and train travel, free entrance to your first two museums (and you skip the line at the Colosseum) and a discount on subsequent museums.)

Reviews.Title: “Spent one night at Re di Roma...great value”
Reviews.Author: Luv2experience
Reviews.Content: Our first week in Italy was split between Rome, Venice and Florence. We had spent our last week at an Agriturismo in Tuscany about 55km form Siena and spent our last night in Italy at Hotel Re di Roma on September 9. We really appreciated the location of the hotel, the great service and comfortable, well appointed suites in the hotel. I had wished that we had spent more time in the area as we saw a different side of the city what we referred to as the "real" Rome. The area is a hub bub of activity, many locals and offers great shopping and plenty of places to dine out. We would highly recommend the hotel for those travellers seeking an alternative to the more traditional touristy, historic areas of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth going off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Hitomaro
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its favourable reviews on TripAdvisor, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel, while slightly out of the historic centre, has extremely convenient access to the Metro. It's also not far from Tuscolana station, which offers a direct train to the airport (though perhaps slightly too far to walk with heavy luggage or in bad weather). The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and offered some great suggestions for places to eat in the evening - make sure to ask them to direct you to Bar Pompi for delicious tiramisù. The room, while not enormous, was spotlessly clean and beautifully fitted out (especially the bathroom). Breakfast was good and fresh, though the coffee was out of an automatic machine. All in all, a very nice hotel, right at the top of the 3* category, and given Roman prices, a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A good affordable hotel - what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: malcie
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor research came up with this hotel as a good compromise between price & quality & we weren't disappointed with the result. Although not in the very centre of Rome, there is a metro stop just a few hundred metres from the hotel & from there the frequent trains will get you into the centre in literally only a few minutes. Reception staff are friendly, helpful & speak English. Check in was quick & simple. We had a twin room on the fourth floor (there is a lift) which was clean & well facilitated, having very efficient aircon, overbath shower, bidet, a range of toiletries, flat screen TV & a small balcony. There were no tea/coffee making facilities but there was a minibar. Rooms were serviced daily to a good standard (we returned one day to find the pyjamas which had been inadvertantly left out were folded very neatly on the bed). Both the hotel & the area were quiet. We paid £625 for five nights which is very reasonable for Rome & included breakfast which was a bit limited but perfectly OK. The hotel also has a 24hr bar with reasonable prices. Rome is a pretty spectacular city but there are a lot of cobbles & steps etc so I recommend comfortable shoes! It was also very hot & humid while were were there but there are small drinking fountains all over the place so buy a bottle of water & then top up from a fountain - the water is good, cool & of course free. Do get yourself travel passes. They're cheap (16€ for a 7 day one) & are valid for metro, tram & bus. One day we went for a trip to Tivoli which was quite a few stops on the metro & then nearly an hour on a bus & were surprised to find our passes were vaild for that too. Back to the hotel review. This is a good one - On our last day we had to check out in the morning but our flight wasn't until late evening. The hotel looked after our cases all day & arranged for a taxi to the airport for us for 7.30pm. We arrived back at the hotel at 7.20pm to find the taxi had just arrived. What else can I say? Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay here.”
Reviews.Author: dbuzzy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic modern hotel at an affordable rate. If you are planning on walking everywhere, this may be Re di Roma's only potential negative. My wife and I tried to walk everywhere the first few days and soon discovered that the Metro is the best way to get around. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone that doesn't need to be right in the middle of all the hustle within the heart of the main tourist attraction areas. It's cute, clean and the staff is incredible. They were very friendly and went out of their way to accommodate our every need. Beyond our marriage and honeymoon experience, this was absolutely the best service experience my wife and I have ever enjoyed in our travels. We stayed in February 2010, so I should have posted this sooner, but if I haven't forgotten his name and he still works there......Giorgio is definitely in-line for raise.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tijjw
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides modern, comfortable accommodation at a very reasonable rate. It is situated in a pleasant location near to the Metro (2 mins walk). The Re di Roma square at the end of the road is pleasant and the area appears to be very safe (we felt safe walking back to the hotel in the evenings). We were travelling with two teenagers and had a large quadruple room on the top floor which had dividing doors and the appearance of two separate adjoining rooms with two bath/shower rooms. The breakfast was basic, continental, but adequate. The reception staff were extremely helpful, pleasant and all spoke very good English. There is also free Wi-Fi in the hotel, which we had no problems accessing from our rooms. We would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Trnafs
Reviews.Content: Although the Re Di Roma Metro line was down, the staff was excellent in providing us with alternate routes. There were 2 main bus routes that ran throughout the day that were able to get us to our destination. This is a very clean, to the point, hotel. If you are a younger couple, I may suggest a more trendy hotel near Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: JJShank
Reviews.Content: This was off the 'tourist path' but well worth it. The hotel was amazing, clean, and the staff was VERY helpful. We would stay here again and the bus and train station are very close so you get every through out Rome. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Rome suburb”
Reviews.Author: mrrfrost
Reviews.Content: When arriving from the airport the hotel is about a 10 minute walk away from Tuscolana station - a 40 minute direct train ride from the airport. Alternatively the nearest subway stop, Re Di Roma, is 4 stops from the main station, Termini. The hotel is very clean and the rooms reasonably spacious for Europe! Free wifi throughout the hotel, no too expensive mini-bar, adequate toiletries and lots of TV channels if you need them! There is a continental buffet breakfast included, no eggs but plenty of cereals, fruit, yoghurts, bread, tea and coffee to get you started for the day. There are a couple fo supermarkets and other shops nearby the subway station. The staff all speak good English. I'm sure usually getting around Rome's subway is easy but at the moment there is lots of construction going on and Line A (which serves the hotel) was completely closed during August. There are replacement buses to Termini and back but it's a bit of a pain. There are plenty of other buses around though. I thought the Rome subway system was grim and thoroughly needs modernising. It is possible to walk everywhere from the hotel if you are a keen walker! It took me about 30 minutes to reach the Colisseum and I even manage to walk back from the Vatican, via Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc in a couple of hours. I would stay here again but probably check about the subway. Be careful of pickpockets - especially around Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel without a Sign, Comfort without the Frills”
Reviews.Author: monkeyface09
Reviews.Content: Just metres from the metro stop of the same name, the unassuming Hotel Re di Roma is especially economical for high season and offers some respite from the tourist mob as it’s located just outside the city’s historic centre. With comfortable, minimalist rooms, it could exceed most expectations for a 3-star hotel if it weren’t for the lack of signage, the manual reception, and the use of room keys. Unlike most establishments, this hotel actually provides a small soap bar for the sink and another larger one for the shower. But this seemingly thoughtful gesture becomes rather pointless as the shower does not have a soap tray, forcing guests to use their creativity to compensate for poor design. While a typical continental breakfast buffet is included, an unexpected feature is definitely the endless cable channels, which may be a common perk among hotels that can’t simply rely on their proximity to tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannesydney1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for the price. It is a little out of the centre of town but right near the Metro station. The room, bed and bathroom were very comfortable. The breakfast was ok- not great quality italian produce as I had expected. The staff were helpful in directions and what we needed. I would recommend this hotel if you dont mind having to catch transport to attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for a Rome-visit”
Reviews.Author: TaxiFaber
Reviews.Content: Great place for exploring Rome, especially when you take the slow train from the airport (FCO) to Tuscolana (8 euro single), walk to the hotel in ten minutes, and -with your reservation- have requested a standard room with a balcony. Not only are you near the metro B-station Re di Roma in this hotel, and, when the metro's being worked on, and you can't find the replacement bus, you're just outside the Rome walls and within walking distance of a number of sights and/or a reasonable 14.00 euro taxi ride from Spagna. Staff are super and multilingual, rooms not big but well-equipped with small minibar, there's free WiFi (great!) a sitting area and a 24/7 bar (!) plus an adequate breakfast which sets you up well enough for your Rome-exploring. Metrotickets can be bought from the tobacconists across the road. There's supermarket on the Re di Roma for (additional) food and drink. Enjoy this excellent base for a Rome-visit!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gauravs09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a little away from the main city center but it is not inaccessible ... its in a safe residential neighbourhood ... metro station is closeby but metro line A does not run after 9pm or so. The rooms are clean ... looks like newly renovated ... have a nice bath tub ... all necessary amenities ... food is not available but there is a very nice bakery / pizza bar nearby ... breakfast can be better, but its manageable as Rome is not a city where you shud eat in the hotel ! ... pizza gelato pasta tiramisu ... its all heaven and its all out there on the streets!! The hotel staff is definitely helpful .. have internet pc .. wifi connection ... airport pickup for a reasonable fee ... and decent location ... its not very far from Coloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - one of the best of our 6 weeks in Europe”
Reviews.Author: worldwinelover22
Reviews.Content: Located only 2 (or 3 I can't remember) stops from the main station in Rome - really quick train trip and the metro is just at the end of the street from Re Di Roma. Absolutely spotless hotel...like new..clean..modern....great little bar and sitting area as you walk in..breakfast was awesome it even had little mini nutellas, selection of breads, biscuits in wrapping, ham, cheese, cereal, juice etc etc....the room was spotless with a good sized balcony...spotless bathroom. It was like it was brand new. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, next time I visit Rome we will definitely stay here. Who ever was on reception was always helpful in providing information also. Loved it! Good little restaurants near by too!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Italian hotel, second visit”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Nonna21042
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-located and spotlessly clean hotel. I have stayed there with two of my granddaughters on different trips and found it a very good value. The Metro entrance is just down the street and with a weekly Metro pass you can take the subway and buses nearly anywhere in Rome. The owners/managers are extremely attentive to their guests to ensure they have an enjoyable experience. Additionally there is a fine European breakfast including meat and cheese and the breakfast buffet is kept fully replenished during service. This is the hotel I stay at when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure I would stay again, but nice”
Reviews.Author: secarte2
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel 5 stars. Really, it's not their fault-- while we were there, Rome's metro was undergoing some construction, causing the line that takes you to the Re di Roma metro stop (which is very close to the hotel) to be closed after 9 pm each night. Considering Romans don't even start dinner until 8 pm or later, this made it tough for us to get back. There is a replacement bus route, which we rode one night, but we were sooooo cramped (literally couldn't move or breathe) with the amount of people on the bus I nearly had a panic attack and vowed not to do that again. The hotel itself is really nice and clean, and the staff was friendly. The breakfast was pretty good, though not the best we had. The walls were kind of thin though-- my husband complained of getting woken up by our neighbor watching soccer at 3 a.m. one night. Rome is so big you can't really get a hotel that's close to everything, but this one felt too far from anything. If I had it to do over, I would pay a little more and get something closer to at least a couple of attractions. At least that way if the metro quits on you or something, you can walk back instead of feeling stranded like we did. In a pinch, I would stay again, but I think I would research other options first, and I would definitely check to see what the metro's construction schedule is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Burcusipal
Reviews.Content: We were there in October'10, we chose this hotel with the help of reviews in tripadvisor. It was really a great choise, the hotel was fantastic, very clean and smart and the bathroom was wonderfull :) , the location was perfect and most importantly the staff was very friendly and polite. Metro station is just round the corner, the breakfast was not excellent but better than most of the similar hotels. I will visit Hotel Re Di Roma, if I will have a chance to go Rome again..

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Caco2011
Reviews.Content: Near Re di Roma metro station, good neighborhood, very clean rooms, small breakfast, efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “But the real reason to stay here is....”
Reviews.Author: georgia1
Reviews.Content: All the reviews on here are spot on - the good: friendliest staff EVER, clean, comfortable, near metro, fairly priced, great fast free wifi; and the bad: so so breakfast, not in the heart of Rome, thin floors/ceilings - but the real reason to stay here is its location. Rome is too big to stay near every tourist thing, if your goal is to stay in the heart of Rome you're going to have to choose a "heart" and still do public transport. The Re Di Roma Hotel is not in the heart of Rome but will get you there quickly because of its proximity to the metro. The reason this hotel is most excellent is because it's not in a tourist area! It was by far our favorite hotel during a 3 week trip around Italy. Ask the hotel for restaurant recommendations. Everywhere they sent us was the best food we had in our travels. They were little neighborhood restaurants run by families that couldn't do enough to please us. The folks at these restaurants didn't speak English but we communicated just fine. The prices were so much more reasonable than any of the restaurants we went to near the tourist spots. Also, the shops and bars around the hotel: people don't speak English but can't do enough to help you. It's a neighborhood where the up and comers live so it's safe and there's no riff raff. The staff in the hotel can't help you enough. One night we were going out and the front desk clerk said it looked like rain and gave me an umbrella to borrow. The negatives. You're not going to find a big American breakfast anywhere in Italy that I know of but the continental fair they offer will get you to lunch. So the only negative that's really worthy of mention is the thin ceilings/floors. First of all, don't be a dummy like us. The hallway noise is also an issue but they've provided a second door that blocks it out if you're smart enough to close it (I plead jet lag dumbness-we figured it out our last night). As for the other noise issues, they really weren't a problem. It's not a riff raff kind of hotel. It was international travelers and business men and there wasn't a loud tv or loud talking problem. Just a few footsteps till whoever removed their shoes, a door closing, some water running. I travel with earplugs and didn't have to use them. Unless you are highly sensitive the noise problem will not effect you. Pompi. Don't miss it. It's a dessert restaurant around the corner from the Re Di Roma Hotel. It's closed on Monday and open till 1:30 am other nights. Go there your first night in Rome because you'll want the option of going there every night. I don't like tiramisu but I loved this restaurants'. ps. They have several tiramisu flavors: traditional, strawberry (excellent), pistachio and hazelnut plus lots of other desserts. Note: the Metro is having nighttime construction right now so it closes at 9:30 pm (except Sat night). At every A line metro stop you'll find a bus stop for the M1 or M2 buses. These buses follow the A line metro route so catch one of them to get back to the hotel. Don't forget to purchase your bus ticket in the metro station (same ticket as for the metro) because there isn't one at the bus stop and the bus driver doesn't sell tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Transporter_11
Reviews.Content: Great location, convient to underground, rome and other attractions. Staff is friendly and focused on customers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is everything you need for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: faye_575
Reviews.Content: Location - Hotel is in a good location, 5minute walk to metro station (located at end of road) where you can easily get the train to all major attractions, trains arrive every 3 minutes and the signs within the station state what stop to get off in order to get to each tourist attraction. Could walk to coloseum from hotel in about 30 minutes which is a very pleasant walk, once you reach san giovanni the coloseum is clearly sign posted. Unfortunatly there aren't many restuarants within walking distance of the hotel, but this wasnt a problem for us as we just ate in the area we had visited that day, and made our way home in the evening, usually walk to coloseum and get a taxi from there for a fairly reasonable price. Not many taxi's have heard of the hotel, but all know the square re di roma, which is easy enough to remember considering hotel is of same name, once you get to 'piazza re di roma' you will immediately recognise where you are and be able to take the 3minute walk along the road to the hotel. Before you leave for your trip, i would strongly advise going on the hotel re di roma web site where they give you perfect directions to the hotel using the metro system which could save you some money, think we paid about 14euro each to travel from airport to hotel. Room - No complaints what so ever about the room, was a brilliant size, clean. with a bath and shower in the bathroom and also toiletries shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/hairdrier. therefore dont need to take your own if on tight baggage limit with airline.rooms are cleaned each day and toiletries replaced if required so no worries there. Breakfast - Breakfast is everything you need to set you up for a day sight seeing. composed of, bread rolls, coissants, ham, salami, cheese, fresh fruit, yougurt, selection of jams and spreads on each table, fresh juice, tea and coffee readily available also. Overall i believe re di roma is a perfect base for a sight seeing trip to rome, transport to all major attractions on your door step, clean tidy rooms, which house keeping attend to each day, staff extremely pleasant greeting you each time you enter and leave the hotel. and for the price we paid it offers great value for money and everything you could want/need from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, clean & comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: melodyrose34
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Re di Roma - and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The room and bathroom were immaculately clean - sheets and towels changed everyday if required. The reception and kitchen staff were all helpful & friendly. Buffet breakfast was provided with toast, croissants, ham, cheese, yoghurts etc - very fresh and well stocked every morning. The noise does travel easily between rooms - not ideal for light sleepers, but a full day walking around Rome is enough to make anyone tired, so we managed to sleep! A great location from which to explore Rome - the Metro is very close, and there are several good restaurants nearby (ask at reception). We would recommend this hotel highly - and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New and Clean hotel with perfect staff...”
Reviews.Author: acece
Reviews.Content: It was really a nice experience to stay in this new and very clean hotel. Location was not so close to rome attractives but not far. The metro is in 2 minutes walking distance, superb! Or you can get in a taxi to reach the center that costs only 8-12 euros. The only bad thing I can say is the breakfast was poor for a Turkish :( Perhaps it is not important for europeans, but Turks like a riiiiich breakfast with many types of cheease, tomatoes, olives, honey, fruits, etc :)

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning!!! Need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: rockgoddess309
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Re di Roma due mainly to the great reviews here on Trip Advisor, along with the lower cost. We were very pleased with our stay! First of all, Re di Roma is in southern Rome, just a few subway stops away from the main Termini. We found it to be a pleasant location, with some of the best pizza around! The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, with the normal fare, such as croissants, ham, salami, cheese, rolls, etc. Our Rome was on the 3rd floor I believe, and was quite spacious. It has a modern feel to it, which we liked. Although the bathroom shower is small (as with most in Italy), it was manageable. To our pleasant surprise, we had actual Air Conditioning, which was uncommon in even fancier hotels. They also have free WiFi in the rooms. No complaints! I would highly recommend to others, and will stay again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel, close to Metro, staff is helpful”
Reviews.Author: VPraj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside of the really touristy area, but it is very close to a metro stop. There are some local resteraunts that are decent, but its better to take the metro into the center and get food and go out there. You will most likely need to cab it back, cause for the next 6mo there is construction on Line A of the metro, it only runs until 9pm :( Hotel itself is ok, strange blanket situation. The room is small and the temperature control is difficult, it is hot in the room, turn on the AC, gets cold, just needs time to stabilize.... ac blows in your face, rest of the room is hot... Breakfast is decent, fruit not that great. Staff very helpful and speak English well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and good location Rome”
Reviews.Author: potstickerman
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in very good location only 1/2 block from metro stop, making it an excellent location for getting to major tour area in Rome. Functional breakfast included. Smallish room, but clean and probably typical for innercity Rome. Very reasonable price. Restaurants about 10 minute walk. The area seemed safe in the evening for walking to restaurants. Wifi was very reliable and one free computer (that was usually in use) near the lobby. Would recommend the hotel as an excellent site for exploring the city at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: bishdish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was not at all disappointed. Rooms: clean, modern, everything you need to have a very comfortable stay. (flat screen tv, fridge with bar, closet, desk area, lots of shelving for luggage and bathroom had shower, bidet and heated towels. The lights were a little hard to figure out and the shower had a minor issue with drainage, but by all means, these were not issues for us. There's another door inside the room to add to blocking out noise from the hallway. Street: Yes it's laiden with graffiti and it initially does feel a little unsafe. However, it really is a fine area and shops and restaurants are only a couple blocks away. Piazza Re de Roma is very close and is a nice place to sit and eat gelato and people watch. We walked to the Colloseum which was a 20-25 minute moderate walk. There was a lot to see on the way. Hotel Staff speak english well and are happy to help with anything you need. Fantastic breakfast complete with cereals, coissants, coffee, yogurt, buns with cold cuts and cheese, and plenty of choices of fruit. This was no 'cafeteria' style breakfast buffet. Tables were beautifully set, with condiments and spreads and proper linens. Breakfast in a hotel has never been this good! There is an elevator, bar and computer to use for the internet on site. Very happy with our stay considering the fantastic price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Reccomend Hotel Re di Roma”
Reviews.Author: cherriesfan_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Re di Roma for our silver wedding anniversary following a reccomendation from a work colleague. I stay away on business in the UK and Europe on a weekly basis and this is one of the nicest boutique hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were large and clean with modern fittings. The bathroom was as good as any you would find in a four or five star in the UK. The location is not in the heart of the city, but neither is it noisy or the local restaurants and shops expensive like they are in the city centre. The train from the airport is only a short walk away and the metro is only a 2 minute walk away, and for 1 Euro you can get to most of the sights within 4-5 stops. Although streetwise, we were not Metro wise, and my wife had her purse stolen. The manager of the hotel, kindly telephoned the police on our behalf, and walked us to the police staiton, where in interpeted our statement to them. On hearing it was our silver wedding anniversary he even left a bottle of Chianti in our room when we returned later in the evening. How many hotel managers have ever done this to any one of you reading this report., I know in the UK, the staff would just shrug their shoulders and say hard luck but it's not my problem. For those visitors from Texas and elsewhere who have written poor comments on this site, I would say everything you found fault with I could not praise enough. The food, the service, the location and the price were all excellent. We will certainly reccomend this hotel to any traveller in the future, whether on business or pleasue. Thank you everyone at the hotel. Paul Keeley, Bournemouth, England.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Judge a Hotel by its Street!”
Reviews.Author: ross2011
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel we were somewhat anxious as all the buildings in the Street were graffitied. The only exception being the Hotel. This nervousness soon abated as we became familiar with our surrounds and could not fault the location. The Hotel is warm and comfortable with daily room service, excellent buffet breakfast. WiFi is avail. Staff are friendly and helpful with sight seeing and local dining knowledge. The nearby Piazza has a gem of a pizza shop (re di Roma) and a supermarket next door. Metro just at the end of the street and walking distance (25min) to the Coloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome! Hard to beat!”
Reviews.Author: P_and_H4550
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay here. Having read a quite damning review we were a little anxious. How unjustified! The hotel is spotlessly clean, usual bathroom provisions, programmable safe in the room and no charge to use it. City Tax payable at 2 euro per day per person at the end of your stay (this applies to all hotels in Rome). Yes there is some graffiti on walls around the hotel but non on the hotel itself as the staff make every effort to keep it that way. All staff very helpful indeed.Breakfast continental good choice of croissant, bread meat and cheese, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, tea (English and fruit) coffee etc. Small store across the road for essentials. Metro is 200yds (1 euro - use within 75 minutes) and runs literally every 2 mins. Colosseum is 25 minutes walk if you'd rather take the scenic route. We felt very safe returning to the hotel even after dark. One evening we took Pizza purchased from a near by cafe back to our room and ate this on the balcony with a lovely bottle of Chianti as we were a little weary following an early start! Perfect! We would certainly recommend this hotel as an ideal base from which to explore and experience Rome as it is just far enough away from the noise and hustle of the centre but close enough to feel instantly part of it. On our last day the hotel kept our luggage safe for us and booked a taxi for our return to the airport as we had an evening flight. Taking into account the cost of this hotel compared with more centrally located hotels (which cost nearly double) there is no contest. This has to be the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “So sleek and posh ,yet affordable!”
Reviews.Author: fauxmaven
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel-super clean ,and all the chrome accents sparkled ! Breakfast was on time every day (set up ) and our last day they were ready at 6 am ,because they knew we had an early flight !! There was some street noise ,and at midnite before April 1 ,we awoke because there was a ton of screaming and yelling .We didn't know if this was because of the transportation strike ,or celebrating for Apr .! It was a bit scary.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a good location, food and service, avoid Hotel Re di Roma like the bubonic plague.”
Reviews.Author: liz77006
Reviews.Content: This hotel was most disappointing. Only one cab driver during our 3 day visit knew where this hotel was located! It is a terrible location for a tourist, and located on a scary street with grafitti on all of the buildings and not near ANYTHING. There are no nice restaurants within walking distance. Two of the desk staff were helpful--however the rest could not have cared less--very sullen really. The food served breakfast was not fresh--croissants out of a huge plastic bag were 'dumpled' into bowls. The Wi-fi in the room was broken and no one bothered to help us remedy this situation. If comfort and service are desired, please do NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really useful location, good value. Does a great job of getting the basics right.”
Reviews.Author: PhilCrookUK
Reviews.Content: The location is the best bit - walking distance to the Colloseum and spitting distance from a Metro stop to get you about the city. Breakfast is nice without being excellent, whilst the staff all seem friendly and were happy for us to leave our bags during our last day as we had an evening flight. For anyone going to Rome, not expecting to spend too much time in the hotel and rather using it as a base, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, room, balcony, staff and area”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmark
Reviews.Content: got this one for €406 for 4 nights which was excellent value in an expensive city. at first the graffiti around the area is off-putting but then you soon realise graffiti is a big problem everywhere in rome. it is a decent area and very handy to everywhere of major interest in rome. the metro stop is only 5 mins walk. we got a room with a balcony (407) and the balcony is huge - wraps round both sides of the room. the room was large and comfortable, free internet, staff helpful, plain but good breakfast. deli across the road and down to your right is good and again staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel for a good price, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: daveh104
Reviews.Content: We normally prefer a hotel closer to the heart of the city and were unsure of being a little further away, but the close metro and main line stations made the hotel well located and accessible. Trains from the airport to Tuscolana Station are frequent and dont take long the hotel is then a short walk (but have a map with you, we got lost), A metro station is 2 mintues down the road and its only a few stops into the centre of Rome. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful, doing all they could to make our visit to Rome comfortable. The rooms are a good size and the beds are comfortable. Breakfast could have been better but it was more than adequate. The coffee for breakfast really is pretty horrible but maybe its just not what I am used to. The previous post to this, just before our stay, made us ask ourselves whether we made a bad choice but we were wrong. Lovely hotel, we did not get bitten and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: hozae
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay in Hotel Re di Roma and like the title says, I have no complaints whatsoever. The hotel is kept really clean, which was obviously really important to my fiance and I. I didn't get any shots of the bathroom, but that was clean as well. The breakfast, which is included, is good enough before a day of sightseeing. You should definitely take advantage of it. They served cereal, crossaints, rolls, cheese, salami, ham, yogurt.....things like that. I'm not sure what the prices are like during tourist season, but I paid 315 USD for a 3 night stay.....breakfast and internet access included, which I think is a good deal. We booked a double standard room which isn't really that big, but it's definitely good enough. If you plan on being in Rome for 3 or 4 nights you're not going to spend much time in your room, so who cares? Cleanliness is what matters. As far as the location goes I found it to be ideal for what our plans were. It's definitely not in the city center, but the train is about 2 or 3 blocks away and you can be at some of the major attractions in no time. If anyone has any questions feel free to send me a message. I'd be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Phenomenal Staff!”
Reviews.Author: cesp85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Re Di Roma for 7 nights from February 5 to 12, and it was an absolutely amazing stay! Our flight arrived very early in the morning so we got to the hotel at 9 am.
