Although it was much too early for check-in, the reception staff said that it was okay and checked immediately if our room was ready. Because we were staying for a longer amount of time, they had a specific room for us, so it wasn't quite ready yet. However, the staff asked us to enjoy the buffet breakfast in the meantime, which was great! She was very accommodating! When our room was ready, the reception staff took us to our room and showed us around so that we were aware of how everything worked. Our room was great! It was a lot more spacious than what I had expected. Everything was very clean as well. We had a corner room (307) and we had a great wrap-around balcony! Our bathroom also had a tub, which was nice. Our room was also always constantly cleaned exceptionally well on a daily basis! In fact, we were shocked at how much attention the cleaning staff paid to cleaning the rooms and bathrooms... they never missed a spot! The reception staff was AMAZING!! At night, we liked to have hot water and the reception staff was always very courteous and got us hot water. One night the reception staff was busy with guests checking in so she actually came upstairs to our room with the hot water when she was done checking them in! We also left our voltage converter at home and the staff lent us one to use all week! On top of all of that, they booked us on our tours and airport transfer service -- never a disappointment. When we wanted recommendations for places to eat around the area, the staff even printed out a map and directions for us to follow. We have never experienced such courteous staff! They definitely made our stay top-notch! Although the hotel is not a walk away from all of the sites to see in Rome, it was only a block away from the Metro station (Re Di Roma stop). It took 2 minutes to walk to and from the station, and from there you could get off at any stop that allowed you to see everything! Also 2 minutes away was Piazza Re Di Roma where there were shops, a grocery store (great for us because we bought snacks - chips, chocolate, gelato, water - for great prices), and several pizzerias. We went to Pizza Re Di Roma almost daily because the pizza was delicious, the staff was friendly, and they had these deep-fried battered potatoes that sound unhealthy, but were excellent! The buffet breakfast was good as well. They usually had toast, croissants, fruit, yogurt, cheese, deli meats, and cereal. They had an assortment of teas, which was fantastic as well. And, they constantly refilled the food, even past 10 am! The walls in the hotel are a little thin, but we didn't really mind it. It really wasn't an issue for us during our stay. Besides, after full days of roaming around Rome, we were usually too tired and slept wonderfully anyway. If this is something you'd be concerned with, I don't think it should stop you from staying here; I'd just bring ear plugs (if you'd even need them). The decor of the hotel was nice. It's a modern-looking hotel, very simplistic, which we liked. The safe in the room was also great to have. We had such a great stay at Hotel Re Di Roma and would definitely stay there again! Thank you to the amazing reception and cleaning staff for contributing to making our time in Rome a phenomenal one!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little hotel, good location,excellent service + best tiramisu shop in Rome around the corner”
Reviews.Author: bear807
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend, although this hotel is a little bit small in terms of the entrance hall and other facilities but rooms are ok. When you first reach by metro you will be a little bit confuse in the re di roma circle, simply turn on your iphone compass and go to east! You will also not able to notice when you reach the hotel is red in colour windows frame and door. Service i would say excellent! Staff are very great & helpful. When first arrived they show me the room and other facilities. I stayed in the first floor and the wireless router happen to have some problems, so i went down and ask for help. Great staff eventually give me a LAN cable and came to my room and make sure everything is fine before he leave! Like other reviews have said walls are quite thin, i do experenice this as well especially in early morning, but than is alright anyway im gonna wake up soon. Breakfast hall can be very crowded at times especially after 9am, so beat the crowd go and have your breakfast at 8:45am. Another bonus of this location beside near to the metro is it is close to one of the best Tiramisu shop in Rome called the POMPI! Please please please for heaven sake pay a visit to the shop, i 100% gurantee you will never regret it! Open very early in the morning and close as late as 1:30am. It can get very crowded in day time, you will find 90% locals in there, As the italians highly recommend their tiramisu, so this is a must try get all dfferent favours, gelato and sandwitches are fair price and quite good too!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Hotel in Roma - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LimaGonzalez
Reviews.Content: Located near to Metro station, friendly staff and excelent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: Mina8600
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both really enjoyed our stay at the Re di Roma. It was a bit out of the way, but with a metro station just a short distance down the road, it wasn't a hassle at all to get to the city centre. The rooms were comfortable and nicely furnished. There was a computer with free internet access, which was convenient. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that I will definitely stay again if I go to Rome”
Reviews.Author: bennysilver
Reviews.Content: In a quiet area but few minutes walk for the metro station, and few metro stops for centre. A very high quality hotel for inexpensive room prices. Stayed there for only 2 nights but would definitely stay again if I had to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, walls a bit thin.”
Reviews.Author: GizmoCairo
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and friendly. Room was clean and had a balcony, bathroom, safe, minibar, hairdrier and reasonable toiletries. Storage was limited, no drawers at all for undies etc.but hanging space was OK. Good satellite TV (Sky Italia) with PPV on other things like sport, movies and adult. Free wifi was easy to access and quick enough to stream video. AC was effective and quite quiet. Only downside was the poor sound insulation between rooms; we could hear everything from the adjoining rooms! Breakfast was a basic continental selection of cereal, pastries, cheese, cold meat, yoghourt and fruit which was constantly replenished, even when the advertised time for breakfast had elapsed. Extra nice touches were a gift wrapped bar of chocolate each, extended breakfast hours and late checkout, all on New Year's Day. The hotel is very close to the A line metro and within easy walking of many of the sites of Rome. A great place to stay if you are looking for a tourist base.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: mariusb
Reviews.Content: a very good choice in otherwise overated city!! quiet location, close to metro and downtown, clean and good sized rooms, friendly staff - all in one a very pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base To Stay for Brilliant Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: travelsphinx
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find!!! Booked after recommendations of this site and was not disappointed-excellent location for getting about Rome (although if you want to stay in the heart of central Rome this is not for you!!). Very friendly staff, clean rooms, breakfast provided (as others have said basic-put plenty!) We travelled from FCO Airport to Tuscolana Stazione (around 8 stops-roughly 30min journey) (PS make sure you get your ticket stamped before getting on the train!!), then walked to Re Di Roma (around 10mins at walking pace). We stayed 4 nights and used the metro system without any problem. bought a 'day ticket' each day for 4 euro and let you have unlimited travel-very useful for sightseeing. Re di Roma metro stop is around a 2-3min walk from the Hotel-Excellent! Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will be using again if lucky enough to travel to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Love thy neighbour?”
Reviews.Author: KevinJ57
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, room, and staff, but as other reviewers have said a lot depends on who your neighbours are. Buffet breakfast enough to get you up and running, with fruit on offer now. Had planned to get the express train from Rome da Vinci to Termini but were approached by a man offering a minibus ride direct to the hotel for €30 for both of us, (included Italian driving experience). Was at hotel door within half an hour, saved a lot of hassle trying to find hotel after getting off train Got train back out to Airport for return flight cost €28 and a lot of suitcase hauling.Very reasonably priced Chinese restaurant on street parallel to Via Verchelli, but make sure you ask for your rice or noodles to come with your meat/poultry dish otherwise you get them separately.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ri de Roma.”
Reviews.Author: melodymcgrath
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and it was fabulous. The hotel reception was manned 24 hrs per day and the staff were really helpful with suggestions for places to eat that were nearby. I must say that eating out was quite expensive and very disappointing. The hotel room was beautiful, the bathroom gorgeous and breakfast was the usual buffet breakfast but it was adequate, although, there could be fresh fruit added to the buffet. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definately use this hotel again. It was really easy to get to the hotel using public transport you get the bus outside of the airport to the metro, you do not go to Termini, get the other bus, sorry I can't remember the number. You then take the metro to Rea di Roma and the street that the hote is on, Via Vercelli 21, is just as you come up off the metro. The hotel is down at the bottom of the street on the left there isn't a big sign giving the hotel name look for the building with the red writing on the name plate. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - thin walls”
Reviews.Author: carrafan
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in this hotel and were very impressed with the staff and cleanliness of the room / hotel. The only downfall withthis hotel is that the room walls were very thin and you could hear almost everything that your neighbour does. We were very lucky to have neighbours who were relatively quiet but it would be a nightmare if you had a neighbour who wasn't respectful and wanted to be loud as you would hear all and you won't be able to sleep. The room is very pretty but the wooden floor doesn't help as it doesn't muffle any of the sound from upstairs. The breakfast was nice and stocked up when the food ran down. Good location near to the Re Di Roma metro station and only five / ten minutes from central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: slidhome
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at the Re di Roma for 4 days in early October based on cost, high rating on Tripadvisor, and the reviews. I was not disappointed. Location is a 3 minute walk from the Re di Roma metro. Staff very friendly. Establishment is clean and well-maintained. Room was clean, comfortable, spacious (we had the two double-beds room). Air conditioner worked great, bathroom spacious and good hot water. Free breakfast had a good selection of basics (bread, cereal, pastries, yogurt, etc...). If you are expecting eggs, bacon, etc...you won't find it (I was not). Obviously this hotel is not in the city center so I could not rate the location a 5, but the metro gets you to the center in a matter of minutes. What I also liked about this hotel is that just up the street off the Piazza del Re di Roma, where the metro is located, is a great deal of shopping and eateries. One street over is the Via Nuova, a very long, busy street with tons of shopping, eateries, bakeries, a grocery store, and lots more. And what makes walking up and down the Via Nuova even better is that it is all locals, no tourists. You won't pay tourist prices for food and it has a non-touristy genuine feel. If you are looking to save some money by not staying at top-dollar hotels in the city center near tourist attractions, this hotel is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a few things beyond their control”
Reviews.Author: Airwaysmotel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in November 2010. We walked past the hotel about 3 times before finally finding it as there are no distinct signed indicating its existence! The room was a great size, breakfast was good, location was good (being very near the metro) and the staff were very helpful. The only thing out of our (and the hotel's) control was the people on the other side of our wall which we could hear through in the evening...along with a young child who was, as most young children are, rather noisy and screaming on occasion...avoid room 208 if you can. It appears the hotel backs on a residential apartment building so there is nothing the staff can do, aside from giving you another room. Fortunately, we travel with earplugs so we could easily blot out the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between average and poor”
Reviews.Author: cdotarmstrong
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for leisure with my partner in September 2010. Based on the very positive feedback on Tripadvisor I booked to stay at Hotel Re di Roma for 6 nights. The location is excellent - in a quiet residential street 5 mins walk from the Re di Roma Metro stop. Using the Metro you can get to all the main attractions in the city. The reception staff were not overly welcoming and our arrival in the hotel was disappointing. The lobby interior is modern but basic and looks as though it could do with a little TLC. On arrival we headed straight to the bar for a much needed drink but the bar was very disappointing with just a couple of spirits and beer. The room was dark and in a corner of the hotel. The interior was new and clean, the bathroom was particularly nice looking although we later discovered the shower ran all over he floor. The beds were extremely hard which involved waking up a couple of times each night as it was so uncomfortable. Breakfast is average at best with a very basic continental style. I found the value for money less than average, I paid 175 EUR per night for 6 nights. I heard that September and October are the busiest months to travel to Rome so this may be the most expensive time to book a room at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for the location and the cleanliness but I would not be going back there myself. I would not go as far as saying this hotel is poor but it certainly less than average.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cozy”
Reviews.Author: roquemarina
Reviews.Content: Especially friendly and helpful the staff. Our room was very clean and well kept. The staff work greatly and attentive, helped us with smile, nice touch. The bathroom was clean and spacious. nice hotel to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Liz W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my two best friends for 4 nights this week. We had a triple room with 3 single beds, a good sized bathroom with powerful shower and a balcony which was an added bonus. The room was very clean and the maid was in everyday providing clean towels etc. Breakfast was an added bonus with lots to choose from ranging from rolls, toast, cereal, croissants etc. The metro is at the end of the road and it is so easy and cheap to use - 11 euros for a 3 day ticket and you are transported to all the top tourist attractions.We hopped on and off all day and always felt safe. It is a 10 minute walk to the train station to take you back to Leonardo da Vinci airport for only 8 euros. We did find the walls a bit thin and one night some very loud italians came in at about 2am making lots of noise which wasn't great but on the whole we have no complaints and highly recommend this hotel. True it isn't in the centre of things but that is reflected in the price. The only thing we would say is, Come on Reception staff, SMILE!!

Reviews.Title: “great place, good value”
Reviews.Author: las631
Reviews.Content: August in Rome is pricey and this was a great quality place at a good price. Near the subway and walking distance to shopping, restaurants, historic sites. Nestled in a residential neighborhood, lots to see from the balcony (not an impressive view, but interesting). Hotel quality was very high, and I'm fussy. Warning: room was small. Great continental breakfast. Access to a computer for site locations. Nice amenities. Very new and youthful. I'D GO BACK IN A MINUTE!

Reviews.Title: “3-star boutique-style hotel that punches above its weight”
Reviews.Author: burukku16
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Hotel Re di Roma in October 2010. The hotel has been recently refurbished and has the feel of a boutique hotel. Our room exceeded expectations - the bedroom and bathroom were both spacious and very clean. There were hardwood floors in the rooms, an enormous bed (two twins pushed together - which is very common in Italy), wardrobe, small desk, window seat and TV with Sky box. We were also fortunate enough to have a room at the end of the hall which included a large balcony with table and chairs. We both slept very well and, thanks to double doors in the entrance of our room and double-glazed windows, didn't hear any noise from the street, neighbours or other rooms. The shower was hot and powerful, and for those of you who like your bathrooms Continental-style, there was also a bidet. Breakfast is included at the hotel. It was a decent, buffet-style affair served until 10am (great for those who want a little extra sleep). It included meat cold cuts and cheese, rolls, croissants, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, fruit juices, tea and coffee. It was just enough to kick start the day. We found all the hotel staff to be incredibly helpful and kind. They recommended a nearby restaurant for dinner one night (La Foglietta) which was excellent, and happily answered all our questions about getting around Rome. The only slight downside of Hotel Re di Roma is its location. We loved it and managed to plan our days around it so that we also started and/or ended near a Metro station for easy access to the hotel (which is a two-minute walk from Re di Roma Metro station). However, for those who want to be in the city centre and in the thick of it, this is not the place for you. It's more of a quiet oasis away from the hordes of tourists in the centre. We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Re di Roma and would very highly recommend it to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CKKUPSTYLES
Reviews.Content: Rome was our very first stop for me and my husband's 2 month Europe Honeymoon and this was a great hotel to quick start the honeymoon. The location of the hotel was great, it wasnt in the main area but was very very close to the metro which we took all the time to get to the main areas such as the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. This was lovely because we were close to the locals and not so much tourists. The room itself was very modern and clean we absolutely enjoyed our room and was very comfortable. I would def reccommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great location, value for money and for a comfortable stay. They also served us breakfast everyday which was lovely!! Couldnt get enough of their nutella. Overall lovely hotel and would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaL
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights and were very satisfied. The rooms were large, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was very good including cereal, breads, yoghurt, fruit, juice and coffee. The manager and staff were very helpful in answering questions regarding transportation and other information. The metro was only about a block away. If we returned to Rome, we would certainly stay at Re di Roma again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- close to everything and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Zempo
Reviews.Content: Re di Roma was the highlight of our trip to Italy! The room was extremely clean, spacious, very well appointed and had a terrific wrap around balcony. The staff was very helpful- especially Georgio who recommended some of the best tiramisu at Pompi around the corner from the hotel. Highly recommended. I would encourage Trip Advisor to take Re di Roma off of their B&B listing, as Re di Roma is a terrific hotel just misclassified as a bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liketotraveltoronto
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - just off one of the subway in a clean and safe part of town. it was on the metro line that you use to get to all the major tourist locations. The rooms were clean and modern, Breakfast was nice, free internet. Helpful staff. We couldn't believe the value for the kind of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funnyman64
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Re Di Roma in September 2010, based on a recommendation from a friend. The hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly. We had advised we were arriving early in the day (well before check in) and asked if our bags could be stored. When we arrived, our room was ready for us. The hotel is well appointed, rooms are clean and modern. Breakfast is included with a wide selection. While it is situated a little further from the major sights, it is still walkable (about 20 minutes to the coliseum) but also located very close (about 150 m) from the metro station. I would definitely stay again. One note, if you need a cab to the termini train station, ask what the route will be first. The hotel called me a taxi, and although the price was very close to what the hotel clerk had told me, I am certain that we took the scenic route.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, friendly and happy to assist in many ways”
Reviews.Author: shazcan
Reviews.Content: Situated a little out of the centre it helped to have the metro close. Not the poshest part of Rome but safe and surpisingly quiet. Immaculate hotel with helpful staff who were eager to please and made us welcome. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient modern boutique hotel 1 block from the subway”
Reviews.Author: Hadriandave
Reviews.Content: A very modern little hotel in a residential neighborhood 1 block from Re di Roma subway station on the A Line. 4 stops to Termini, 10 stops to the Vatican. The front desk staff spoke great English and were always very helpful. The rooms were new looking and very contemporary. There was a dining area where the included continental self-service breakfast was laid out. There was also a little lounge next to the front desk but it was always empty. There was an elevator. When you arrive at the hotel the first time you may be taken aback, as we were. There was no sign for the hotel. The entrance was a bright red door which became our 'signpost' thereafter. From the outside you would never know there was a hotel in there. But it was a wonderful little hotel and I highly recommend it. We stayed here for 3 nights in June.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location near Metro”
Reviews.Author: zlw31
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Re di Roma following the good reviews it had on Tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. The Hotel is approx 200m from Re di Roma Metro stop on the Red Line making it nice and easy to get around the City. We stayed in room 404 which looked out onto the main road. The windows are sound proofed and we did not hear any noise from outside. The room was really clean and modern and had everything that you would need - fridge, safe, wardrobe, desk, air con, sky tv (although not many english speaking channels), reading lights and comfortable beds!!! The bathroom wasn't huge but it was perfectly formed. The only downside was that although the shower was lovely and powerful but it was really small. Breakfast was self service and had all the usual continental stuff - cereal, fresh fruit, pastries, bread, cheese, ham, yogurt and juice. There is a coffee machine but you can also ask the waiting staff to get a fresh coffee for you. The breakfast room is small for the size of the hotel so be prepared to share a table with fellow travellers. The desk staff were very helpful and knowledgeable with regards to attractions and transport. Nothing seemed to be too difficult - they are definately there to help. Now, this place isn't too good to be true as there is one downfall and that is that the walls are quite thin in the rooms. We could hear conversations of people in the next room as clear as day and although they weren't the quietest of guests I do think that we probably would still hear mumblings if they spoke quieter. This shouldn't put you off too much as most nights we were so tired that we slept for England although we did get woken up earlier than we would have liked due to our noisy neighbours. Yes, we could have asked to move rooms but we were happy where we were and it didn't bother us enough to mention it to the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Beware The Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: magnic
Reviews.Content: Modern and clean but they really need to do something about the thin walls. We were woken at 4am and could literally hear the conversation by our next door neighbours and other 'strange' sounds. This is our second stay here so we can only guess that all rooms must be the same so expect to be disturbed. Don't expect much from the bar as the selection was very limited. It is in a residential area so views could be better but the area itself wasn't a problem. Its about a 20-30 minute walk to some of the main attractions. Breakfast is typical buffet style. Has a lift to all floors. Overall it's clean and no major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Bristlehound
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night/5 day trip here. We booked this on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor and weren’t disappointed. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel. This was 40 euro’s. Apparently the fee has been set by the local government from the airport to anywhere in the city, no matter how long - 40 euro’s. The hotel is quite difficult to find if you don’t get a taxi as it has no sign outside and is in a residential street. Our room number was 403. This was on the fourth floor, top left hand corner looking from the front. The room was compact. Double bed, flat screen Tv on the wall, wardrobe, free digital safe in the wardrobe, table and chair. The room had air con which you could adjust the level yourself and was an absolute god send as the temp. were in the low 30’s! Double French doors lead onto a balcony which stretched from the side right round the front. Two chairs and a table outside to have a wine at. Bathroom was very clean. With the usual shampoo’s etc. Shower water pressure very good and plenty of hot water. The hotel changed the towels everyday. The mattresses on the beds are memory foam type. Both my wife and I found these very comfortable but some may find them a bit hard. There was a small bar area where you had free use of a PC with internet access. Just ask at reception for a password. Great for booking your Vatican tickets. Just use the hotels email address and they will print your tickets out. The breakfast area was spotless. Breakfast consisted of fruit juices, tea, coffee, cereals croissants, rolls etc. Basically a continental breakfast. Certainly enough to set you up for the day and ALWAYS fresh and plentiful supplies of produce. The lady who runs it was brilliant. The reception staff were some of the most helpful Hotel staff I have ever come across. Many thanks. There is a supermarket in the square, Punto, quite cheap all the locals use it. The cash machine is also in the square, 2nd turn off in the square. We also found a local coffee shop, Pompei, (also 2nd left turn off) which served great coffee’s and there specialty was tiramisu! Yummy! 3.60 euro’s for 2 coffee’s! On the evening all the locals come out into the Re Di Roma square for an ice cream. Old and young alike, just shooting the breeze and eating ice cream, wonderful! You can see the Metro station from the front of the hotel. Quick, easy and cheap access to Rome. If you use one of the maps that reception provides, the Colosseum is a 20 minute walk away. We found the area very safe and did not feel intimidated at all. The only downside. No decent restaurants nearby. We would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel for a stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kbaesch1
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Would stay again! Very comfortable - staff eager to please. Not directly in city center (which I think is nice - surrounded by more locals); however, the hotel is steps from metro which can get you anywhere in the city fast for cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend-nice clean hotel,good location,great value!”
Reviews.Author: champkis
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed here for 5 nights in august. The hotel is modern and clean and the staff were extremely friendly. The hotel was quite full while we were there so the breakfast room was fairly packed but it was ok. Breakfast was a decent selection of yoghurts, bread, croissants, fruit and tea/coffee etc. There is free internet available in the hotel which is very handy. The location of the hotel is very good- 2 minute walk to Re Di Roma metro station. Coming from the Fiumicino airport, we got the train (not the da vinci express) to Tuscolona statoion which was €8 one way and we walked from there- the hotel website gives good directions. The outside of the hotel is a little unassuming as there was no sign with the hotel name so keep an eye out for it!! Overall, this is a great value nice clean modern hotel in a great location with friendly staff, decent breakfast and free internet! I would definitely recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel ,Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: kentri
Reviews.Content: Yes it's not in the center of Rome but that worked well for us.It was good to get away from the hustle and bustle.A three minute walk from the hotel and you were waiting for the Metro. The staff was very friendly and ready to answer any questions you have.The breakfast was fine with an assortment of fruits,breads, beverages,cold cuts and cereals .Ask one of the ladies there if you want cappuccino.The room was cleaned everyday with clean sheets and towels.There is a great Chinese restaurant around the corner .Along with many other restaurants and stores . I will stay here again when I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Polly050
Reviews.Content: Just back form holidays in Italy, which included 2 nights in Rome. I booked the Hotel Re di Roma, as I already knew that part of Rome very well. ideal location, quite and only a few metro stops from the city center (no expensive car park to pay!!!) The hotel offers a great value for money, the staff is excellent, the serv ice perfect. The rooms are modern and very well equiped. We got a very nice room with a big balcony. We couldn't ask for more for our stopover in Rome. and we certainly recommend this hotel to travellers who are looking for the a very good value for money in Rome. We will go back to Re di Roma as soon as possible!!!!! PR - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Gooders1969
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome and stayed in a 5* hotel on our honeymoon 5 years ago, I was expecting the Re Di Roma to be functional and reasonably comfortable. It surpassed my expectations. I was a little disappointed when I saw the exterior, very unassuming at best. However the location was ideal, quiet side street 5 mins walk from the tube. Rooms were large with a sliding partition which mean we could sleep seperately from our young child (and get a good night's sleep!). Breakfast wasn't outstanding but as good as any "business hotel" or large chain I've stayed in before on the continent. Staff were helpful and the free wi-fi really helped as we were able to download maps etc before a day's sightseeing. All in all, excellent value for money. Not 5* but worth every penny we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & superb location”
Reviews.Author: littlesthobo79Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Re di Roma in August after reading the reviews, and we were not disappointed! The hotel is fairly new and all of the rooms are tastefully decorated with all the ameneties that we expected. The staff were very helpful and even held our bag for 3 days while we took a trip to Sorrento. The continental breakfast was good, the dining area was clean and tidy and the food was lovely and fresh. The location is excellent and a 5 minute walk will take you to the Re di Roma tube stop which for 4Eur you can buy a day pass to use on the metro as well. I thought that the room was a bargain for £60 per night and I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bru_5
Reviews.Content: I spent one day/night in this charming and comfortable hotel. The single room with a big double bed room on the last floor and a nice terrace was excellent. The hotel provides you with every confort and accessories in your room and of course the internet connection. Also, on the ground floor you find a lovely lounge room with the bar where to sip good drinks and relax. I really loved the furnitures and the design choosen for this splendid hotel that is also just 5 mins walking from the metro stop, and only about 4 metro stops to the city centre and the train station. Strategic! The staff and the owner are extremely kind and caring. What else? I higly reccomend it for your journey in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: nbologne
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent. There is a metro stop a block away, you can take the metro to any attraction you need cheaply and easily (someone mentioned it is a bit of a walk, but how much closer can you get than 190m?!). Another reviewer commented that they felt the neighborhood was a little unsafe, I guess it depends on what you’re used to, but I found the neighborhood extremely safe and didn’t have any worries at all, and I’m a petite woman. Room/amenities: Modern decor, satellite TV, spacious bathroom for European standards, clean, good breakfast Eating suggestions : cannot remember the names, but there is a gelato shop nearby that is open late that serves the best gelato I’ve had in all my travels, and there’s also place that sells pizza to go by weight (they’re both near the roundabout) Overall: I would definitely stay here again, it much less expensive than the other hotels closer to the attractions (didn’t matter with the metro stop so close by), the rooms were great, and I found there were good eating options nearby since it’s in a more residential area and therefore doesn’t cater to tourists. Front desk staff was always very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Couple_from_Cypress
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. The staff are friendly. Although a bit far from the metro but wouldn't mind if you like walking. Breakfast was plentiful and very good and its included in the price!!! We will be back again to this hotel next time we come to Rome, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, clost to a metro station but street doesn't feel to safe”
Reviews.Author: bhuchar
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, looked new! Location is close to a metro station, though the street feels slightly uncomfortable to walk on at night. No incidents happened and we didn't see any rowdy characters. But the street is not well lit and felt a bit unsafe. The front desk was pretty helpful. Wi-fi was free but connectivity was a bit troublesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful city, amazing holiday”
Reviews.Author: mhobbsy
Reviews.Content: I only had a short break at the hotel, however the facilities were excellent, especially liked free wifi in room. All looked very new, perfectly clean, with mini bar, fridge, cupboards, LCD tv & fridge. Breakfast was nice, continental as expected but a lovely start to the day. This was a lovely hotel with lots of amenities close to the Metro & easy to get to the main attractions. Lastly the staff really were amazing, so friendly & helpful & more than willin to help with local questions or any queries. I would more than recommend this hotel Romans friends & family. I am looking forward to going back there in the not too distant future for another short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Inexpensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsGME
Reviews.Content: This was a good find..the price was right! There is nothing fancy about the hotel. It is small, but clean and a good base and in a good location for using the train to get around the city. The breakfast that is included is basic but sufficient. This was my first time traveling in Europe so I wasn't prepared for the lack of washcloths. If this is an issue for you, bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to enjoy all that Rome has to offer”
Reviews.Author: PaulGlobal16
Reviews.Content: For those first timers to Rome (like us), this was a good choice as a home base. We stayed 3 nights at the Re di Roma. The hotel was very clean, modern (contemporary design), and the service was always very helpful (I had a lost luggage with the airlines and the front desk made the calls for me to track the baggage and keep tabs on its arrival). The breakfast was solid, nice croissants, cappucino machine, cereals, cold cuts, fresh fruit, etc. Our room was spacious and the bed was big (two twins combined) and comfortable. We had a street side room on the 2nd floor, but the windows were well insulated and the curtains kept the light out of the room to the point where we slept in and didn't know what time it was. The walls contained noises for the most part, but we could hear people in the other rooms at times. Aside from that we always came back to a very clean room, and kudos to the housekeeper for organizing and packing all toiletries (my wife was impressed). The shower was smallish, but water pressure was great and really all that was needed. The location of the hotel was literally one block and a half from the Re di Roma Metro stop. You can ride the metro for 1 euro, if you are not familiar with the Rome Metro it is very easy to use. For a euro at the machine you get a metro card and that card is good for 75 minutes, so if you need to go from the orange line (A) to the blue line (B), it is not a problem. Or you can do a 1 day card (4 euros) or a 3 day card (11 euros). The metro basically takes you to the areas where all the top tourist attractions are (Colloseum, Vatican, Spagna steps & Trevi fountain, Piazza Nuvona) with some walking required. From the airport the most affordable and best route is to take the Leonardo Express Train (14 euros) to Termini station. At Termini you have to walk pretty far to the Termini Metro lines, and up and down some stairs, so if you are not physically capable of carrying your luggage, this route may not be recommended. Once in the metro take the orange line (A) in the Angannani(?) direction about 4 stops to Re di Roma, then once at Re di Roma follow the signs "Via Vercelli" and once up the stairs from the metro you walk a block and a half and the hotel is on your left (small red awnings). At the Re di Roma roundabout there was some shops & takeaway food, also a supermarket tucked in, a perfect place to buy affordable water, wine, fruit, etc. for the room. Not a lot of cafes or restaurants in the area (at least not to the tourist eye), but that is what the metro is for to get to the best spots in Rome. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in . Perfect in every way. A real find.”
Reviews.Author: Skybird66
Reviews.Content: I'm generally hard to please when it comes to hotels, and try as they might there's usually something that they don't get quite right. Until now. This hotel was great. The staff were super friendly, a complimentary coffee on arrival while we waited for our room (we had turned up 3 hours early). A lovely clean crisp airy spacious room on the first floor, with a lovely bathroom - very clean and fresh and new, firm comfortable beds with nice pillows, tv, lounging chair, writing table and a massive balcony. A generous fresh and plentiful breakfast every morning, with tasty coffee, croissants, fruit and cereal. All you would need to set you up for the day. Really helpful staff - answered every query fully and with good grace - keen to offer help with reservations, directions and recommendations for restuarants etc. I would definitely stay here on my return to Rome - I'm sure there are other lovely hotels, but when you've stayed in one this good, why try anywhere else. It was just a couple of minutes walk from the metro which took you into the centre of town in 4 stops, and ten minutes walk from the mainline train which comes directly from the airport for 8 euros. In a neighbourhood type area so away from the hustle bustle, but in a good way. If I had to be negative about anything, it would be the thin walls - I had read this in other reviews and took earplugs incase, but if you wear yourself out in the day you 're too tired to worry about other people's noises. Just a few showering noises in the morning, nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: vlh528
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as a pre and post stop in Rome for our Tuscany vacation. The hotel staff was professio9nal, friendly and very helpful. The room was small, but VERY clean and well layed out. The hotel's neighborhood was a little disconcerting, but we never saw or experienced any problems. A metro stop is 2 minutes from the hotel and if you want to walk , it is an easy 15-20 minute walk to the Coliseum. The Toscanna train station is only 10 minutes away so it is very easy to get to theairport as well. The breakfast each morning was good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, location OK”
Reviews.Author: silver28
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel in a residential area, 100 meters from Metro station. Hotel very clean and modern, the staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms were cleaned everyday sometimes a little later than expected. Only a couple of stops from the main attractions on metro, (which was also good value at 11 euros for three days).

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: meganw2010
Reviews.Content: the room is so clean which is the most important for us.very elegant with contemporary style.The beds are comfortable,the bathroom is sooo clean.staff are very helpful.they even help us find a very nice restaurant which is not expensive,and where the locals go!I really enjoyed the food.The hotel is also close to the malls and grocery,and to the train station.It is also about 20-30min-walk to the Coliseum.We walked back and forth which we didnt mind because we enjoyed walking.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel but alittle out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Jennyz28
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 4 nights on a trip to Rome with my boyfriend. Read the reviews on here first before booking and most of them can out to be true. Hotel was great condition and rooms were really nice. Actually bigger than I was expecting. The walls were a little thin however and we could here people coming and going outside our room as well as our neighbors talking next door. Since we weren't really in the room much, it wasn't a big deal to us. The free WiFi is nice and they have a bar near the lobby which also has internet access. Location was not the best as it is a metro ride away from all the sites. Luckily the metro was only a 5 minute walk. Overall, we were happy with the hotel choice and will probably return again. I highly recommend Pompii, a desert shop a block away from there. It is definitely a locals hang out and was swarming with people everynight. It has the BEST tiramisu I ever had as well as a ton of other sweet selections.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: odessa91
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in the beginning of May. Clean with friendly staff. Night manager Julia is very helpful. Excellent location, just few minutes walk from Metro station Re Di Roma, and 5 minutes walk from local train station, to get there easy from airport ($7.50 Euro) or you can take shuttle bus for $15 Euro per person. Rooms are not big but modern, clean with refrigerator and mini bar. Free internet in room, with PC in lobby. Bar in lobby open late. Breakfast is good

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more - FAB hotel”
Reviews.Author: LinCritter
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - friendly and helpful staff, clean, ample continental breakfast. Couldn't have asked for more. Well placed close to metro, short hop into Rome. Staff were more than helpful. Free internet access. Room clean, good size bed, hair dryer, bar (only thing missing was a kettle for any 'british teapots' like me, but staff were happy to provide tea when we asked). We had lovely large patio area. Good choice at breakfast - cereal, toast, croissants, fruit salad, fresh fruit, yoghurts, fruit juice, tea, coffee, chocolate, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel, even the area.”
Reviews.Author: traveloretta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Re Di Roma for just one night, as we had to leave for a cruise early the next morning. We received the recommendation from our tour guide. The hotel is medium size, about 50 rooms but they were so warm and helpful it felt like a pensione. The place is impeccable, the breakfast adequate and the metro to take you in the center is only a 2 minute walk. I'd stay here again, just have to save up for a longer stay in Rome next time!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Clean.”
Reviews.Author: Ibideb
Reviews.Content: Location - We looked on Google Maps Street View before arriving to the hotel so we knew where we were going - as the hotel has no sign. The hotel is near the Re Di Roma metro station so it's easy to get to and from downtown. It is a brisk 15-20 minute walk to the Colosseum. Hotel street is very quiet. Re Di Roma Plaza has pizzerias, pasta places, gelaterias, 3 grocery stores, shopping, etc. Nice community. Hotel - Super clean and modern. The front desk is small, lobby is big. There is a accessible computer in the bar area for guests with free internet. There is free internet in the rooms if you have a laptop of wireless devices. Free breakfast is great - cereal, pastries, espresso machine, fresh juice, meats and cheese, and yogurt. The front desk will hold your key so you don't have to. There are 4 stories, 1 small lift and stairs. Room - Clean. Bathroom has toilet and bidet. Shower is small. Didn't try the towel heater. TV is approximately 19". There is a safe, refrigerator, armoire, free internet, SKY channels. Walls are paper thin - you can hear neighbors when they arrive, leave and if they speak loud. Not good for those who are light sleepers. Ok for those who can sleep regardless. Street the hotel is on is quiet though. Bed and pillows are comfortable - great rest after a day of walking. Summary - Great hotel, easy to get to, friendly staff, great breakfast and did we mention clean?

Reviews.Title: “220 steps to metro - cheaper than staying right in the centre and you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dan773
Reviews.Content: Firstly we would stay here if we returned and we would recommend it to family and friends the room was spacious and comfortable, breakfast was nothing special but what you'd expect for a cold buffet the hotel is 2 minutes to metro and then just a few stops from the centre. easy to get to from the airport to if you dont mind not staying right in the centre or wanting a bit better value for your money then this could be for you. Rome is a dear city to eat and drink. getting around is cheap save money on the hotel because you'll need it to eat and drink. Getting to Hotel from Airport 45 min train ride then a 10 minute walk from the station to the hotel. Simple.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and staff”
Reviews.Author: cathanne08
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 person room on the 2nd floor and it was the best room of our trip. The room was spacious compared to our other rooms and had a beautiful bathroom. The walls are thin but didn't disturb our sleeping. The breakfast buffet had a good variety of items like croissants, juice, coffee, meat, cheese, rolls, yogurt and coffees. Near Re Di Roma metro stop, maybe a 2 minute walk, but not near any other attractions (except the local market). The lights were tricky- the key has a card that you insert in the wall to keep the electricty on. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with everything you may need while in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: ego_55
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after reading lots of reviews, went there everything was as described: The metro station is really near, about a block and a half There are several restaurants around, gelatterias, etc. The rooms are comfortable and the beds are superb. Good service and the included breakfast is ok. Sat TV at rooms It was safe to return late at night in taxi, walking or metro... Would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Rome is crazy! but the hotel is nice :)”
Reviews.Author: VixseyVixen
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on trip advisor with excellent comments and affordable rooms. Flew out to Rome Fiumicino and got the 8euro coach to termini. Tried to get a taxi from termini to the hotel but the driver didn’t know where he was going so took us more than an hour or so for the ride and cost >20euros. The hotel is spotless, crisp and clean. I am not exaggerating when I say that the mattress there is the most comfortable hotel mattress I have ever slept on! Plenty of choice for breakfast, easy to use safe, rooms cleaned daily, free internet access. A 30metre walk to the metro (there are only two lines in the city) so were able to visit the Vatican and Colosseum easily. We booked our Vatican and Colosseum tickets at tickitaly-dot-com as the queues are out of this world! The police told us that Rome isn’t a safe place to be walking around in at night time, but we got the metro and walked along the main roads and didn’t have any problems; by the way the metro is packed at rush hour. Really good trip – we packed loads into four days!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wilpshirewanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the positive reviews we had read. The staff are excellent and very helpful with restaurant bookings. The metro at the end of the street has you in the heart of the city in minutes. The suburb feels very safe and there are lots of useful shops at the Re di Roma Roundabout. A visit to the Bar Pompi, Via Albalonga, for tiramisu is recommended. We returned to the Fiumicino airport using the local station Tuscolana which was only 8 minutes walk from the hotel. This was a stopping train but got us to the airpot in 35 mins, without having to go through the mayhem of Termini to get the express train, which would have taken the same time. It is also 6euros cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good location (close to Metro), clean, quiet, causy...”
Reviews.Author: susonic
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel with a friend's recommendation Was excellent - clean, causy, friendly, close to Metro, good neighbourhood Highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dublin24yrs
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a great location with the metro stop at the end of the street (arriving every 3 minutes and only costing one euro per way). Not many restaurants nearby the hotel so the metro made it a lot easier!! The hotel itself was v v clean and staff were v helpful could not fault hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruzy_cruz
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a 4 night break at Hotel Re Di Roma and have the blisters to prove it. It's been quite a few years since we ventured out of the UK and I was a bit apprehensive over what to expect despite the reviews. Well I can tell you I need no have worried as the hotel was excellent. We found the hotel easily thanks to other reviewers comments about train travel and the not having a noticeable sign outside until you get to the front door. (I virtual walked it from the station beforehand using google maps) It was located a bit away from the centre of Rome but it was a mere 40 minutes on the train from the airport (Tuscolana Station, 8 euros) and a hop skip and a jump from Re Di Roma metro station (1 euro for 90 minutes metro/bus travel). In fact we walked to the Colosseum in 30 minutes and that was only strolling. Inside the hotel is very clean and modern. We had a 4th floor corner room with a large balcony and excellent air conditioning. The rooms were the usual european size with a big enough, well equipped bathroom. Their was a mini-bar fridge which was excellent for keeping your own drinks cold as well as a safe in the wardrobe. The maids kept the room spotless every day and the breakfast, whilst continental was OK with a range of croissants, melba toast, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juice etc. I can recommend either asking the lady in charge for a cappuccino or use a large cup and select black coffee twice to fill it and add a dash of milk. The coffee with milk selection was not very nice ;-) I mentioned that the hotel is a bit away from Central Rome but don't let this put you off as the metro line on the same street as the hotel can get you to virtually every major site such as the Vatican, Colosseum and Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc etc and runs until 11.30pm mon-fri and 12.30pm Saturday. San Giovanni in Lanterano Basilica is a mere 15 minute stroll. Walk in the direction of the metro and then right around Re Di Roma piazza and take the 2nd exit, which is a wide street that you cannot miss. From here consult your map and amble to the Colosseum for a nice first evenings outing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ScientistIreland
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here back in October for our anniversary. Weather was lovely. I always think autumn is a nice time for city breaks cos its mild and not so crowded. It wasn't my number one place to stay in Rome but i couldn't find anywhere else with such a good price and location so i decided to book it even though there had been some poor reviews. I have to admit i was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was although compact there is nothing wrong with it at all and the room was fab the bed especially was so comfortable. The breakfast was great i love continental breakfasts and it set us up for the day. Its about 20mins to walk to the Colosseum and its a very nice walk and one the way you get to pass the famous Basilica of St. John Lateran!! Amazing!! (This is also only one stop away on the metro). The metro is so easy to get use and def the best way to get around Rome so being right next to metro is great. I would def stay there again its great if your on a budget and i always think there's no point spending a fortune on a hotel in the city cos you spend most of your time sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravel50
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Milan because of the airport closures so I went to Rome to try to find a flight out from there. I wasn't looking forward to it but this hotel made my stay here extremely pleasant!. It doesn't look like much from the outside (in fact I don't think I even saw a sign) but once you enter it's a completely different story. The design is modern and clean and the staff very helpful. The rooms and bath are clean and comfortable with all the conveniences you might need, (free internet as well). It's located only a few meters from the metro where you can get to the main sites without have to transfer. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel re Di Roma - Better than any five star you will find in rome”
Reviews.Author: daniiella
Reviews.Content: Hotel RE DI ROMA is a brilliant hotel, the staff elena and giorgio are extremly helpful and the service is better than any five star hotel you will find in rome. The rooms are well furnished and modern and most importantly they are very clean ( which is very hard to come by in italy). The hotel is well postioned and close to the train station (re di roma), with 1 euro and a 10min train ride you will be in the heart of rome and be able visit all the sights of rome. on top of this you have free wireless so can stay connected to friends and family. It is fantastic to come back from a long day of sight seeing or travelling from one destination to another and be able to lie down and relax in a comfortable clean modern environment. Even the common area in the hotel is elegant and welcoming. We highly reccomend this to any traveller business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckim32
Reviews.Content: Overall I think it's a good hotel for the price that you are paying. Finding the hotel is a little bizarre at first as you step outside of the Re Di Roma station, it is mixed in with residential buildings. It is very close to the metro station on the A line which makes the travel convenient but it is about 4 stations away from Termini. The decor has a very nice swedish/modern feel. We were allocated a room with a balcony and it was very spacious. The breakfast was cheerful with your basic continental available (but the coffee was pretty terrible). They provide free internet and there's a computer that's available for use which was a very nice perk. The 2 complaints about the hotel. 1) Temperature - It was unseasonably cold for the time of year however there is no heat available in the rooms even though there are individual thermostats. The hotel's response - They cannot mix heat and air conditioning so they prefer to leave it as air-conditioning as it is generally hot this time of year. The rooms were very cold at night and difficult to sleep at times. We requested additional blankets that never came. 2) Housekeeping - The drain to the tub was very sluggish and the shower water would fill up above my ankles when taking a shower. I have communicated to the hotel every day and it was never fixed. I am not a high maintenance traveler but at minimum I do require the rooms to be clean (the rest of the room was clean with the exception of the bath tub drain) thus left a negative impression of the hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a friend but would suggest other options.

Reviews.Title: “It's all that you hear about it and MORE!”
Reviews.Author: MorganaHifeng
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in Rome, friendly staff, great rooms - pick your description, it fits. We stayed for 8 nights last February and it was a delightful experience. The room was very confortable: nice bed, a lovely chair, a balcony, cable TV, free WiFi . The bathroom is bigger and better than it shows in the pictures. The metro station is 100 meters away. (When you arrive, pay atention to get the right exit - Via Vercelli, and go down the street. At your left side you will see a red door - its the hotel - they don't have a big sign). Nearby you have small grocery stores and pizza places (some deliver at the hotel) for a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: CEBJLB
Reviews.Content: This was a really good hotel, very clean, modern/contempory decor, friendly helpful staff, breakfast good, although only continental. They offer a selection for people with allergies too which was good for me with a gluten allergy (you don't get that very often). Bedrooms were average size, all very clean and nice bathroom. perfect for a short break. I'm undecided about location. Its quite out of the centre of Rome, but with the Metro only 100 yards down the road, its not hard to be able to get into the centre within say 15 minutes. The area seems like a residential area, and be aware that the hotel has no sign outside, only the number of the street so not very recognisable. We were fortunate enough to find it easily, but it could be just as easily missed. Overall would recommend, but if you're wanting somewhere very central then its not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: alexbaileyracing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in March and it was great. It's ablt out of town but only hundred metres from a metro station which takes you straight into the centre or onto the Vatican city. The hotel doesnt look great on approach but inside it's very nice. We got upgraded to a suite as we were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary, room was very large with a large balcony which went around the hotel as we were on a corner. Breakfast was continental and very nice. Hotel staff were very helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location: but stay only if that is ALL you want!”
Reviews.Author: Priyeni
Reviews.Content: Our Double room was small and stuffy and even in March we had to regulate the temperature by opening and shutting the window all night. The reception did not think that it should be a problem of course and after mentioning it twice we understood they would not listen. There was very little space to walk around the bed and the table. Someone mentioned here before about the size of bathroom IT IS TRUE! I have not seen a smaller space, even in London. It was clean but too small and my husband was banging his arms all over the place. Th breakfast was basic cold fare but OK, but it was exactly the same things the next morning and the next. No change! All in all avoid if you are travelling with kids or for a longer stay..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: vitorborg
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor helped us to choose a nice hotel for a nice price in Rome. Re di Roma is very well located, near the subway station Re di Roma. As we were four, the staff managed to put us on a 3-bed bedroom. The room was new, really huge and there were two private bathrooms. The hotel staff is very polite and helpful. There is free wireless internet in the rooms and there is also a guest-computer near the front desk. The breakfast was typically European. There are also lots of Cable TV Channels from all over the world for free in the rooms as well. A taxi from the Fiumicino airport to the hotel costs around 50 euros. Visiting Rome tourist attractions however is much cheaper as it can be done using the subway and even walking as the city is not that large. If we ever visit Rome again, certainly we will stay in Re di Roma.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 88wndyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located right near the Metro. For 11 Euro, you have unlimited access to the Metro and buses for 3 days and is four short stops to the main Termini so its simple to get to most off all the main attractions in Rome. The hotel itself is small and very friendly. All the staff speak excellent English and are very helpful. The hotel was very modern and had a wonderful bath and shower - perfect for soaking in after at the end of the day after all that sightseeing! I strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Re di Roma is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tazmaniandvl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Rome for 8 days and spent the entire time at Re di Roma. The staff was excellent and always answered the many questions we had about anything! When I arrived, my baggage was delayed and Georgio was working the front desk when we checked in. He followed up with the airline many times over the first 2 days to check on the status of my bag as well as letting me know when it was supposed to be delivered. The room we were in was located on the 2nd floor and had a rather large balcony that wrapped around to the front of the building. The room was very clean and modern and had a refrigerator as well as a desk and plenty of outlets. The free wireless that they provide is also of good quality and we never had any connection problems during our stay. You will need to get a code from the front desk for each computer that you plan on using and they usually last for a period of 3 days. If you are there longer than that, you just go to the front desk and ask for a new code. Some have said that the hotel is not located close to transportation, but the Re di Roma Metro station is only about a block and a half away from the hotel. This station is on the A line and can be taken into Termini Station to meet up with the B line that will also take you to other places throughout Rome. While the Hotel is in a residential area, the Metro runs late enough each evening that you can go anywhere in the city within minutes to find a meal (or dessert!) after the local shops have closed for the evening. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that is traveling to Rome for the first (or even second!) time that doesn't have a problem with friendly staff, nice rooms and maybe some walking! My only complaints (and they aren't that big) are that they really need a shower curtain on the shower so that you don't have to worry about watering the floor each time and that it would be nice if they were to change up the breakfast items at least a few times a week - just for variety! Also - a TIP for those staying here - when you get into your room and can't figure out why the lights don't work.. you need to put your room card (attached to the key) into the little slot in the wall by the front door to the room - this will turn on the power to the room as well as turn on a little red light outside of your room to let the staff know that you are in the room (there were no "Do not Disturb" signs that we could find).

Reviews.Title: “service with a smile ; )”
Reviews.Author: Dub_Claire
Reviews.Content: Small hotel located a few metro stops away from the city centre. The staff in this hotel were so helpful and pleasant throughout our stay, The rooms were basic but clean. We found the breakfast to be of a very poor standard, even passed on the tea & coffee! There is not much happening in the locality at night time as it is on the outskirts of town but there is an excellent icecream parlour a short stroll away were there was a long queqe of locals waiting to order, a good sign! The standard was fine for the price we paid for this hotel and I would recommend it to those travellers not wanting to splurge on accomodation but spend their cash on icecreams & pizza!

Reviews.Title: “good! location?”
Reviews.Author: sgrale2000
Reviews.Content: Good. Exactly what my girlfriend and I were expecting. I am just not sure about the area. I mean, it is easily accessible thanks to the metro connecting the area, but it is low-side residential of Rome...! But in any case, GOOD!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EleniMAthens
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for 6 days in December but before that we spent a lot of hours serching for a nice hotel, close to the sights with a reasonable price. Re Di Roma seemed perfect and, as it turned out to be, it was! Friendly, english speaking stuff, beatiful comfortable and clean rooms, good breakfast and all these just 3 minutes on foot from the "Re di Roma" metro station (with a good guide and a map of Rome, a metro ticket for the day and some walking, you can visit almost all of the main attractions the city has to offer). If I go back again, I will choose Re Di Roma for my stay :-)))))))))) Small tips for future Rome visitors: Learn a few italian key words before visiting!!! Do the open bus tour of Rome, don't miss visiting Piazza Navona and eat as many gelati (ice creams) as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: hidalguito
Reviews.Content: Well located on a quiet neighborhood..just 300 meters from Re Di Roma Metro Station from were you can go to the most important tourist attractions in just a few minutes. Buffet breakfast with good variety. Free wifi internet on the rooms and also on a computer by the lobby (very rare to find free wi fi and included buffet breakfast in europe). Clean contemporary design. I will stay there again on my next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, perfect for our needs and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Muffin_bun
Reviews.Content: My boyfirnd and I (both 24) stayed here for 4 nights and were really pleased with the hotel. The room was quite small but perfectly formed. Queen size bed, modern decor and stylish bathroom, flat screen TV (although limited channels in English, but you don't go to Rome to watch TV). The nearest mtero was only a 2 minute walk to the end of the road and there was a really lovely modern fish resteraunt just round the corner. The staff were very frindly and helpful. In colder weather (such as this was) it is quite far out as it is too cold to walk, but the nearest metro takes you to the Colesseum, the vatican, Spagna and numerous others so still it's not bad. In the summer it would be perfect as walking a bit more around the city wouldn't be a problem. All in all, really enjoyed staying there - a great base for exploring the city and if going again in the sumeer I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel Re”
Reviews.Author: soniaPrague
Reviews.Content: good location, good staff, perfect for staying just a few days

Reviews.Title: “A good value stay”
Reviews.Author: bombshel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at re di roma between 28 - 30 Jan. We found the hotel location to be very good and easy to get to. Metro line A and you come out of the metro and the hotel is at the other end of the street. All the staff were attentive and helpful and really made this hotel what it is - especially Georgio with all the help he gave us. Typical continental breakfast of cereal and pastry's more than sufficent. Coffee machine in breakfast room was poor - opt for tea! Hotel was very clean and had good amenities. There is a hair dryer in the room so no need to take your own. Mini bar with cold drinks were also in the room. The only down sides to the hotel was that the double bed was 2 singles pushed together, also it would be nice to have a kettle and hospitality tray in the room as its nice to have a cup before you go to breakfast. Apart from that you could not fault the hotel and if we go back to rome we would choose re di roma.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bergsund
Reviews.Content: Fine, elegant rooms and services. Friendly and attentive staff. A comfortable, high-value accommodation in the immediate proximity of the main underground line A (200 m) to the ancient city center and shopping areas. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and a better location than you may think.”
Reviews.Author: jfsinmsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Christmas Eve last year based mostly on reviews and were very happy. It was really hard to find because the sign was almost invisible, so bring a good map. It was also very inexpensive, but I think it was a special over the holiday season. The room was extremely nice, the staff all spoke excellent English and were very helpful, which was a relief when stumbling of a multiple-delayed flight late a night. They even went out of their way to point out how to switch the satellite TV between English and Italian during checkin. Free internet was nice too. The breakfast was really unimpressive, but then again breakfast was almost universally unimpressive everywhere in Italy. Apparently the Italians just aren't all that interested in breakfast. The British much be horrified when they get their yogurt and small piece of fruit. The location is better than it seems. If you're a tourist in Rome, you're going to end up walking a lot. There's no way to avoid it. That means there's no such thing as a truly convenient location. The metro station was nearby, so we just started each day with a 15 minute ride to wherever we wanted to go. Overall, a nice hotel by any standard, and an especially good deal for less than 100 euro, but again I think that was a holiday special.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the hype!”
Reviews.Author: RoastedChestnut
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews andmaybe that was a mistake, because I was expecting magnificent things from the hotel Re di Roma. Don't get me wrong, this is a perfectly reasonable hotel, but I find it hard to believe that this is the 8th best hotel in Rome. The service was good, but to be honest, coming from Norway the only way is up, and service seemed great all over Rome. The breakfast was average, coffee was terrible - and in Italy bad coffee is a crime! The hotel decor was very moderrn and stylish, and the room was much the same. The plumbing was a little suspect - the sink was very slow to drain, and after flushing the toilet a trick was required to stop it flushing. Also, the walls were paper thin, so be prepared to share the intimate details of your neighbours relationships! The location of the hotel was fine, and easily accessible to most places via the Metro which is very close by. Restaurants in the neighbourhood were not the best Rome has to offer. I've been to Rome previously and stayed in Trastavere - in my opinion Trastavere is a much better area to stay, but the drawback is that the Metro doesn't run out there, so you need to use a bus or tram to get to the tourist sites. This is not a major problem, but if you absolutely must use the Metro, then the Re Di Roma is a reasonable choice - and of course it is well priced

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and clean but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: BlinkyBillQueensland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and found it easy to get to from the airport (using the train). The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and it was great having free wifi. The only down side is that this hotel is away from the tourist district and we found it very difficult to find a nice place to eat in the evenings. The streets were dirty and we felt a bit unsafe. Also, the shower cubicle is very,very small. However, if you're looking for a clean, modern and affordable hotel- this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinghubby
Reviews.Content: So the hotel was perfect. Decor...check...breakfest selection..check check..price...check x 3. The price we payed for this hotel had to be an off season price, bc when we walked in the room we knew we were playing with house money. The decor was new, and fresh. The room smelled new and was sexy even. The bathroom, with a towel warmer rack was nice as well. The only thing that threw us off was...walking to the hotel from Re Di Roma metro stop. Besides figuring out which is the correct street and overlooking the spray paint "exhibtion" on all the walls in the neighborhood, everything about this place was awesome. My wife and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our stay in Rome even better”
Reviews.Author: garethdibble
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find, thanks to the comments on Trip Advisor. It is pointless repeating what everyone else has said but it is all very accurate. As for all of the Graffiti comments, Rome is covered in Graffiti not just by the hotel. Do not be put off by it. Rome is fantastic and so is this hotel. Top tip: Get yourself a Roma Pass it will save you stacks of money.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Roma! Viva Louis!”
Reviews.Author: dudleywysong
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at Re di Roma at about 9 o'clock at night, we were a little taken aback by what we thought was the shabbiness of the neighborhood. But, once we were ensconced in the little modern hotel, all was right with the world. We had not eaten since early in the day on our trip down from Florence, so we were looking for a place to eat in the area. Enter Louis, the Michelin of Re di Roma. Louis recommended a great little neighborhood fish eatery right near the hotel. Over the next three days and nights, Louis became our gourmet guide. Every one of his recommendations was great. All were little restaurants within walking distance from the hotel and all with great homecooked food, fun local wines and wonderful Roman ambiance. We did not encounter another English speaking person in any of the restaurants that we visited. But, the Romans were welcoming and always apologizing for their broken English. My response was always that they did not have to apologize to us; we should accommodate them. They were all perfect hosts. And the food in every one of those restaurants that Louis recommended was fantastic. The hotel is a little out of the way; but its accessibility to the Metro makes all the difference in the world. We went everywhere on the Metro, except to the Colosseum, where we walked.(about 30 minutes). The hotel is pretty basic with comfortable rooms and a decent buffet breakfast. It really did not matter because all of Rome was accessible from the hotel due to the proximity of the Metro. The other staff people were very accommodating and friendly; free internet access and a nice cozy bar and common area room. And, as to the neighborhood. Well, in the daylight it is much less menacing and once you realize where you are it is quite an interesting part of town. Certainly away from the hustle and bustle of central Rome around the Spanish Steps, but with enough cafes and shops to make it very interesting. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Re di Roma :D”
Reviews.Author: SirBags
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Nice room; good shower! Well located (non-touristy, close to subway/train station). Tasty buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel- Comfortable, Friendly and Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: PennyLane87
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday from a 3 day trip to Rome staying in this hotel. I had booked this on the strength of previous reviews on this site and I was not disappointed. The staff were extremely helpful from the beginning, we arrived early due to our flight being a very early one, and although check in was not until 2, our room was ready within half an hour and we were treated to a coffee in the bar while we waited. The room itself was very nice with a big comfortable bed. There was a balcony which would have been brilliant had it been summer! Each day the room was cleaned to a spotless standard while we were out. Breakfast was included, this was a simple continental breakfast but with plenty of choice. The reception staff were always very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English which really helped us a lot (wish we knew more Italian though!). The location of the hotel was good as it was very close to Re Di Roma metro station which was on the A-line and from here it took about 5-10 minutes to get into central Rome. Taxis back of an evening were about 11 Euro though, but there was a night bus, the N1, which we never managed to get! In terms of cost of transport, there was an 11 Euro card which worked for 3 days on metro and bus. All in all I was extremely happy with this hotel and would not hesistate in recommending it to anyone! It cost us about 180 pounds for three days so excellent value too!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Cleverbroad
