Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night after an 11 night Mediterranean cruise and staying at a different hotel for two nights prior to the cruise. We wish we'd chosen the Re di Roma for our pre-cruise stay! We got here early in the morning after our cruise got in with another couple from the ship and checked in with the charming and helpful Giorgio. Our rooms weren’t ready so Giorgio invited us to help ourselves to breakfast, which was very good – cold cuts, cheese, hot and cold cereals, yogurt, pastries, breads, jams, juices, coffee, cocoa and fresh croissants. Our rooms were ready when we finished breakfast and what a nice surprise – chic, modern décor, spacious (especially by European standards!), with a big bathroom and a huge, deep tub. There was even a tiny courtyard. The room had a mini-bar, safe, free wireless high-speed internet, a nice size flat panel TV with a bazillion channels and the means to change the language. They even provided slippers along with the pretty decent complimentary toiletries. The location was less than five minutes from the closest Metro stop, which was about 10 minutes to Termini Station. We spent the day sight seeing and eating, stopping for gelato before we got back to the room around 8 pm. We were too tired to go out for dinner and ended up watching movies and taking a hot bath. Breakfast is served from 7 am - 10 am but we had to leave for the airport by 6:30 so we thought we were out of luck but Giorgio arranged to have the entire breakfast buffet out by 6 am! All-in-all, a reasonably priced terrific little boutique hotel with a great staff, well-appointed rooms and a tasty, satisfying breakfast. And while not close to the historical sites, it’s very close to the transportation to get you there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HarvBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Re di Roma for a long weekend with my mum at the end of November. I was a bit worried about the location, but needn't have been. We flew to Fiumicino and got the train to Tuscolana and walked from there - very quick and easy, just make sure you go in the right direction out of the station! The hotel is very modern, clean and comfortable. The rooms are very well equipped, with new TVs and everything you could need. The bar area is lovely, and we spent a lot of time in there in the evenings. The staff are very helpful and friendly, and speak perfect english. They recommended some fantastic local restaurants to us. The location is great - 30 seconds walk to nearest Metro stop, and very regular trains, which take no time at all to get into the centre. On the first day we visited the vatican, and got the metro straight there without changing - it can't have taken more than 10 minutes, which surprised me as it is the opposite side of the city. Fantastic hotel - I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Autumn trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: CornwallReviewer
Reviews.Content: A Reasonably priced Hotel, with excellent staff who speak English, and are friendly and welcoming. The room was a basic standard hotel room with twin beds. No coffee facilities in your room but 2 coffees in the bar cost 2 euros. There are a fair number of restaurants nearby and we walked to the big attractions, but the metro is handy too. The collesium was about 2 miles walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 19-DIARMUID_51
Reviews.Content: Fifth trip to Rome and not just the cheapest hotel i stayed in but the best by a mile. Friendly, comfortable, nice modern decor, good breakfast and all the rest. The area is not tourist Rome but an ordinary residential area. Safe too. Well connected to Airport and Metro (see other reports) Best Welcome to a hotel ever. Reception is super helpful. Book it. you will not be dissappointed! It's a gem

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable a little far out but worth it for the money”
Reviews.Author: joeiii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in October for a mini break from a work trip. There are only good things to say about the hotel. The owner/concierge is extremely helpful and nice. His restaurant choices in the area are spot on (never feeling he is pointing you to a tourist trap he is making a commission on), always sending you to the price point you want and always quaint and very tasty. The rooms were well appointed (we had one with a balcony which was a nice bonus). Breakfast was nice (don’t forget you can order a real espresso or cappuccino from the lady working the breakfast) and all in all the hotel is a solid 3 star on the higher side of 3. The negative with the hotel is the location, which is an easy metro ride to town but your still a solid ways out. There is also little to do in the immediate area, though the tiramisu around the corner is one of the best in Rome. The hotel offers good value for money if your are ok making a small trip to town to do your sightseeing. If you want a clean place to stay and a nice comfortable hotel at a good price, this one is right on the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Rome - only to Re di Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Dugai
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel (especially for reasonable money they charged) in good location. Location. 20 min walking to Coliseum area, 10 min to San Giovanni Laterano, several supermarkets in 5 min walking, a lot of different shops with affordable prices. As we traveled with a 2.5 years old baby, we also spent great time in cozy and convenient playground located exactly on Piazza Re di Roma. From the city we normally traveled back using Metro, as the Re di Roma area is located on the one of Rome hills (probably we can also walk back but it was quite difficult with baby after long day sightseeing in Rome). Note for those who travel to Rome with young babies - please be prepare to walk a lot of stairs in Rome metro with a stroller in hands - lifts are built in very few stations and often they are out of order. One more benefit of the hotel area - possibility to rest from crowded Center of Rome (especially on weekend). The hotel. Stylish, comfortable rooms with SAT TV, minibar, safe, good quality furniture and sanitary engineering. Free wifi (but with average connection quality) was very suitable. Breakfast - no wow, but good enough. Special thanks for memorable stay to friendly, hospitable personnel (all of them), and especially to Mariano. Few more tips: Roma pass (we bought ours in airport) was convenient generally and we found it especially useful when visited Coliseum without lines (you can use special line - no people there). If you are traveling with children it will be a good idea to spent more time in really nice parks and villas (some of them located 15-20 min walking from Re di Roma e.g. Villa Celimontana). We can also recommend small but very reasonable priced "IN's" supermarket for some food and wine (5 min from hotel, near Metro station).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, awesome staff !! Highly recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_and_Teddi
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at.. right in the heart of most things to see and shopping. Quiet neighborhood and right by the Metro. Everyone at the hotel was exceptionally friendly and helpful, spoke english very well (thank goodness!!) and was super helpful. Rooms are a good size and we had a balcony with a small table and chairs... very romantic! Would and will tell everyone this is the place to stay when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: EsboTilde
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at this hotel. Breakfast ok. Rooms a little bit small but when you are visiting Rome there is so much to see so you want have much time to spend at the hotel. Friendly staff. Metro nearby is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, excellent hotel, would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireBear81
Reviews.Content: We flew from London gatwick to the fiumicino airport, from the airport we went by train tp the Tuscolana station. It is the local sabina line and cost 5.50euros per person as opposed to 11euros (plus 1euro for the metro) via the express train. It took roughly 40-45minutes. Be sure to validate your ticket before getting on the train. on arrival at the tuscolana station we didnt exit the station at the main entrance, so as a result we ended up walking completely the wrong way for at least 15 minnutes, before accepting we had gone wrong! At no point should you co underneath the railway bridge, whichever way you exit the station, if you do this you're already wrong! All i would say is from the main tuscolana road, look up in the hill for a tall church spire with a blue neon cross on the top, head for that and you cant go wrong! The hotel was excellent, not difficult to spot as i had looked at pictures of the outside before arriving. Very comfortable, extremely clean and a good breakfast. Consisted of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, bread, croissants, had, cheese...etc. served from 0700-10am so gives you a good lie-in! The only complaint i would have about the hotel is the walls are quite thin and for some reason the people above us decided to move furniture around the room at about 10pm every night. Other than that is is a quiet area, and nice to be away from the main city. Having said that we comfortably walked from the hotel to the colosseum and roman forum(about 30mins), we walked from there to the piazza navona, trevi fountain, spanish steps, and pantheon. we did get a tube home but is is a good way to get around as you dont miss things. the tube we paid 11euros for a 3 day pass and its 1euro for 75minutes on the underground. very similar to london underground, and very quick. takes roughly 5-10 minutes from the main termini to the re di roma stop and about 20 minutes to the stop for the vatican, which i think is also walking distance but some may disagree!! Maybe not there and back! We had a guided tour of the vatican city museums, sistine chapel, and st peters, it was very expensive (35 euros pp inclu entrance fee that is 14euros alone) but well worth it. It is the only tour we did and the only one i believe we needed, but we wouldn't have got nearly as much out of if without it, plus there was no queuing. When we went to the colosseum there were people everywhere touting for tours. telling us the queue was 2hours long. Well we decided against it and queued. Well 20mins later we were in. Prob the time of year more than anything. 12euros entrance for the colossum and roman forum which is a good 2-3hour visit. Eating out.............beware of the piazza navona. we had a pizza for 13euros, pasta for 18euros and 2 beers, not even pints.........9euros each!! the hotel recommended restaurants near the hotel which we excellent. The trattatoria for a good selection of traditional italian food, reasonably priced. ASTI - a proper pizzaria, made and stonebaked in front of you, again, well priced, and bar pompei, which is famous for tirimasu......people travel from all over the city to have the tiramisu here. Beautiful, and each one within 5minutes walk from the hotel. Once again, wonderful trip, fascinating place and perfect hotel, and perfect time of year in my opinion! would NEVER visit rome in the summer......queues and heat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Red-ally
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Booked after reading the reviews from trip advisor & they were all correct. Excellent location, clean, friendly staff, continental breakfast but lots to choose from, rooms are compact but adequate & comfortable. Lovely restaurants in the locality for evening meals. Asked reception & they gave us a couple to choose from. Great shops nearby if you want to shop. Very close to Metro to get around & it is so easy. Ask hotel to get you a taxi to airport as a lot cheaper than the one we got from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Tiger1London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located not far from the centre of Rome, in a quiet area very close to the Metro. Travel from the airport to Tuscolana station, which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel, avoids having to use the Termini station with suitcases. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and made our stay very enjoyable. There was a wide selection of food and drink for breakfast and the hotel's facilities were to a good standard. Overall everything about the hotel suited us and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jweibase
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern with contemporary furniture and decorations. The room is small compare to U.S. standards but clean, cozy, and comfortable. The breakfast has a pretty good array of choices to eat compared to the continental breakfast in the U.S. This hotel is very close to the Metro or "Subway" which can bring you to great attractions in a short time. Please note that there are griffitti on the buildings, subways, etc. which is can be seem in pretty much in Rome. At night, you might feel a bit uncomfortable walking from the metro to the hotel since the lights are dim and the street is dark, however I can say that the area is safe after I have done this many times. The service was excellent. Mariano, the owner and front desk reception, was very polite, professional, and courtesy in helping us out with our needs and concerns. He recommended us the "Pompei Bar" in the area which has the best tiramisu in Rome. We are very grateful for his wonderful service and would certainly return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Nice Touches”
Reviews.Author: cleyyz
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by Re di Roma. It is very clean and has a modern unique style. The hotel is a block from the metro and a good base to explore Rome. Make sure to try the gelateria near the metro station...it is unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crow-Eaters
Reviews.Content: The Re di Roma is a great little hotel - modern, comfortable, with great staff, who are friendly and helpful. Mariano, the owner, takes pride in his hotel, and it shows in the way guests are treated. We arrived about 8:30am after a 26 hour trip from Australia, to find our room made ready within 30 minutes, and we were given a free breakfast ! The rooms are spacious, comfortable, a good size by European standards, and spotlessly clean - we stayed twice at the begining and end of our trip and both rooms were great. We experienced no problems with noise. The hotel is not in the city centre, but the price reflects this and we knew the location before we booked. There is a metro station at the end of the street to get you to many of the city sights, and cafes and eateries within walking distance. The area felt safe after dark, and the location gives you a view of "the real Rome" not just the tourist traps. The breakfast offers a choice of food and is well-presented for a small hotel. The staff and the service are maybe the best feature of the hotel - they were terrific. We would not hesitate to return and strongly recommend the Hotel Re di Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and easy”
Reviews.Author: funandtravel
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in october 09, staff was super friendly, hotel very clean, with a great and easy way to get anywhere in Rome ( I used metro all the time with no problems, had a spa treatment at Spanish steps area and it took me 15 minutes to get there). I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully friendly and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: charlesSomersetEng
Reviews.Content: On first arrival the immediate area seems quit scruffy- especially at night - but you will soon discover that this is how Rome mostly is now. Flying in to Ciampino this hotel is easily accessible from the airport - expect to pay about 30 euro for a taxi.The hotel staff were so welcoming and the premises clean with frequently changed linen. Bedroom was on the small side but sufficient and the breakfast was quite fair. Tip - if you do not like UHT milk in your tea or on your cereal you will need to ask for fresh milk - they are very happy to oblige. If you find that the city gets a bit much, hop on the metro then the bus to Tivoli and head for the restaurant La Sibilla for a great meal in fabulous surroundings with spectacular views and consider a walk round the gardens of Villa Este and also between the 2 villas

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kellychoice
Reviews.Content: I arrived for my first trip to Rome and headed to the Hotel Re di Roma, my hotel for the first two days of my trip. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I selected this location based on the cleanliness, western design, and proximity to public transportation. I reached out to the hotel staff on three separate occasions prior to my trip to ensure that they had the accomodations that were promised during the booking process and to arrange pick up from the airport. All responses were given within 1 hour which impressed me. Upon arrival at the airport, my transportation was there waiting for me with a sign. I arrived at the hotel early in the morning and the hotel was in the midst of cleaning my room so I waited in the bar area for about 30 minutes. The contemporary design was very pleasant and the computer / wi-fi internet was free as promised. The room was clean and small but typical of Eurpoean hotel size. The hotel has been recently renovated and the rooms reflected it. The beds were comfortable and the towels were generous. The only problem in the bathroom was the drainage. Both the sink and shower would overflow since the faucet and showerhead were too powerful for the drains to catch up and I had to start and stop the shower or reduce the waterflow but this was a minor problem. The front staff reception was extremely helpful and spoke perfect English. They went out of there way to help me with my transportation and even looked up bus schedules for me. Their breakfast was average but sufficed since I'm not a big breakfast eater. Baked goods, a few meats, and juice were offered. I was worried about the location since this is far from many of the main attractions of Rome. This did not become an issue since the hotel is only two blocks from both metro and bus stops, which is really the best way to get around the city. Public transportation is very easy in Rome and is not difficult to figure out. I spent 8 days in Italy and this was by far the best hotel. I would highly recommend this location to others and look forward to staying here again the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern well positioned base for a Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: keith_lol
Reviews.Content: I'll not repeat all that's been said before, take it as read that this is a good place to stay. The only caveat would be to bring ear plugs if you are light sleeper (thin walls and wooden floors). 5 minutes walk to Re Di Roma metro stop. This is then 4 stops(10 mins) away from Termini (the main station). Despite being out of the heart of the city, there's a good choice of places to eat off any of the streets leading from the Re Di Roma roundabout. From Pizza takeaways through to Indian Restaurants, ask at hotel reception to print you a map of suggestions. Well worth a visit locally is Pompi, the worlds best Tiramsu apparently. Closed on Mondays, as many restaurants seem to be.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and pleasant hotel 2 blocks from the metro”
Reviews.Author: ViviNewYork
Reviews.Content: Liked: - Nice location in a residential neighborhood, low noise level at night. 2 blocks away from metro station (Re di Roma), super convenient. A 10min (slightly uphill) walk from the Tuscolana train station, a cheaper and faster option than taking the airport-to-Termini train. - Decent breakfast, prociutto/salami/cheese and other typical continental fare. Coffee comes from a machine and was okay. - Pleasant front-desk people, stored our bags, courteous, always there. Have to leave the key with them when you go out, which I found a little weird, but in Siena and Florence it was the same thing. - Room was pleasant although a little small, which is to be expected. We had a room on the side of the building with a balcony, 4th floor. - Free wireless internet, and it actually works! In the room! I didn't know this was extraordinary until Siena and Florence. - Hotel was renovated 2 years ago, everything looks new. Didn't like: - Bathroom has one of those modern decors - bathtub has no curtain or sliding door, half of the length is open, so every time I shower, the entire bathroom floor is flooded. My husband didn't have the same issue though, so maybe it's okay for people who have a knack for showering neatly. - No English channels on TV, but who goes to Roma to watch TV, right? Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- not centrally located, but the rooms make up for it...”
Reviews.Author: austintoanywhere
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel with very nice rooms. Although it's not particularly close to the sites, it is very near the metro, so getting around isn't an issue. The neighborhood is quiet, and there are shops for sodas and a grocery store close by, all of which is very helpful. There is free wifi in the rooms -- another big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: worldtripaddict
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. We stayed two nights and had a great modern room that was quiet at night and well air-conditioned. Excellent location right near Metro station, making it easy to navigate to all the major sights. We walked to the Colloseum easily with directions and map from helpful hotel staff. Free internet in foyer was fabulous. Extra toiletries in the bathroom were great. A very affortable hotel and a good choice for holiday-makers in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel 5 min by metro from Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: MayankPatel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at an affordable price. It is located 5 minutes away by metro from Termini station on the red line (Re Di Roma Metro Station). You cannot walk to the hotel from termini station. You will need to take the Red Line towards Anagnina and get off at Re Di Roma stop. Rooms are modern, new and clean. Hotel opened less than 2 years ago. Bathroom is small, like all hotels in Rome. Be aware that the shower stall is less than 3x3 feet with sliding doors so large people will have trouble getting in and out. Nice breakfast buffet, courteous and helpful staff. great pizzeria and gelato places within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel without the hassle”
Reviews.Author: wassupdoc
Reviews.Content: Went for an anniversary trip. The room was a typical european room in terms of size, but the service and hospitality were excellent. We will def. go back to this hotel. Very close to the metro station so can get around all of Rome pretty easily from here...less than five minutes to the rest of the city. The hotel itself had been recently remodeled so everything appeared new and well kept. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Fell in love with the espresso at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: England60
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was expecting more than I actually experienced. True, the hotel staff are excellent. True, the location is good in terms of proximity to the metro and all the sights. The free Wi-Fi is a nice addition and the breakfast is continental style and is OK. The hotel is modern in terms of facilities and layout, but its major downfall is the soundproofing/insulation between rooms. You'll hear every noise in adjoining rooms and the rooms above and below.

Reviews.Title: “great value and friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: BallantraeGolfguy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 18 days in Italy and stayed at the Hotel Re di Roma twice during the trip. The hotel is great and the satff are super friendly and very helpful. The rooms are very clean and newly renovated. The breakfast they serve is more than sufficient. It is located a short distance away from the Rome subway so getting around is easy. There are some good little restaurants close by and a good little supermarket so you can get the things you may need. Had a wonderful time there and would not hesitate to suggest this hotel to anyone going to Rome. I'll go back no questions asked!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location, clean and modern. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: sebachu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and modern and was built two years ago. Excellent service from the English-speaking staff who were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean, large and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and nice, although the shower was a bit small. Air conditioning. Free wifi. Freecontinental breakfast. Just a short stroll to the underground metro station so it was easy to get around Rome and easy to get back again in the evenings Re di Roma is a nice neighbourghood - not much in the vicinity (a few shops and pizza parlours) but a 10 minute ride on the underground gets you to the centre of Rome with all the attractions (Colosseum etc). I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte46
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, good service. Staff spoke english and was very helpful. Breakfast was nice. My only complaint would be the hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: craigsterToronto
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony which was very nice indeed. The room was well appointed and had a really nice bathroom. A bit of noise intrusion from a shared wall - bathroom was right on the other side behind our headboard so we could hear, well, y'know. As has been said by others, for Rome, this is a well priced hotel. The neighborhood is residential and we found it quite safe and reasonably clean (for Rome). There are some decent restaurants nearby and they are fair priced. The hotel is very near the Re Di Roma metro stop (hence the name?) and this was very convenient for getting to all the sights. The evenings were quiet and we needed that after the big sightseeing days. The staff were very nice and were quite helpful for restaurant and travel recommendations. There is a small bar so getting a bottle of Vino was convenient. I had a small notebook with us and wireless internet reception was great on the 2nd floor - free Internet is most appreciated! Bandwidth was fine. No regular restaurant in the hotel but the breakfast was decent. As good as one gets for this kind of price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SilverFish5
Reviews.Content: My wife and me visited Rome in September 2009 and stayed at Hotel Re Di Roma. The hotel is located a block from the Metro which is well-situated. The hotel staff is very helpful in providing details about where to go for lunch or calling a taxi. Since the Hotel is very new, all the rooms are very clean. Some things to remember before visiting Rome is that, the space is very expensive and limited like any downtown area and all hotel rooms (excluding 5 star hotels) in most areas in Rome are difficult to come by, hence most rooms are small by American standards but adequate. The hotel is named after the locality in Rome and the locality is not very good when it comes to good restaurants. Your best bet is to take the subway to Barbarini (near the trevi fountain) on Metro Line A or Trastevere on the Fara Sabina. Overall, Re Di Roma is a good residential neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond experience”
Reviews.Author: atlmikem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at Hotel Re di Roma ending Oct. 1, 2009. The hotel staff was absolutely great, each and every person we came into contact with. The hotel manager even went out of his way to help us catch our train to the airport back home. The hotel is close to the best metro line (red) and we easily reached all parts of Rome from it. Our room was very clean (as was the entire hotel) and the breakfast was good. We have already recommended this hotel to others and will continue to do so. You won't find a friendlier staff or better value in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Banana-Man-in-Melb
Reviews.Content: We were on a 4 week honeymoon and Rome (Re Di Roma) was our first stop. It was the perfect start as it was easy to get to via metro and they were kind enough to allow us to check in early. This isn't necessarily the rule but a room had just been vacated so they cleared it up quickly for us so we could check-in (this was at 9am). All the staff were extremely helpful and those at reception (24 hr) could speak English which helped alot. The room was inpeccable and rest of the hotel was presented beautifully. It isn't a 5 star hotel and doesn't try to be, but for an affordable and well-priced boutique hotel, Hotel Re Di Roma is very hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “/A Roman Gem”
Reviews.Author: CH-Doc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arranged independently for a three-night stay at the Re di Roma for at the end of a cruise around Italy. We found the desk staff extremely friendly and helpful. Our cruise ended very early in the morning and we arrived at the Re di Roma at about 9:45 am. We anticipated only to be able to leave our luggage at the hotel becaue we didn't expect a room to be ready for us. However, the very gracious gentleman at the desk told us that they would have a room available in 1/2 hour and invited us to have breakfast while we waited. His attitude was that problems were only meant to be overcome. Our room (203) was extremely clean and comfortable with a very pleasant balcony. Instead of sightseeng when we arrived as originally planned, we were glad to for a few hours of rest. We spent the next three days sightseeing from a very easy residential location -- only one boldk from the RE di Roma Metro station. We ate at two local restaurants recommended by the hotel staff and enjoyed both. One restaurant was so local that the menu was only in Italian and the staff spoke no English. Nevertehless, we had a wonderful meal based on pointing to the menu item we wanted as well as taking the waiter's recommendations. It was a very pleasant adventure. The breakfast at Re di Roma was excellent and consisted of high-quality European foods. We enjoyed the wide variety of breakfast items in the very comfortable breakfast room. In the evenig, we enjoyed our balcony with the sights and sounds of the neighborhood and a bottle of Tuscan wine we had brought along for just such an occasion. When it was time to leave the staff aranged for a taxi to take us to the ariport and all of our luggage was loaded while we finished breakfast. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again without heistation. Our experience at Re di Roma was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidBrower
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hotel Re di Rome on honeymoon and we found the hotel to be everything we had hoped: very clean, lovely room, best breakfast we have had in Italy full-stop. The staff were extremely friendly. In fact, when the manager found out that we were on honeymoon he had a bottle of wine sent up on a platter with chocolates! The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Re di Roma Metro station and 15 minutes walk from the Lateran Basilica. The ONLY negative was the lack of a shower curtain so showers often led to the bathroom floor resembling a swimming pool - however, at the end of our honeymoon we can see that other hotels in Italy make this omission (my wife slipped twice in the bathroom in our hotel in Assisi).

Reviews.Title: “A good value hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: gailmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Re di Roma for 3 days in August & 5 days in September. The hotel is located just outside the city walls but because Rome is flat, there was no problem walking everywhere we wanted to go (even the Vatican is only about 80 minutes walk away & you see so much other stuff on the way). The local metro is at the end of the street so if you're not energetic you can easily access the rest of Rome. The hotel staff are very helpful & go out of their way to provide information to make your stay more pleasant. The local lavanderia (laundromat) is about an 8 minute walk away & is open 7 days 8am to 10pm. There is a local trattoria off Via Appia Nuova where the staff do not speak English & the menu is entirely in Italian but the food is beautiful (you need some knowledge of Italian as it is not your usual spag bol & lasagne). There is also a Chinese restaurant just around the corner in the next street but the food is bland & the servings very small so you are better off walking 10 minutes to Tuscolana or eating around Re di Roma Square. Our room on both occasions was very clean - the only thing lacking was drawers to put underwear & smaller items of clothing in but the manager advised us that they were looking into doing that in the near future. The only other thing lacking (& this is the case right thru Europe & Egypt) is tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. The breakfast room is smallish but we had no problems in getting a table. It would be good if light evening meals could be provided, even if only omelettes or toasted sandwiches. The breakfast room staff & housekeeping staff were always very friendly & helpful. All in all, we would certainly return to this hotel if ever we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: travellingthommo
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome then stay here. I stayed for 8 days and enjoyed every minute...the staff are very helpful and extremely welcoming. Breakfast is cereals, breads, pastries, juice , fruit ,yoghurt hams cheese etc ,more than enought o set you up for a days walking in Rome. Location..initially seems to be a long way from anywhere but its and easy 15 minute walk to the Colosseum and other major attractions. The metro and buses are at the end of the street and theres a great ltittle laundry close by...essential when you're travelling for a while. Lots of fabulous shopping from the super expensive to the souvenir kiosk and the eateries are too many to mention...the gelati shop is a 'must do'. I certainly hope I will return to Roem and I will definitely be booking in here.

Reviews.Title: “Why the high ranking?”
Reviews.Author: misi197
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our final nights in Rome after a wonderful holiday in Italy. We selected the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, but are left confused by the exceptionally high ratings after staying here. The hotel is very conveniently located near the Re di Roma metro station, has quiet, clean rooms and is helpful in storing bags if you have time to explore the city before catching a late flight. The service however was lacking, with disinterested staff and insufficient space to handle the breakfast crowd in the mornings. People were left sitting two to a chair and consistently asking the attendant to bring out more food and beverage. This may be a small detail, but for over 200 Euro a night in Italy, having a coffee machine at breakfast is a travesty.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: ElizRoe
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Re di Roma hotel last week. It has recently opened and all the fittings are new: the rooms are immaculately clean. Hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate, and are eager to assist. I had no problem with the location: the metro is a few minutes' walk and was in the centre of Rome within 15 minutes. As Rome is a smallish city it is also possible to walk. I'd agree with the posters who noted that the walls were a little thin: I did hear conversations and the TV from the rooms on either side. Overall, though, great value and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exchangers
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice with a great bed. The location was also decent and the metro was not too far away. Buffet breakfast was average. The main downside was the internet. Wireless was advertised however our floor did not have access. Consequently, we had to sit on the stairs between floors and try to get internet from outside sources. Not ideal!! Would recommend hotel as long as you are not on the first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated room!!”
Reviews.Author: TBONEUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a FAMILY room (two small rooms with a sliding door divider). It was a bit cramped with a queen bed + 2 twins, but we didn't spend much time in the room. Room and bathroom are modernly decorated and very clean! Location is ok with a metro stop (Via Vercelli) only a block away. Ask hotel for a nearby "mom & pop" restaurant within walking distance, that serves up good Italian food! Kids loved their ravioli! Continental breakfast was simple with bread, cheese, cold cuts, juice & decent coffee (machine). Expect lots of graffiti everywhere in Rome and very polluted! Would stay here again for the hotel amenities, not necessarily for the location...

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: pye72
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on TA, as i always do, i booked re di roma for an anniversary trip with my husband. Rome was on our 'bucket list' and i was not disappointed by the city or the accommadation. the staff are fantastic, they go out of their way to give a full service, this includes the lovely staff at breakfast. late night tipples in the bar are poured V GENOROUSLY, not that im complaining! room was fine with a large bathroom and powerful shower. much of what i wanted to say has already been mentioned but i will mention the beach. many guide books say avoid ostio lido- but if you do you will miss a lovely destination but the biggest brucey bonus is that i cost 1 euro to get to!! however you will surrender your well earned cash to the steely woman that collects money as you enter, for beach beds and brollies. for 2 beds and 1 umbrella.... 21 euros!! yikes!! also we generally spent a fortune on bottled water when away- but fear not another money saving tip- rome is home to hundreds of water fountains, the water across the city centre is supplied from a fresh water spring- so great to replenish thirsty sight seers! try La foglietta, via enna round the corner from the hotel if you wanna stay local for good roman food. or Thats Amore near the trevi, for great home cooking and the best pasta i have ever had! lastly go with vino bianco al la spina( from the tap) for good cheap wine- 6 euros for a litre, cant go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden affordable modern gem”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: I snatched this hotel for $130 per night for 3 nights after staying in Milton Roma which is a lot closer to the Coliseum. The hotel itself is BEAUTIFUL and very modern which is very unusual for the area for the price. The room was HUGE and very spacious with a marvelous bathroom. It had a free internet in the lobby, the front desk was very helpful with directions, and I couldn't believe how beautiful it was. Now the location, wasn't so bad. Its in the Re Di Roma station which is a bit further down on the metro line, and the neighborhood itself isn't the most desirable although still safe. As far as exploring the neighborhood itself, its doable but its a bit of a walk to go around into the main blocks. We didn't get to enjoy the breakfast but it seemed they were good about making sure you either made a reservation or if you were having it at all. I would probably stay there again for the hotel and the room because you can't get anything comparable for the price in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - A Great Getaway Hide-away!!!”
Reviews.Author: us_finch
Reviews.Content: Spending a week in Rome can be tiring when trying to see all the sights, but we were refreshed daily by the service and accomodations at Hotel Re di Roma. It was perfectly cleaned daily, on our early days to breakfast (which was included in the nightly rate and more than adaquate: cereals, chocolate croissants -YUM!!, plain croissants and rolls, yogurts, meats & cheese, fresh fruits, coffee, hot chocolate, fruit juices) it was cleaned by the time we finished our meal, but we were never made to feel like we had to get out of our room just so housekeeping could come in to clean. The staff was very accommodating to our every request and even arranged to have a driver waiting for us at the airport upon our arrival for a small fee. This was amazing after traveling over 15 hours and not having the energy to figure out anything on how to get to the room. The hotel was within 2 minutes of a great little pizzeria (we both ate for less than 10 euros)and gelato (in Piazza Ri de Roma) and also stores in the other direction. The mini bar was completely reasonable and when we did purchase our own sodas/beer at a nearby market, the staff were happy to give us tall glasses of ice, which refreshed us after the heat outdoors. The location for us was great! Only a 2 minute or less walk to the metro line (A line) and we purchased a 7 day pass for 16euro which was definitely worth it!! The room was comfortable and very well appointed with A/C and a balcony with table and chairs. It had everything we needed and included a safe which was also helpful. Access to computer/wi-fi and bar 24 hours a day. Excellent value, excellent rooms, and excellent service, We will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: faithk
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is a little out of the way and off the main tourist area but that can be a plus after a long day of sightseeing and crowds. The hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood but close to several shops at the Piazza Re di Roma and Appia Way - which goes directly to San Giovanni in Laterno (a must see). The hotel itself is about a hundred meters from the Re di Roma metro stop on the A line (the one with air conditioning) that can quickly take you to virtually all the major sites. You would have to transfer at Termini to catch the B line (no a/c) to the Colosseum but that's about it. The room was modern, nicely appointed and larger than I expected for a European hotel. The minibar was much more reasonably priced than one would find at an American hotel and there was room in the fridge left over to BYO provisions, which can be purchased at a neighborhood grocery or the one in Termini station. The only drawbacks were 1) the thin walls from which I could hear water running in the staff closet next door but my room was between that closet and the stairwell so I didn't hear any noise from other travelers and 2) the lack of variety in the daily breakfast buffet. Don't get me wrong. There was a wide variety of items on the buffet but it was the same stuff (croissants, cereal, biscuits, ham, cheese, salami, yogurt, pineapple and orange juice and coffee/cappuccino, fruit) every day and that got to be a little boring by the end of the week. This is a minor complaint however. The food was good and I was grateful for the big breakfast to start a day full of walking through Rome. If you don't mind not being in a big busy hotel in the center of the tourist area (with prices to match) and would prefer a small, clean, quiet hotel for a reasonable price, the Re di Roma is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home. Location excellent.”
Reviews.Author: AussieConcetta
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and very the helpful. The room was clean and very comfortable after walking around Rome in very hot humid conditions. Breakfast was very enjoyable and if you like a short black the staff will gladly make one for you and they are perfect. Only 4 stops from Rome Termini and the metro is only a very short 150mtrs up the road making it an easy walk after a long day out. Also a great pizza shop just around the corner opposite the park, try it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, not a great location though.”
Reviews.Author: pr0fumo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay in Rome today. We chose this hotel, after consulting this site. The location is not what i would have thought from reading the reviews. Dont get me wrong, we found the place in not much time. We arrived at Ciampino airport, got a bus from there to Anagnina (€1.20 from the ticket office in the airport) and then got the underground from Anagnina to Re Di Roma stop. The area seemed to be entirely residential, but this didn't put us off. After a short stroll and some advice from a really friendly guy working in the local Forbidden Planet! (who hadn't heard of the hotel and lived in the area, he checked with his boss, phoned his friend and then checked google after double checking i had the name right!) the hotel was about 100 yards from where he was and he hadnt heard of it! If i was returning to Rome, i'd much rather stay somewhere more central, however the metro system was adequate and very reasonably priced. One way tickets are €1, all day (for use on buses and trains are €4 and a 3 day pass can be bought for €11. The machines in the station only give maximum €4 change, so make sure you have change! Never matter, we got there fine and had no problem checking in, the staff were very attentive and friendly. We had appr 20 minutes to wait for our room, which was fine. We had booked directly through the hotel. We had found some pretty good offers on various sites, and when we contacted the hotel, they could give us an even better rate (€79 per night, b&b), we secured this booking with the hotel by phone and everything was fine. The room didnt have a balcony, however this wasnt too much of a problem as the view was a few apartment blocks across the road! The air con was very good, the rooms were lovely, very modern, the bed wasnt too comfortable, but adequate for our needs. The bathroom was lovely and had a good pressure shower. If i was being extremely picky, i'd mention that there was a blue streak of cleaning detergent running down one of the walls in the bathroom, which was there for the duration of our stay, but it had no impact on our opinion. Breakfast was fine, meat, salami, cheese, breadrolls, fruit juice, cereal, croissants, yogurt, tea, coffee etc. Enough to keep you going until late lunch. The only problem we had, was on checking out this morning, the member of staff at the desk had quite a problem with the amount we were to pay (€237 for 3 nights) and asked if i had time til he checked this out, i explained we had no time as we had to go to the airport. I had the confirmation from the hotel, but this was not sufficient from what i could see. He hummed and aah'd for a while, looking at the invoice which had already been written out for us (€355 i think) and comparing it to what i had put in front of him. After almost 10 embarrassing minutes for me (there was a large queue forming behind me) he managed to find his copy of the confirmation i had (it was undernrath 2 sheets of paper!), which had the rate we were given highlighted in blur marker pen!! he took the money, and never said thanks or anything, we left and that was pretty much it. If i was returning to Rome, i'd stay in this hotel if i could move it to the centre of the city, but then i'm sure the price would be much higher and for the money they'd charge in the city centre, i'm sure i'd find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, restful, trendy escape from the bustle of Roma”
Reviews.Author: vacationloveressex
Reviews.Content: Ok, in summary: Pros of Re di Roma: Very clean, newly refurbished, modern decor, good air con, close to metro stop, and extremely polite, really helpful reception staff. Cons: LOCATION- not as great as other reviews suggest, depends what ure looking for- most hotels in rome are centrally and well located, even walking distance to some attractions... Re di Roma is unfortunately not, it could be closer. It'll cost you 1 euro for every single trip on the metro---does add up after a while. Also since the last metro train runs just before midnight, the opportunities for a late night stroll through beautiful Rome, with gelato in hand, may be sadly limited. The only other con was breakfast---really quite limited choice, but not uncommon for the continent, and probably pretty standard. Overall, good value for money, but I think if I had to go to Rome again, I would look for a hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Microtravelin
Reviews.Content: The Re Di Roma is a great find. Great location, large, modern rooms, many with balconies, great decor, comfortable reading room and provided internet area and great staff. Combine this with fast, stable wireless internet and a good breakfast included in the low room price and you have a sure winner.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel we Stayed in on this Trip”
Reviews.Author: travelincanuck_9
Reviews.Content: After a very busy 3 week trip throughout Italy and the Greek Islands it was wonderful to wrap it up with a 2 night stay here. It's tucked away on a relatively quiet street very close to a Metro station that leads to all points in this great city. Everything was perfect. From the modern comfortable rooms, the friendly service, the bar, the reading room and the great continental breakfast, for the price I don't this place can be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Just great! Reduce to the max!”
Reviews.Author: merlin911
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just perfect for someone who spends the day out in the city. It is just a 5 min walk from the next subway station (RE DI ROMA) of the A line. It takes not more than 30 min to reach nearly every area in the city. As well the connection to and from Fiumicino Airport is good as well. You can take the Regional Train which takes you to ROME TUSCOLANA within 35 min and then you only walk about 5-10 min. The rooms (or at least mine) was small but enough space for one person. You have quite a spacious bed (guess around queen size) and as well a good desk with a comfi chair. Enough plugs and good free internet connection. I had a 12 sqm terrace on my own. Great for a passionat smoker like I am locked in a room on top floor. The elevator is a little creapy. Looks new but when you step in it goes down like 10 cm and it's very slow. The staff is professional and nice. They even got an adapter for swiss cables...not even 5 star hotels I have stayed at had those...they can help you with nearly everything. Since I had to work in my room in the mornings I wanted to have my peace and haven't been disturbet by a cleaning person banging at the door at 8 o'clock. That is something I really appreciate. There is a nice pannini Take awaz just near the metro station and a little supermarket as well. MC DO is just on the other side of the small park. :) important for solo traveler who returns after 10 pm... :) Just great...

Reviews.Title: “Price Quality the best there is”
Reviews.Author: Peter102
Reviews.Content: The best quality/price Hotel, Very friendly people and very close to the center. They offer good qulaity and good rooms for the the value, we come back again here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel; great place & great staff.”
Reviews.Author: lemonskinny
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews here on Trip Advisor, and are so glad we did. The hotel is very smart, chic, and spotlessly clean. We had generously-sized rooms, one with a balcony. Just a few yards up the road is the Re di Roma Metro - a short ride & we were in the centre. Good continental-style breakfast included in the price. The staff were fantastic, can't praise them enough. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: David_john_lee
Reviews.Content: SHHHH - Let's keep this one for ourselves eh? I for one can't wait to return. Believe all the other reviews on this site as they're all true. All the touches are excellent, the staff could not be friendlier, the rooms are immaculate - you won't be disappointed. Just need a bigger sign outside. and if you have wheeled luggage then walk from Stazione Tuscolana from the airport - halves your costs

Reviews.Title: “Ambience, Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: lesliewalk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Re di Roma immediately after traveling all day and virtually all night to get there. We were early, and the hotel clerk was extremely accommodating. He had us go downstairs and eat breakfast while he worked on getting us checked in early. The room was decorated in a lovely contemporary style and it was very comfortable. The air conditioning was great, especially after walking around Rome all day. As discussed before, the breakfast was generous, with a hardworking attendant. The desk clerks were always friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. It was in close proximity to the metro station, and excellent gelato on the piazza nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: shannonlv
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a solo trip to Rome and stayed at Re di Roma for 4 nights. I was a bit worried being a woman and traveling alone, but the location was fine. The hotel was clean and modern, and the staff were all great. There is not a lot around the hotel at night, but it is a short 4 stop ride on the Metro. The price could not be beat. Would definitely stay again my next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our Best Hotel Stay In Italy”
Reviews.Author: BrownsFanToronto
Reviews.Content: Booked the room - based on Trip Advisor members' comments - in February and was quoted an incredible rate. It seemed incredible at the time, but after staying in the Re Di Roma, it seems even more remarkable now. Modern, well equipped, large room (we were given one with a massive terrace) great tv, perfect AC and a great staff. To illustrate the last point. Upon arrival, and even before seeing our room, I ran across the road to a tabacchi to get a phone card. When I returned to the hotel, I asked the young guy at the desk how to use it. he gave it a strange look, and noticed that the guy at the tabacchi had sold me a display copy of the card with no PIN. He looked pissed off for a moment and walked purposefully across the street. He returned 2 minutes later with a card that actually worked. He - and all the other staffers - obviously cared that one of his clients was about to be ripped off. They are very helpful at the hotel, and gave us two unbelievable suggestions for neighborhood dining. One was the "L'Aquila d'Abruzzo", a wonderful restaurant that is definitely off the tourist track, and the other was the "Pompi", which justifiably calls itself the King of Tiramisu. Rome is a crazy place, and while we were there, the daytime highs were in the mid 90's. After lengthy days of sightseeing and shopping and sweltering, it was really nice to have the Re Di Roma to "come home to." As for location, it exists just off the edge of most tourist maps, but is located in a decent residential area and is just a 2-3 minute walk from a Metro station that will take you anywhere you'd want to go in the city. The Re Di Roma Metro station is just 4 stops from Termini. If we'd had paid 50% more for the room, I'd still have considered it a huge bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vaucouleur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great in many ways. We got a great, clean room with a balcony. The breakfast is good and the staff is nice. The Metro is not far away eventhough the hotel is not in the best part of rome. The neighborhood needs an overhall... Restaurants around the hotel is not prefferable to the many nice ones in the city centre. A good hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient hotel - great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: selrick
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Re De Roma and found the stay very pleasant. We chose this hotel because of the high ratings and reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel was easy to find, modern with friendly English speaking staff. The room was cleaned daily and to a high standard and the room had a nice power shower, fridge, TV and safety deposit box. There was little storage space as there was only a wardrobe however the room was of good size and had a comfy king size bed. The supermarket "SMA" is located in the plaza ( near to the Metro entrance) and is a great money saving option as food and alcohol is very expensive and this helped us no end. If you are looking for fast food pizza there are plenty to chose from, again in the Plaza though we found restaurants quite sparse however as the Metro is so close by you are not limited on options further afield. Overall, this is a great hotel, well situated for sight seeing and superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Suite great for a family (space, large balcony 2 bathrooms with jaccuzzi tub)”
Reviews.Author: RichieJNewYork
Reviews.Content: And we paid only EUR 159 for it. It's worth more. Kids slept on quality converto-couch and also a nice rolleaway bed. My wife and I stayed in large double bed (king? and no, I don't mean two single beds pushed together!) And this ned was in separate space with sliding doors that close (!). What else? Free flawless wifi, corner balcony would seat eight, beer in the minibar is only EUR 2,50, nice enough breakfast, well attended to. The staff person offered to heat my milk when the latte part of the coffee machine broke. Many would not have offered (even in the company I own) and I was ready to put cold milk in it no problem. This jacuzzi tube was great (adults and kids raved). Put the hair and body cleaner in and you get nice bubbles. Sure it's only near the metro, but you're in Termini in ten minutes (one euro, kids free). Actually it's also near a good pizza restaurant, inexpensive chinese restaurant, newsstand with English magazines (not papers), McDonalds and a nice toy store. When you're done with the metro, it's only EUR 10 back in a taxi and we were never ripped off or taken the long way home. In Amsterdam for comparison, EUR 10 only gets you an argument with the driver. We were cheated and tried to be cheated almost every ride. It was worse than the third world there. Rome with kids tip: The kid musuem. Our 8 and 5 year old spent a half hour alone sending the pneumatic shuttle back and forth in the post office part. They quickly realized you could write insults to each other on paper and shoot those back and forth as well too. Rome with adults tip: Arirang Korean restaurant near Termini. We spent a wonderful week on an AgriTourism enjoying rural Italian culture and eating well, but now we were happy to be back in civilization too.

Reviews.Title: “nice modernly styled hotel”
Reviews.Author: meliha
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for those that are budget-conscious and trying to find a hotel for around 150€/night. The hotel is new and decorated modernly and breakfast is included.  The best part about this hotel is that it's located near the subway (Re di Roma stop). There is also a great local Gelateria place right around the Piazza Re De Roma that is a don't miss. During our stay, the food served during breakfast included: both orange and pineapple juices, yogurt, sugar croissants, chocolate croissants, coffee machine (for cappuccino, hot chocolate, etc), 3 kinds of cereal, crackers, meats and cheeses, and another kind of bread.  We were not too crazy about the breakfasts at this hotel...then again, it was included/free (so can't complain too much). The staff at the hotel are nice and helpful. They even recomended a nice restaurant (La Carbonara) in Campo de Fiori.  Tip: During our visit, Rome weather was very hot during the day and rainy in the early evening. It rained almost every night (around 5 / 6 pm) for about half an hour. The good news is that there are some umbrellas near the hotel exit (for borrowing). The bad news is that some of them are broken, so just test your umbrella before venturing out in the last afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay with free internet”
Reviews.Author: jimiUnanderra
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights from the 6th july and arrived by train at roma termina.then take the a line metro to re di roma which is 4 stops away for 1euro,follow the sign for vercelli that brings you out 150 metres from hotel.apart from the ice machine that was broken for 5days,with reception saying to go accross the road to bar and tell them i was staying here and they would help me,after 5days i think they got sick of me asking and therefore went without.also no tea and coffee facility in room and buffet breakfast was basic so for these reasons i thought the 139euros a nite might have been a bit steep.the best features were the room which was very clean and modern,the free internet and easy access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackiew64
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel, the staff were very very helpful and friendly, spoke good english and the apartment was amazing, really roomy and lovely and clean, wish we could have spent more than one night there as it was so peaceful and having a balcony was lovely too. The room was so spacious and with 2 bathrooms was a bonus would love to go back and spend some more time there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Elchay
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, comfortable, with all the comforts. Free internet in the lobby, mini fridge in the room that actually has reasonable prices. A/C, hairdryer, TV etc.. Hotel staff was exceptionally polite and helpful. Only drawback is the location, it's not really in the middle of things, however if you were like us and spent the whole day sightseeing it was easy enough to get to and from all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel inside, neighborhood needs improved.”
Reviews.Author: eacrites
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bargain for those staying in Rome, it has a lovely modern interior and I enjoyed having a breakfast provided in the morning. The service at the hotel was great, very helpful people at the desk. We got a cab to the airport below what the guidebook priced us at. However, like other reviews indicated, the hotel is a bit challenging to find and the surrounding neighborhood leaves little to be desired. Graffiti decorates the walls on nearly every building nearby including the hotel. There are really no restaurants in the neighborhood nearby so you'll have to rely on the metro to get to good restaurants. However, I put the review at "very good" due to the price, it's hard to come by a place that doesn't charge an arm and a leg in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute 'find' - if you can find it!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandMaureen
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel for location, price, comfort, friendliness, and if i ever open a hotel of my own i will headhunt their cleaning staff - our room was sparkling! only prob was... finding it! they dont have a sign at the door saying 'Hotel' as you might expect. just an A4 page, with quite a small logo, we walked past this hotel twice - if you get to via vercelli (which is as easy as previous reviews state) - then use the hotels street number (21) to find it. once inside tho - its everything you can expect from a top class hotel. Breakfast is fairly good, bread rolls, cheese and ham, and the usual assortment of spreads, ( tho no yogurts or eggs). If you are travelling from Fiumcianno (L.d.Vinci) Airport take the local Sabina train to Tuscolana station (about 30-40 mins from Fiumcianno, L.d.Vinci) its only e5.50. (the other alternative which is the Leonardo Express takes you into rome centre for e11.00 and then a further e1.00 to take you to Re di Roma). make sure to validate your train ticket in the yellow machines BEFORE boarding, the inspectors on the trains dont seem to have a lot of sympathy if you get this wrong. on leaving tuscolana station walk out onto Via Tuscolana which is a big main street and turn right, walk for about five mins. Via Vercelli is the last street on left, if you overshoot, you will find yourself at the roundabout also called Re di Roma, and via vercelli runs off this roundabout, so you definately wont get lost. This roundabout is also where you get the metro which is simple to navigate, Re di Roma is on the red line which runs up to 11.30pm. (just four stops brings you to Termini, the central train station in Rome). e1.00 for a ticket which you can use for one journey anywhere in the city, or e4.00 for an all day pass. We arrived at night and the neighbourhood wasnt brightly lit and at first we were a bit nervous, but it turned out to be an area where locals live and the streets are very safe. as we were only on a three day break we bought 'two day pass' for the Roma open top bus tours,(green bus) e24.oo for two days - really good value). i found at all the attractions that the lines are horrendous up until about 2pm, and you are tempted to pay (a lot) extra for 'skip the line' entry, but if you go a little later in the day, there are less crowds and you usually only have to wait for about 10-15 mins in the Q, also as its a little later in the day the temperatures arent as bad. All the tours seem to be open until 7pm during the summer Highlights for me was Trevi Fountain at night.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTC”
Reviews.Author: Moviestar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and everything perfect. Location – great Breakfast – great Price - great

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: givanildobs
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to find, within walking distance of the train station, easy in and out of the city to the airport. This hotel was very nice, great breakfast, safe area at night, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - comfortable, modern and convenient to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: segovis
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, lovely hotel. The room was comfortable and quiet and beautiful. Ours was a double, corner room and included a wrap around balcony. Breakfast was very nice, staff extremely helpful with very good English. Free internet, lovely bar area. So convenient to the Metro, with banks and markets close. I would stay there again any time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elhawi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel standard, especially in comparison to some 4* hotels in Rome! Room was large compared to local standard, clean and modern. Friendly and very helpful staff. Breakfast okay. Good location, off the tourist centre but close enough to explore all the sights within only a few metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: KristinO
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Re di Roma, and really enjoyed it. The hotel is a bit hard to find, as it appears that their main sign wasn't up, so look for the red awnings! Just a block from the metro, and only a few metro stops from the main Rome sights, this is a great spot to stay. It's out of the craziness of the touristy areas, but close enough that you can get anywhere quickly. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They recommended some really good restaurants in walking distance from the hotel, which we took advantage of. The rooms are decent sized and very clean. Great climate control allowed us to get the room nice and chilly to cool off from the HOT Roman afternoons. Good value and location. Now, if only we'd actually had our luggage those three days... got to love the airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with fabulous people! Favorite hotel in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: TomPh
Reviews.Content: I love the Hotel Re di Roma. My wife and I had a horrible experience getting to the hotel from the airport. The airport shuttle driver left us in the wrong part of town and we had to take a bus and the metro with 4 pieces of luggage to get to the hotel. We arrived sweaty and exhausted and we looked like hell. Giorgio, the front desk manager, told us to sit down and gave us bottles of water. He helped us contact Expedia to complain about the shuttle and did everything to make sure that our stay went well. Eugenio and Lara are the owners and they are also great people. The hotel rooms are newly renovated, clean and large. The furniture was perfect for the room and we had a balcony which was perfect. Breakfast was included and was very good. I could go on forever about how good the hotel was but why bore you. Suffice to say that everything considered it is the best hotel that I have stayed at in Europe. Again, the staff are great. For my money, it is the only place to stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “YES- As good as the ranking says...”
Reviews.Author: clark_w_griswaldIII
Reviews.Content: To give you some perspective....Let me first start by saying I don't stay at the Ritz when I travel, however I'm not a motel 8 or holiday inn type either.. think more Hilton/Marriott type. My family and I (total of 5) stayed here for two nights. Rate was around $215 US. Hint- If you're traveling with more than 4 people (or in my case- women with lots of luggage) - get a private minivan at the airport. It's well worth it. Had us there in no time and I think it was 70Euro (less than two cab fares). The rooms were nice. We had an corner room on the top floor (i think the 5th) and it had a very large terrace w/ table and chairs. The bed was a little hard, but not terrible. The bathrooms (the most critical for us) were very nice. The staff here is awesome. The receptionists (all of them) were very helpful and had great recommendations for restaurants although I can't remember the names. Breakfast was great... the espresso machine was awesome especially if you like more than on latte in the am. The only negative is the location is a not the best. I consider myself a walker, but it's a bit of a walk to the main sights. Good news is the subway is literally at the end of the block. Best 1Euro I spent in Italy. Overall, great hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: farfold
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable, clean, well tended, good breakfast, helpful staff, comfortable beds, in a quiet neighborhood and right off the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: bjinblue
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel, it is 100 meters from the Re Di Roma Metro Stop which gives you access to any where in Rome. The rooms were clean, modern and spacious. The were well cleaned each day and our room had a balcony. Our room had a mini bar fridge which was well stocked and items were not over priced. The staff were very helpful and recommended restaurants to try for dinner in the area, which were all delicious. So far this has been my favourite Hotel in Europe and has cost me the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room; Slow Internet; 15 min to center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TinaDr
Reviews.Content: No complaints, except for the surprising slowness of the wifi (couldn't watch online show at all and it takes half a minute to load some pages). Otherwise, a wonderful experience. Good breakfast, very clean room that is new and modern. Comfortable bed. On the firm side but in a good way. Not hard but supportive. I'm very picky about beds and am a side sleeper, so if it wasn't too firm for me it probably won't be for you. Also very quiet since it is away from the bustle of the city. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mml632
Reviews.Content: The hotel managers went out of their way from the moment we walked through the doors to make our stay as comfortable and easy as possible. We were given complimentary drinks from the minibar throughout our stay. The recommendations to restaurants and sightseeing were personalized to fit our needs. Our hotel manager even went so far as to speak to our taxi driver to make sure we wouldn't be overcharged for our trip to the airport! The rooms are compact, but space is utilized very efficiently. The decor is simple and elegant. Located just a couple of minutes from the metro, we loved the location because it is not in the center of chaos, but tucked away in a nice, quiet neighborhood. We are so glad we decided to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LeeSibbald
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for my weekend break in Rome with my girlfriend, based on the reviews on this website. I was a little concerned with the location of the hotel as, when looking at the map, it appears to be well out of the way of the major sights. I shouldn't have worried, however, because there is a Metro stop literally at the end of the street and it's only 4 stops away from the main Termini. Plus, all day Metro travel tickets cost a paltry 4 euros, and the Metro line it is on (Line A) will take you all the way to the Vatican without needing to change! The hotel's surrounding area, whilst not particularly scenic, is none-the-less fine and was quiet on the nights we were there. Ideal to get away from the grid-locked and noisey Rome centre in my opinion. I won't comment on Rome itself as it's not really relevant to a review of this hotel, save to say it's rather a dirty, graffiti covered city and very expensive on the food and especially drinks. Back to the hotel; the guy on reception was very helpful even when obviously very tired and gave us restaurant tips and a map of the Rome area. The rooms where clean and looked rather chic; the twin beds were very firm and comfortable and the bathroom was clean and modern with an excellent shower. The aircon unit worked flawlessly, was quiet and did a great job of making the room sleepable! There was a free-to-use safe in the room as well as a small mini-bar. Prices of the mini-bar and the bar of the hotel itself weren't too badly priced (not compared to the rest of Rome that's for sure!). Breakfast was in with the price and was a basic buffet style; juice, tea, coffee, croissants, cereal, ham, cheese, bread etc. Nothing spectacular but decent enough to get the carbs in before exploring all the sights of Rome! The only bad thing I can say is that one the first night there, during the middle of the night, there was a foul sewerage-type smell in the room. I never figured out where it came from but it was only present on the first night and didn't cause us any real issues. If I had to pick a hotel to stay in Rome this one would certainly be on my list; I'd definitely stay here again. Thank you Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, couldn't have been more helpful...”
Reviews.Author: pc-Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, two minutes from the metro and three stops from the city centre. The room was modern, very clean, had air con and was spacious. Smokers, ask for a balcony room. The staff were excellent, so friendly and helpful. We were there for the Champions League Final, the owner personally took us to the gate of the stadium, just to make sure we got there safely, thats what I call service!! Their continental breakfast was lovely. They also have a bar and the staff are there 24 hours which is great... I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to subway”
Reviews.Author: BobLoblawsLawBlog
Reviews.Content: Our room at Re Di Roma was very nice, clean, trendy, modern, had a nice LCD tv, a balcony that you could get a glimpse of the non-touristy residential life of Rome. The breakfast was excellent. Staff was very helpful. They're there 24 hours, which is always useful if you're like us and wonder in after midnight. It's super close to the subway stop Re Di Roma, which is a few stops away from everything of interest like Piazza Spagna and Colosseo. Internet is included in the price. The only downside I can think of is the neighbourhood isn't the greatest. We never felt unsafe or anything, it's just that it's a bit on the less than nice side. Overall excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGal1017
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited our needs very well during our recent three day stay. It is very sleek, modern & stylish- and the rooms are very nice- w/ hardword floors, flat screen tvs, and the deepest/nicest bathtubs I've seen in Italy yet! Also on the plus side- the staff was extremely helpful. However, as expected and as is common in Europe, the rooms were very small! But, when in Rome you shouldn't be spending too much time in your hotel room anyway so this was fine. While not in the hustle and bustle of Rome, it was still very easy to reach the sites from the Metro that was about 1or 1.5 blocks away. Another positive of this location is that it's conveniently located (about 10 min walk) to a train station that takes you directly to the FCO Airport! My boyfriend & I were not aware of this when we booked the hotel, but when a member of the staff informed us of this it was a definitely a nice perk! It saved us the hassle of going back to Termini with our luggage, and also about 1/2 on the ticket prices. As another example of how helpful and accomodating the staff was, when we found our first room too noisy, they switched us to a quieter one for our second two nights without a problem. This hotel was not cheap, but seemed to be competitively priced w/ other hotels in Rome, and we were able to find a decent price on lastminute.com- about $500 USD for three nights. The included breakfast was just fine- not the best we've had, but nothing to complain about either-pastries, yogurt, meat, cheese, coffee, juice, etc. Overall, I would certainly recommend Re di Roma, and would definitely consider staying there on my next visit to Rome (which will hopefully be soon!)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean- not the best neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TexasRobert
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we were not sure what to expect. This hotel was a great value- extremely clean, although small, and modern. The reception staff allowed us to check in early and they were helpful with recommendations for restaurants and directions to attractions. The metro is located close by and is easy to navigate, although it gets quite crowded often. The neighborhood did not feel safe, but our son enjoyed the park and playground close by. One big plus is the in-room internet service. Overall, we felt this was a good value (reasonably priced) but would probably stay closer to the attractions in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: lodge75
Reviews.Content: An excellent small hotel in the south-eastern suburbs of Rome. The hotel has had a complete restoration within the last two years- beautifully designed and spotlessly clean. Staff were very helpful, arranging a taxi to pick us up from airport and showing us best ways to reach the delights of ancient Rome. They were also happy to suggest local restaurants, including Aquila d'Abruzzo - close to hotel with good local cooking. Breakfasts were great ( a plus for Rome) and the Metro was 2 minutes walk away at the end of the street. We did a hugh amount of walking in that wonderful city but were always happy to return to Re di Roma at the end of the day. Most enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: zipleon
