Reviews.Content: great location, a minute walk to the metro. great service, friendly reception, great coffee, restaurants and more nearby. we arrived very late, after searching the internet for a long time. the reception guy was wonderful. he made tremendous effort so we could stay in the same room for the whole of our visit, even though we did not book in advance. we had many questions (regarding site-seeing in rome, regarding food nearby etc.) and he was so friendly and helpful. the room was a bit small, but i think there are bigger ones in the hotel. breakfast was nice-and we could even order fresh espresso.

Reviews.Title: “Get more than your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: Andrew-VanBC
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel after several days of searching on Internet and armed with two guide books. I found it as I was already getting frustrated with lack of affordable options in reasonable locations. I got a very good price for a 6-night stay (tip: try to book through multiple sources to find the best deal) but I did not expect to get all that I got. The hotel has a modern, unmistakable Italian look inside and appears new and spotlessly clean. My room was amply sized with all amenities I wanted and some I did not - writing desk, fridge, safe and even a big balcony with table and two chairs! I loved the design of the furniture, colour coordination and laminated floors. Enough power outlets everywhere, good sized bathroom. My only complaint is lack of shower curtain and not being able to tighten the showerhead holder to keep it raised - probably a defective one. Overall nothing worth writing home to complain about. Wireless internet was free and very fast; multiple access points and access passes - professionally done. The service from the staff was excellent, they were always helpful with directions and recommendations. Breakfast was buffet style and included everything I would wish for; if I needed to be picky, I would have preferred pastries to be better (that is Rome and they certainly do know how to make them - try them in any bar). But given the availability of toast, all kinds of spreads including Nutella, several flavours of very good yogurt, cheese, salami and cooked ham, there's again nothing of importance to complain about. Tip: ask attendant for a cappuccino or espresso as they will make one in the kitchen and it's better than the machine in the dining room will make. I was aware of the location and am overall satisfied with it. It's reasonably close to the metro station and as you should expect to walk a lot in Rome, it will not present any trouble. Just don't expect to drag a lot of luggage from the airport to the hotel - my recommendation is to come with carry-on only or leave big bags at the Termini if you're on a multi-city tour. Overall I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel and believe I have gotten one of the best deals in Rome. I am not sure why it's only rated 3 stars, most likely it is missing some amenity like restaurant or pool because what it does provide, it provides superbly. The reviews were certainly true. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was the best I've stayed in ever!”
Reviews.Author: Stephindevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! A 3 minute walk from the metro and just around the corner from a great pizza restaurant. The room was clean and well decorated and the service was truly wonderful. The guy who works on reception in the afternoon was great and very helpful with showing us where to go and places to eat. Breakfast in the morning was from 7.30am - 10.30am and was in a lovely breakfast room with a help yourself service! This was great!! If we ever go back to Rome we would deffo stay at this hotel again!!! Someone MUST tell Lonley planet! Thanks for our stay in Rome, Hotel Re di Roma! From Steph and Dylan Room 207

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no AC”
Reviews.Author: Indiantraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was walking to the metro in a decent neighborhood. Rooms were clean and sufficiently large. Staff was very cooperative in helping me with directions and places to eat. There is free internet too! I found it a bit expensive but probably worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: betsy026
Reviews.Content: Every employee of this hotel provided excellent customer service. All the reviews were right, every employee went out of their way to make not only our stay in their hotel but our stay in rome as enjoyable as possible. The balcony off of the triple is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “The best advice we could get”
Reviews.Author: IGUW
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. The best value for money you'll find. New and very clean. Close to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look any further ! Best value hotel in Rome !!”
Reviews.Author: teza1234
Reviews.Content: Hi, my partner and i stay at Hotel Re Di Roma at the end of March on the last leg of our honeymoon and were so pleased that we did. There`s alot of hotels on offer in Rome so it can be very tricky picking which one would be - 1. value for money 2. close to attraction 3. nice hotel to stay at ( services etc ). I`m so glad i read the reviews on trip advisor the hotel had recieved prior to us leaving it made staying in Rome a more enjoyable experience. The english speaking staff are really excellent their more than happy to answer any question you have, which my partner and i had alot including best shopping spots, restraunts, transport, general getting around (metro/bus). The price for our stay was the even cheapier than the doggie less star hotels we found online. So when you book ( which you will ), try to do it in advance online as they have really good prices, even half what you would pay if you booked days in advance. The price includes a continental breakfast every morning which has cereal`s, toast, juice, coffee, fruit`s, cold meats etc a good meal to stay your site seeing day. The rooms are also excellent, cleaned daily, tasteful decor and big compaired to Italy standards with all nessecary items and your own bathroom. Only thing we found alittle annoying was that walls are very thin so when the guest next door showered you could hear the water runnning, and at 5.30am they must have not been on holidays ! They have a lift for any special need guest`s or for us lazy ones to avoid the stairs (5 levels). They have free interent connection (wifi) for those who have laptop`s, but if you don`t they supply free internet on a guest only computer which is a nice touch and very handy for getting in touch with love ones. I highly recommend Hotel Re Di Roma !!! Save your time reading and looking for best prices and book with these guys you wouldn`t be dissappointed like many other travels who have stayed ! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LL80
Reviews.Content: This was a great find in Rome! The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are extremely nice--especially for the price you pay. We had a double room, which offered plenty of space. We were also lucky enough to get a room with a large wrap around balcony, which was great! Bathrooms was also nice and quite spacious. The location is okay--very close to the Metro, so it is easy and fast to get around. But there is not much nightlife in the area, so each night we would go into the city center to eat and go out. Not a problem at all, but as a young married couple, we would have preferred to have stayed closer to the action. Also, ladies, the hair dryer in the bathroom is so slow--bring your own! The hotel offers free wifi in the lobby (not available in rooms), and there is a computer for guest use in the lobby as well. Breakfast, which was included, was quite good too. All in all, we had a great experience here and I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: 1Life
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything a traveler could need in Rome - good location (not in a 'tourist trap' area, but close enough to all major sites), great service (staff could not be more helpful - going as far as to print maps to local restaurants, storing luggage etc), extremely clean and a good buffet selection for breakfast. The nearest Metro stop (also Re di Roma) is close - following advice from an earlier post we followed the signs out onto Via Vercilli, the hotel is on the left about 100 meters away as you exit (walk away from the plaza).

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are all right, this is an outstanding hotel and value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: pianoman822
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 days 6 nights at the Hotel Re Di Roma in mid March. The location was really good for us, in a nice quiet regular neighborhood, not in a tourist area. We bought a one week Metro Pass, and with the metro only 1/2 block away, we could within a couple of stops be in any section of town. The room was wonderful! We must have been upgraded, but we had a lovely corner room with a balcony, that was extra large. We poked our heads in the non corner rooms, and they were like large, American hotel rooms. All the rooms have huge bathrooms, with big baths, showers, bidets, etc. Very beautifully decorated as well. There is a nice breakfast each morning, nothing exceptional but a nice choice of cereals, cheeses, breads and croissants, etc. usual European breakfast fare. The staff are WONDERFUL! Everyone was so kind and friendly and helpful. There is a lovely little, attractive bar, where is is fun to sit in the evening, use the internet, have a very reasonably priced glass or bottle of wine, and chat with other guests. Most people found the hotel because of the great reviews here on Trip Advisor, and we all agreed the reviews were right. There are some lovely, "real" Italian restaurants nearby. Have the staff recommend some. They are the type of restaurants without English on the menu, but the waiters still speak excellent English. Family run type places, wonderful Oh, one important tip. If you book the hotel, make sure you contact them before your arrival, and ask them to arrange a driver from the airport, it is much cheaper. We paid $70 for a cab from the airport to the hotel, but when they arranged the limo for our return to the airport, it only cost $40. And the limo was a nice mercedes, with a very nice driver, who drove NORMALLY (not like an Italian cab driver, if you know what I mean). So, we HIGHLY recommend the Re Di Roma when staying in Rome, and we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: HomeisWhereDaHeartis
Reviews.Content: After days of searching TripAdvisor for the perfect hotel for our stay in Rome, we booked this hotel and were delighted to see we made the right choice! You can pretty much get the picture from the many reviews before mine: a small, sort of boutique hotel, very clean and tastefully decorated rooms, friendly staff, a good continental breakfast that includes small rolls, ham, cheese, fresh and tasty croissants, fruit salad, fresh fruit, 3 kinds of cereal, orange juice, coffee and tea. Cappuccino/ espresso on request... A high chair for our baby could have improved our (and the other guests) breakfast experience, but it was rare to find it in any restaurant in Rome... When my husband and I booked online, we requested a double room with a baby cot and a bathtub, and were granted this room with a huge terrace- for no extra cost. The room is not very big, so with our 2 suitcases, baby cot & baby stroller- it was quite crowded for us… There wasn’t enough room in the closet for all of our clothes as well, but we managed. We loved the complimentary slippers! And the bed, though it was actually 2 single beds connected, was very comfortable. After a long day of walking, it was nice to sit around in the lobby/ bar area, that felt more like a big living-room, and it was great for our daughter to crawl around and play with her toys. We also loved the terrace outside our room, and enjoyed sitting there every evening after our daughter went to sleep. The location of the hotel is good, for the price you pay. We liked the fact that the area is not too touristy. It’s easy to get to the center, just 2 min. walk to the metro. And a short walk to the airport train station. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and made us feel right at home. Best value for money hotel I could find, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Re Di Roma is Solid Value and Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghoststoglory
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re Di Roma was a very smart choice, and I'm glad that I went with it off lastminute.com It was very easy to locate, the staff was friendly (they spoke English as well), the room was very clean, as well as reasonably sized, and it was within walking distance of the Colosseum and Pantheon (maybe 30 min on foot). The only negative things I could say were that the blanket on the bed wasn't especially comfortable, and the soda/water in the mini fridge wasn't free. Other than those tiny discrepancies, it was a hotel I stay in again. The only advice I can offer to those who visit Rome is to take advantage of the public transportation system when it's up and running during the day, you will save plenty of money to spend on food & wine!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in all respects”
Reviews.Author: SandyNorfolk_England
Reviews.Content: What a gem. A small hotel , spotlessly clean and with very friendly and helpful staff who, when asked, went out of their way to make sure that we knew how to get about Rome, what to see , where to eat etc. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends or family. It is quieter than the city centre hotels but with easy access to the city sights by bus or metro or you could even walk and take in the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boberonicus
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights before a recent business trip. Room in great shape and looked recently remodeled. About 100 meters to the Metro station of the same name. Don't take a taxi from the airport. Friendly staff member asked me if I wanted a free Cappuccino while I awaited my ride after check-out. View from room was of local neighborhood. Staff were willing to teach me little Italian phrases, give advice, and even showed me to my room! I arrived at 9am and my room wouldn't be ready till 2pm (which is fine). I worked till 3pm in their lounge area, which has comfy and business chairs, free Wi-Fi, a very fast Internet connection, and no pressure to buy drinks, etc. The room was charming, but I'd have to say it was the staff that really makes this place special.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price and comfort”
Reviews.Author: bluestarbutterfly
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Rome. The rooms are clean and a good size for Europe, bathrooms are clean and new, I stayed on the 5th floor and had a patio which was nice to check the weather and relax on. The staff is super friendly and really helpful with travel assistance, restaurant recommendations and information. The hotel is just two blocks from a metro stop and in a non touristry neighborhood with a circle of great places to grab a quick pizza dinner, gelato or catch a soccer game on tv after a long day of walking this was great to have. I would stay here again and thought this was a great deal for the price

Reviews.Title: “Clean & modern rooms, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MamaBabaRocks111
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights during my stay @ Rome in Jan. Location is 3-5 metro stops away from center of Rome, but the rate, quiet environment and the conveniences made-up the distance. Lots of shopping & restaurants options in the area. Breakfast was one of the best amount the 3* hotels I stayed in Italy, with ham, cheese, cereal, fruits & few types of rolls & croissants. The showers were strong and water was hot enough. Walls are quite thin and I could hear the neighbours talking but when it got to mid-night it was all good. I'm happy with the hotel so much that I spent my last night in Italy at Hotel Re di Roma again before I headed back, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: PocketSizeSun
Reviews.Content: Weather was a little off but this was the perfect place to stay. We took the airport train to Termini and then took a taxi to the hotel. The hotel is a short walk from the Metro but is also a short walk from a train station that will take you to/from the airport for 5.5 euro. The hotel staff is super friendly and also recommended RICOMINCIODATRE {via amiterno, 42/52, roma, italy} for excellent pizza (around 7 blocks from the hotel). They have wood fired pizza ovens and charcoal grills, very good food, highly recommended. Internet was free, and the breakfast was included. Just have to lady make you a cappuccino instead of the standard coffee which is about the only thing that isn't great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Great Food Nearby- Highly Recommended-”
Reviews.Author: r0b101
Reviews.Content: Apart from not having a big sign outside which makes it slightly hard to find i can't find any fault with this place. Location: The metro is two mins walk from the hotel. The metro line is four stops from the main 'Termini' station and about another four stops on the same line brings you to the Vatican metro station. We walked to San Giovani Basilica from the hotel which is a lovely 15 min walk and then all the way to the Colloseum which was another beautiful 30 -40 minute walk. A map and a good sense of direction is important. For us the location couldn't have been better. Food: The little pizzarias, trattorias and patissieres near the Ri de Roma roundabout were the best that we came across in Rome. It is REAL Italian food so most places have no English on the menus or speak very little so a little phrasebook would come in handy if you aren't adventurous. We just winged it and were very happy. The breakfast in the hotel isn't particularly noteworthy so head out and get some cheap real italian food and coffee in the surrounding area before heading into town by metro or on a nice walk. The mini bar was really cheap. For about 10 items (water, beer, juice) it was less than €15. A taxi back to fiumcini airport cost us €40, we paid €11 by train into Rome plus a cheap metro ride. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LakeDistrictman
Reviews.Content: Pro's :- 1. Excellent value ( although I can't believe we paid the normal price). 2. Good location - in a quiet residential neighbourhood yet less than 5 minutes walk to the Metro and quick access to the city centre. 3. Comfortable rooms - functional perhaps but a comfortable king sized bed, plasma screen TV, and reasonably priced minibar - drinks also available in the bar/lounge where there was free internet access. 4. Friendly, helpful staff. 5. The buffet breakfast was good value considering the price. Cons :- 1. The local restaurants that we tried (4 in all) were not particularly good and one, in particular, seemed overpriced - an Italian Restaurant recommended by staff at the Hotel. No meals at the Hotel save for breakfast. 2. The shower in our room was a little unsatisfactory - the tray was too shallow and the curtain awkward which resulted in floods in the bathroom if we weren't paying close attention. 3. The breakfast dining area was a little small - it was a little nervewracking each morning wondering whether a complete stranger was going to end up sharing your table. If you're looking for reasonably priced accommodation I'd certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: rd76
Reviews.Content: We chose Re di Roma via TripAdvisor for spending two nights Sep 27th and 28th, 2008. As usual with TripAdvisor the hotel (top rating for our price range) fulfilled our expectations. It is located a side streed 500 yards away from Piazza Re di Roma, which has a metro station, extremely convenient and cheap for moving about in Rome. I think that the building was converted a few years ago into a hotel, so everything looks fairly modern and is in good state. In the room there was no noise from the street. We could only hear the neighbours in the morning but they were very reasonable. The room was more like a small suite, therefore we had plenty of space. We did not really have the feeling that we were in a hotel room. There was not much selection nor much room to sit at breakfast, but I guess that this is okay if you are not too pretentious. Of course the Italian breakfast is not usually very rich. We took the suggestion on TripAdvisor and ordered capuccino, avoiding the standard coffee. The guy at the reception was friendly, could speak English and guided us to the next door parking (quite expensive by the way, but there is no parking on the street, not to mention that foreign plates are guaranteed to give you troubles with the local burglars. If I remember correctly the Internet usage is free via wireless. There is also one free-access computer on the ground floor. If are looking for a standard four-star hotel, you should go to Sheraton or Holiday Inn. From this perspective Re di Roma is not it, rather a very fancy three-star, with the room comfort of a four-star. This is exactly what we look for when we go on city trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: juzzap
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a really enjoyable stay at this hotel. The hotel was really easy to find - thanks to the directions given by other TripAdvisor users, and upon our arrival we were greeted by 2 very friendly people on reception and were taken to our room 502 straight away (even though we turned up at 11.30am). The room was as we requested on a high floor, with a balcony and a king sized bed and extremely clean with really modern fixtures and fittings. We spent our first afternoon looking around the area and back past the metro are 2 supermarkets and numerous shops and snack bars. There is so much to do in Rome and we would recommend the Roma Pass which costs 24 euro but it gets you into 2 museums and 3 days of travel which works out good value as just getting into the Colleseum cost more than 10 euro. I would also recommend going to Rome the last weekend in the month as on the last Sunday you can get into the Vatican for free. The only negative we found was that eating out was very expensive, for example at our first evening meal we ate at a small restaurant near to the hotel it cost us £70 including tip for a 2 course meal of pasta followed by veal (please note veg or potatoes do not automatically come with meat dishes) I had a soft drink and my partner had a beer. Back home for £70 we could have a really great slap up meal with wine and dessert. I also found in general the food everywhere was of poor quality and that I could actually prepare nicer pasta and pizza myself. The one exception was a Chinese just around the corner (turn left out of hotel and head past the bar on the opposite corner and look right - you will see some chinese lanterns and that is where a good yet cheap chinese meal can be had. The hotel was really great and I would stay there again if I was to go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This is how hotels should be!”
Reviews.Author: JethroDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel like so many others after reading the reviews. They are totally accurate. Clean rooms, modern building, helpful and friendly staff, free maps etc. We thought the location was great - very near to the metro and trains every 3 mins. 1 euro ticket gets you anywhere. There's no large hotel sign, just a small logo on the glass doors. We took a photo of the hotel with us , so it was very easy to see. The staff were so helpful with advice about eating, sightseeing. We didn't realise that our european plug adaptors didn't work in Italy so we asked at reception where we could buy one from - they opened a cupboard and gave us one to borrow - fantastic! At the colosseum we booked a guided tour for inside and then the forum and palatine hill. This was from a guy outside so we were a bit wary, but it was great and we didn't have to stand in line to get inside. The tour lasted about a couple of hours but then you have as long as you like to explore the area - great. From a stall outside we bought an up to date book with overlays of the buildings to show how they originally looked. The price started at 15 E and quickly came down to 12 and then 10 when we started to walk away - so haggle for everything! You won't do better than this hotel for value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo888
Reviews.Content: Four of us wanted a good quality hotel for long weekend break giving value for money and decent connection into the centre. Sounds easy but isn't in Rome where many centrally located hotels charge very high for what they offer. This hotel met our needs in trumps. 5 mins to metro. Hotel itself is a year or 2 old so and nicely laid out. The guys on the front desk 'went the extra mile' to help - excellent. Breakfast OK. One small detail I suggest is to get a better coffee machine. Bedrooms were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maintimers
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, clean, lush rooms and a good continental breakfast. Close to the subway and for the slightly fitter a walkable distance from central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dont look any further”
Reviews.Author: Namik_K
Reviews.Content: Next time I am in Rome no need for the interminable hunt in the net. My experience in brief and factual manner. Neighborhood - quiet, decent quality shopping (via Appia Nuova) in 5-min walk, supermarket in 7-min walk (Re di Roma circle). Transportaion - metro in 5-min walk. Bus No. 87 in 8-min walk. Both bring you to the main sites in about 20 min. Room - spacious, wooden sliding door separates the family bed from the other one. Facilties - free tea with cookies served by request. Staff - exceptionally intelligent and friendly Manager - professional and personal attitude, nothing was left unattended. An issue raised by previous reviewers - sound from shower in adjacent rooms. Isolation is not ideal, but it also not critical. I knew this is the only possible problem, decided to risk, and was rewarded with a one of the best stays. Re di Roma was a true "home away from home" for the 8 days of our family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: daknapp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Re di Roma for 5 nights for our honeymoon. They arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the airport (45 EUR) and we arrived at 10am. We were able to immediately check into our room (they unexpectedly gave us a room with a large terrace) which enabled us to take a much needed nap. We paid 445 EUR for out 5 night stay which we felt was a great price! The breakfast had more variety than expected...meats and cheese, croissants, cereal, yogurt, fruit, and juices. The staff speaks English very well and were all friendly. The rooms looked modern and were very clean. There are extras in the room like a TV with Sky, safe, and mini bar (with reasonable prices!). The metro station is right up the street and it's about a 30 minute maximum walk to the Collosseum (they also provide maps of the city at the front desk). We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Mletin
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Stayed for 3 nights mid-December and enjoyed it a lot. The staff are very helpful, especially the guy working in the evening and recommended good places to eat. The hotel is a quiet place - great for a good nights sleep. Breakfast is an excellent buffet - cereal, croissants, coffee, juice etc - lots to eat,!! Price was reasonable - 267 for 3 nights for a nice, comfy room There is a train station (can't remember the station name - begins with a 'T' quite close which has a direct line to Fumicino Airport (only 5.50eur). Metro stop Re di Roma is very close to the hotel also - great for seeing the sights. I would highly recommend this place but not if you are looking for the Roman nightlife. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: bpzed
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, on a quiet street. About a 30-minute walk to the Coliseum, through San Giovanni and lots of trattorias. We got in late and were quickly checked in before getting a bite to eat at a pizzeria around the corner - a simple and satisfying meal to start our trip. The rooms are well-designed and furnished, with loads of TV channels and an ethernet connection in the rooms if you're too far from the wifi. They lent us a cable since we didn't have one. They were also obliging with reservations, wine glasses - unassuming and efficient service. The only niggle is that our bed was next to our neighbour's bathroom, with the result that when they showered we could hear it loud and clear. Wouldn't be a problem if you're an early riser though! We paid €280 for 2 nights, so a bit pricier than what others have paid here. We were happy with our stay though and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a 3-star place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: Dadsterdude
Reviews.Content: Following the previous reviews of this hotel, it seemed a good bet to stay here for a recent long weekend in Rome, and we were not disappointed at all. Yes, it's in a quieter residential district, yes, you can't see the sights from your bedroom window, but so what! We found it an advantage to return to the peace and comfort of the Re di Roma at the end of each day. Connections - a 2 minute walk to the Metro line A, with an entrance/exit onto Via Vercelli itself. From Ciampino airport, you must take the Cotral bus to Anagnina stop and then the A train to Re di Roma stop, will take about 45 minutes, journey cost 2.20euros. A day pass on the metro/bus/tram costs 4.00euros - great value, we used all three. A 5 minute walk from the hotel takes you to San Giovanni, with buses to all points in the city. But if you want to walk it, the Colosseum is a 20 minute walk from the hotel. Hotel - this is a smart/ boutique/comfortable/3 star ish/ great value hotel. The staff are welcoming and very helpful, all speak good english. Breakfasts are fine, ask for a cappuccino from the waitress. WIFI and internet downstairs. Bedrooms and bathrooms are very good indeed, quite chic really. And the price, we paid about 280 euros for 3 nights, and this has to be amongst the best value hotels in the City. we had a balcony too which in better weather would be a real bonus. Sights - buy a guide book! We took the 110open bus, which covered all the locations. Tips - if you go to the Vatican and want to see the Sistine Chapel, don't join the line in St Peters Square, you need to follow the signs for the Vatican museum/Sistine Chapel, a 10 minute walk from St Peters Square. Food - it will be difficult to eat badly, but we managed to avoid any touristy haunts apart from the occasional coffee in the larger squares. We assumed that if a restaurant was very busy, cramped, and full of Italians, then it had to be pretty good. We also ate very reasonably too. We would recommend Pizzeria Da Ivo and Pannattoni in Trastevere, Pizzeria La Montecarlo on Vicolo Savelli close to Piazza Navona, Restaurant Raf off Via Cola Di Rienzo near the Vatican. The best was Aquila d'Abruzzo on Via Aosta, only 5 minutes from the hotel and recommened by the hotel, truly delicious food, pasta, pizza, fish and meat - don't expect anything fancy, just great food, service and plenty of locals. Don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else, unless you want 5 star luxury and you have a bank account to match!

Reviews.Title: “Good find!”
Reviews.Author: kiwilloyd
Reviews.Content: This is a great find and very easy to get to from Ciampino Airport. Also a short walk from the collesium I was travelling alone and so nice to get a twin room and have some space. The room has Sky tv and extras such as a safe and slippers. Local shops and supermarket are good - esp with the rate of the pund to euro!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Classic Italian Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JLMarietta
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It is located in a non-touristy part of Rome but very close to the metro subway system to enable one to get to all the sites -- you will need to use the subway/bus system due to the size of Rome. When you get off the subway from the main train station at the Re Di Roma stop, just stay underground and walk about 100 yards to come up the steps at Vercelli, the street on which the hotel is located. We thought we'd be taking the subway back to the main train station the last day and taking the Leonardo Express train from there to the airport, but the hotel told us about a local train service within a 10 minute walk from the hotel that was cheaper and much easy to use to get to the airport. The hotel was very clean and seemed either new or recently renovated -- done in a very modernist style. The room was quite large (we had expected a tiny space), and we had plenty of room in the bathroom, too. There wasn't a charge for the internet service, but we couldn't get the internet to work in our room. Our computer did work in the main lobby, though, and we could use a computer provided by the hotel at no cost. They are currently figuring out how to get the wireless internet more easily to the rooms in the near future. There was also no charge for calling an 800 number from our room to use our phone card to call the United States, and that made our trip very pleasant. It was a little bit warm in the room at times since the air conditioning isn't used in November, but we just opened the window a few inches and were very comfortable. As for the breakfast, the food was quite tasty with a variety of breads, meats, coffee, juices, fruits, etc. The staff were also incredibly nice and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm R
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on the previous reviews - and they are accurate - this hotel has got it right. It's clean, modern, functional and outstanding value for money. Staff are unfailingly helpful, service in the breakfast room charming and efficient, and the quality of fixtures and fittings in the bedrooms worthy of a hotel two or three times the price. Add free wifi and you've got a real winner. The only negative is that the lack of carpets in the bedrooms allows noise to carry, but we were always so tired after full days of sightseeing that it didn't bother us. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: WarringtonWanderer
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at Re de Roma solely on the great reviews listed on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. This small friendly hotel is superb - great room rates, clean/modern interior and friendly & efficient staff. Location is good - just a few stops on Metro line A from Termini. Hotel is 400m from the metro stop. Reception open 24hrs. Staff recommended good areas to eat & drink and even printed maps out for us for the bus/metro routes. Room was clean and well laid out, with en-suite facilities, mini bar, satellite TV, complimentary slippers and toiletries. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshipper99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a 5 night beak in Rome staying at the Hotel Re Di Roma. We were looking for a reasonable hotel in a good location that wasn't going to break the bank and this hotel did not disappoint. It's modern, clean and has a great feel to it - it was only refurbed about 12 months ago so the appearance of it is great and it's tastefully decorated. Breakfast is adequate - sets you up for the day although can get a bit dull by the 3rd day with the same selection of cold items each day, but this is standard in most Rome hotels and is only a slight negative! The location for the metro is great - approx 200 metres walk to the metro station from the hotel door and 1 euro will get you anywhere you want to go for the next 75 minutes. We did walk into Rome 3 out of the 5 days and this only took approx 30 minutes to the Colosseum. The walk with take you past the San Giovanni Basillica (Rome's cathedral) - this is definately worth a stop - beautiful building inside and out. The hotel is located in a more residential area and can be easily walked past however the directions we followed from the hotel's own website got us right to the door (it helped that I studied photos online of the hotel so could spot it straight away!) from the airport using the Cotral bus from Ciampino airport to Anangina metro station (cost of 1.20 euro each) and then the metro from Anangina to Re Di Roma (1 euro each). Great value to get us to the hotel for only 2.20 euro each and was an easy transport system to navigate. We did get a taxi back to airport for our return flight to ensure we weren't late, booked by the hotel for us and cost 30 euro. Good local restaurants if you want to spend some time out of the city centre in the evenings - Chinese round the corner 2 minute walk away (on Via Bobbio), Bombay (Indian Restaurant) about 5 mins walk away and great traditional pizzeria recommended by the hotel only 5 mins away. We will definately return to Rome and would go back to this hotel - we got a great deal on lastminute.com, paying only £335 for the 5 night stay. As it was my birthday whilst we were there, my husband contacted the hotel in advance and they allocated us a great room with a small terrace. All staff were really friendly, particularly helpful were the reception staff who will make great recommendations on places to go.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterwilliam_8
Reviews.Content: Had great few days in Rome staying at this hotel. We had a wheelchair user and were given an accessible room/bathroom as requested. Unfortunately the lift was not working on our arrival day due to the torrential rain which was a big concern but it was repaire d as promised by the next day so we managed--just as well rooms were on 1st floor! Staff were very friendly and helpful--it seems like a family run hotel and they do care for their guests. Rooms were of a good standard and well maintained. Breakfast limited in choice but adequate and plentiful. The hotel is away from the centre but the metro is very close and the peace and quiet is a bonus. Plenty of shops nearby and a great local trattoria--theAsti--at the top of the road-great for a proper Italian meal and reasonable. Try the house wine(and a few words of Italian will go down well). When going out take a copy of the hotels location because not all taxi drivers knew it and there is no hotel name on the front. taxis cost about 12 euros from centre on average--depends on traffic. Beware--we booked the hotels own car for return to Ciampino for an agreed price of 40 euros. Nice mercedes came but not with enough room for wheelchair and bags-we had to carry cases on knees! The trip took just 15 minutes and the driver charged us 50 euros despite our agreement. no tip given! All in all we had a great trip and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Vandervalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and thought it was perfect. - Very nice room - Friendly staff - Close to Metro (subway), quick and easy to get downtown - Very good rate for Rome (80 Euros / night, for one person) - Zero problems! Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short stays”
Reviews.Author: SunAllergic
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay at the hotel at the end of a 2 weeks holiday in Rome and Milan. Typically when you think of a 3 Stars hotel in Europe or France and you have images of small rooms, basic facilities and very tiny small lift. But Hotel Re Di Roma is none of that at all! The exterior of this hotel is very simple and you could even tell that it is a hotel. But the interiors and staff were fantastic! The staff were very friendly and they were very helpful in giving suggestions for dining, shopping, transport etc. I felt that the rooms was of a decent size. Fantastic TV with wide range of channels. Very modern and new decor. Designer like bathrooms with well thought out features. In short the room felt like one of those designer boutique hotels. I am pretty happy with the breakfast selection as there was unlimited cold meats, cheese, bread, pastry, juice, coffee/tea and cereal. Location was fantastic as it was close to the metro and there are at least 2 supermarkets in the region as well as plenty of pizza outlets and some retail shops. All in, I would strongly recommend this place to anyone who cares to ask for my opinion! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: evolverheld
Reviews.Content: Hotel Re di Roma has just had its first anniversary and it is a great place to stay! It is nearly perfect and a very good deal - I don't think you can find anything comparable in this price-range. Interior is almost a boutique hotel! I've talked to the owners - very nice people - and they are doing a great job in offering the best for their guests and they truly care. The rooms are spaceous, well designed, great matrasses(!), beautiful bathrooms. Very friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast (as much as you can expect in Italy) free (!) internet, nice bar and hang-out area.... Even if it is located outside the old city wall - from Plaza Re di Roma it is only a 10 minute ride to downtown by subway. Nice places to eat and shop (without tourist stuff) close-by. Nice and quiet neighborhood - you even can open the windows at night an get fresh air! Very recommedable! Also great for elderly and wheelchair! (I stayed with my mom)

Reviews.Title: “extremely friendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: thepastrychefs
Reviews.Content: re di roma is indeed excellent. since we are on a trip for a year, we have to watch our budjet. we stayed in re di roma in august 2008 (€90 for a double) Fantastic rooms-design-and a staff with a natural enjoyable friendlyness rarely seen in a city-hotel. close to the underground and nice local restaurants and the best ice cream shop!!! garage available next door. we would certainly go back. dany&jorgen restaurateurs bruges belgium

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described”
Reviews.Author: Katherine77
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and the hotel was very clean, modern and comfortable. The staff were very helpful recommending restaurants with a map to get there, advising us about how to get to the main areas and booking us a taxi for our return journey to the airport. (this costs 30euros which is fixed but the first taxi driver, on the way in,tried to charge us 50euros. When we walked away they quickly found us another taxi for the correct tarrif.) The hotel is right near the Metro and we bought tickets for 11euros each which allowed us to travel anywhere for thee days. Internet access is free which was very useful - would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: TheJanit0r
Reviews.Content: My partner and I ventured to Italy this August, Rome was the 1st stop on our mini-tour and it was as fantastic as we expected. Judging by the favourable reviews the Ri de Roma got, we booked it and were not disappointed. Very friendly and helpful staff, being close to the metro was a bonus! Spacious rooms with all amenities at hand and having sky was an added bonus! Free internet and the safe in the room was handy. All in all it was a fantastic start to our holiday, a hotel we would not hesitate in staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanNon
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very close to a Metro stop of the same name. Was a bit too far for our liking from the centre for an evening because Metro shuts at 10pm. However it didn't detract from our stay we got a taxi at night. Approx 20 minute walk to Coliseum from the hotel. We had a fantastic room, a modern and very clean hotel. Staff were very helpful and welcoming. I would recommend this hotel. Breakfast was included and was adequate. Good transport link on the train from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mancity789
Reviews.Content: I read other recently posted reviews which gave this hotel a "3" rating and must disagree. Some of the "negative" comments I read included (1) the hotel room was not clean or in slight disrepair, (2) not enough amenities, and (3) not located near the city center. Our room was impeccably clean, and the entire hotel has a very new, chic and modern look to it. While we were there, the room was cleaned thoroughly and promptly each day. The property certainly has all the amenities required to be classified as a hotel - such as mini-bar in room, free cable TV, 24/7 desk service, shampoo & hair dryer in room - but yes, it is a smaller hotel and certainly will not offer everything a larger hotel would, such as a pool. But this is why you are paying $250 per night instead of $500-$700 night that you can easily pay for a much larger hotel in Rome at this time of year! This hotel is great, great value for money, and I found the amenities and services offered more than adequate. The location is not in the direct city center, but again, you get what you pay for - if you want to be within a few minutes walking of the city center, you will pay $100s more per night. I still found this very convenient to all the sites in Rome - 30 minutes walking from the Colosseum (which is where the Ancient City also is), and an easy ride on the subway to Roma Termini train station (only four stops, which takes less than 10 minutes). This location was actually far, far more convenient than I expected, based on the reviews I read before booking and arriving that said it was not centrally located. The neighborhood does have some graffiti and I was cautious about safety when we first arrived. But after a day, we realized that the neighborhood is very residential and we had no issues with walking around to get to dinner, etc. If anything, because the neighborhood is residential and not touristy, the restaurants in this area were some of the best I ate at in an entire two-week trip to Italy - "real" Italian food that wasn't catering more to tourist tastes. Breakfast was continental and more than adequate. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, recommending several places in the area to eat. Highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: MonikaToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, comfortable & modern. The price compared to other hotels in Rome for value received is exceptional. This hotel is away from the downtown area, not too far, but enough that the price was much less expensive than other hotels that are near all of the tourist attractions.. It is located just steps from the "Metro", the underground subway, which literally will take you anywhere within minutes. We found this extremely convenient & cheap to travel around Rome. Excellent free breakfast & free parking made this hotel a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel....perhaps I was expecting too much?”
Reviews.Author: debsidoodle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at Hotel Re Di Roma, to celebrate my first wedding anniversary with my husband, having booked based on the consistently high reviews on this site. I have mixed feelings about my stay here, and am more inclined to agree with the previous reviewer in that I am surprised this hotel has made it to number 4 on the Rome list. The hotel was clean by Rome standards, although it was far from perfect (bedding and carpets were stained, the skirting was falling off the bedroom wall, with a layer of dust over room during entire stay). Free Sky TV and cheap mini bar were a big bonus. The continental breakfasts were good, with cappuccino available upon request, which was lovely. The breakfast room is too small to cater for all. On our first day it took 3 attempts to secure a table - after that we left going for breakfast until the last minute of service, which meant we were leaving the hotel a bit later most days than we would have liked. Food was however fresh and plentiful. Staff were always polite and friendly, with reception helpful and speaking very good English. The hotel booked a car to take us to and from the airport. It cost 40 Euros, and is a service I would recommend, since taxi prices are much the same, and the Metro line is notorious for pick-pockets looking for travellers with their hands full of luggage. The hotel building itself is old. Sound proofing is not very good, expect to get a fright every time your neighbour flushes the toilet - it woke me up more than once! The hotel is a bit outside the city centre, and I hadn't fully prepared myself for all that would entail. It was a bit more of an inconvenience than anticipated, having to rely on the Metro system or a 30 minute walk to reach the main attractions. The Re Di Roma area is a typical city suburb, highly built up, unclean and covered in graffiti. When we first arrived at the hotel my heart sank when I saw the location. We didn't however experience any safety issues. I mentioned this because at least if you are aware of this before you go you know what to expect. I don't think I had fully taken this on board and got quite a shock when we pulled up at the hotel itself. I think perhaps I was expecting too much from this hotel, based on the other reviews I had read. The staff certainly made the stay for us, as they were incredibly helptful, polite and enthusiastic. I would say that it's important to remember before booking that this hotel is far from perfect, as is the area where it is located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: AlyCatNyc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Re Di Roma in late July 2008 and our experience with the management and the hotel overall were nothing but spectacular. We arrived during rush hour and found it difficult to find the drop off location for our rental car. The manager on duty, Marcello, allowed us to keep our bags at the front desk, gave us detailed directions to the drop off location and even lent us his mobile phone to give us directions only a "human GPS" could. He talked us through the rough spots and we arrived back to the hotel feeling excited about our time in Rome, not frazzled like we were just 2 hours before. The room that we were given was magnificently decorated in a modern style. Sleek and sophisticated! Our wraparound terrace was a fab addition as well. We had our laptop with us so we were able to use the hotel's wifi (free to guests) in the lounge. There, we popped open a bottle of wine we purchased earlier in the day with glasses from the bar of the hotel. When we asked about dinner reservations in the city, management once again helped us out big time. I would stay in this hotel each and every time I had the opportunity to visit Rome. It's close to everything and one of the best values around. Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Nr. 4 in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: tommygun82
Reviews.Content: Is this the best that Rome can offer? Maybe the rest of the hotels are terrible, but I dont understand how can this hotel be nr. 4. Location is ok, very close to metro station. For such a expensive hotel i would expect some bigger room, some facilities and services. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly (but I think that it shouldnt be a problem to be nice), breakfast ok but for such s price i would expect some bigger selection. I think that this hotel will not dissapoint you, but nr.4 on tripadvisor is very ununderstandable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Nadya_M
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Rome. The city is perfect and Hotel Re di Roma is very nice indeed. Rooms are modern and very clean. Very convenient location (just 2 min from metro station), staff is very helpful and polite. If I come to Rome once again I'll stay in this hotel and recommend it to my friends. Just one minus - in my opinion breakfast is not so good, I'd like to eat bread and drink good coffe. But it's a very small minus :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mak022
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We booked it after our research with TripAdvisor and can only confirm the great rating. The staff is extremely friendly, gave us very good recommendations for restaurants. The rooms are very clean and in our case (202) very quite. The breakfast is ok but could get boring after a couple of nights. The closeness to the subway station is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: judyrose
Reviews.Content: Booked this wonderful Hotel through Opodu. Clean and conviently located - just get the Metro A line to Re De Roma (from Termini) and is a 2 min walk from there. We asked for a balcony and got a big room on the front overlooking the road. Very modern hotel and very new. Breakfast was ok, plenty of ham, cheese yogurts etc. Bedroom well equiped with sky tv. Bathroom spotless and towels changed every day. Good supply of shower gel's etc. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: andshewas1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Rome and felt compelled to write this review. The hotel and staff were EXCELLENT. They could not be more accommodating or helpful or friendly. And would go out of their way to assist you with anything you needed. The rooms were new, very clean and quite large. The location was excellent. Very easy to get around Rome via metro and the station is only a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Please read if you´re a fussy person like me - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: busybee12
Reviews.Content: At first, I was sceptical about this hotel because it seemed relatively far from Rome´s city centre (that´s when I looked at it from a map). But as soon as I arrived, I quickly found out that it was literally only 2 mins walk from the metro and really easy to find. So yes, we actually just came back from Rome and believe me, it was boiling hot there. But thank goodness the hotel had adjustable air conditioning and massive windows in their rooms! We paid about 90 Euros or so (i think) a night for two twin beds (of which we requested) which I thought was excellent value for money. Briefly, here are some reasons why I recommend this hotel: -Simple and modern furnishings/design (very chic) -Good shower pressure!!!! -Conveniently located (literally 2 mins from the metro) -It´s CLEAN!! The cleaners clean the rooms everyday, replace the toiletries, and change dirty towels and sheets/pillowcases -The staff are really nice, friendly and approachable (they gave us a bottle of water the day we left to take with us because they knew we had to lug our luggages all the way to Termini in the boiling heat. The gesture was definitely unexpected but very much appreciated!!) -Breakfast is quite decent (continental breakfast with nutella spread amongst others, croissant, cereal, juices, milk, coffee, fruits, yogourt, etc...) -The rooms are very quiet (good soundproofing) -Adjustable temperature for the air conditioning -The minibar is always replenished -There´s WIFI connection Essentially, I can´t really complain about this hotel because everything went very smoothly. So if you´re a picky/fussy person, you needn´t worry because this place has everything that you need to make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ShaznAnt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little difficult to find. We had actually parked our car in front of it but because there is no sign we didn't realise for about 15 minutes! Anyway, the staff were brilliant, doing all they could to accomodate us as we just walked in off the street without a booking. We originally only wanted 2 days and then later asked for 3. They shuffled things around so we could do it without moving our room. The hotel is quite new so all the decor and furnishings and light and bright and new which was a refreshing change from some of the hotels we had stayed in during the previous 3-4 weeks. The room we had on the 5th floor was large and roomy. A couple of the staff had great English so could direct us to the metro, restaurants etc. Free wireless internet was a big plus. The breakfast was OK. Nothing terribly exciting. We found on the 2nd day that we could request a cappucino for brekky instead of the coffee off the table which was much nicer. The breakfast room is also a little small and there was a bit of a traffic jam both mornings we were in there. The room rates are little more (tho less than worse hotels!!!), It was in a great location - 100m from the metro underground which got you into the center of Rome in less than 20 minutes. We had free parking for our car. The street was relatively quiet. Would definately recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DelightedToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of Rome and is very near the Re di Roma Metro railway. The Hotel owner Eugenio and his staff, Mariano, Adriano, Giorgio, Louis and Mercedes were so helpful. The service was excellent. The hotel was a home away from home. When I made the reservation I mentioned to the owner that the trip was a graduation gift to my daughter. We were provided with a wonderful room with a balcony. Because many of the attractions are near the hotel, we had time to rest in our room in between our sightseeing trips. We originally booked the hotel for 2 nights because we had other arrangements. However, we decided to go back to the hotel for another 5 nights. The staff assisted us in getting maps and directions in order to make it easy for us to get acquainted with the beautiful city of Rome. We had a buffet breakfast each morning and the kitchen staff was more than willing to prepare a latte or cappuccino on request. The hotel also helped us find good restaurants in the vicinity . We tried their recommendations and were so pleased and delighted with the choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, loved it”
Reviews.Author: idsd
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel online and it being the cheapest at the time (Feb. 08) we expected it to be small and shabby. We were more than surprised to find it was completely the opposite. The rooms were spacious and immaculately tidy, the bathroom was well equipped and spotlessly clean. The views are not spectacular in that you can’t see the Vatican, Coliseum or anything like that, but by the same token, you are not staring at a brick wall. We figured there had to be something wrong and expected breakfast to be a roll, and it was, along with cereal, fruit, yoghurts, ham and cheese and numerous other items on the buffet table and easily managed to fill up for most of the day. The staff we extremely helpful and went out of their way to help us. Obviously not knowing Rome, they gave us a map and took the time to highlight all the major places to visit on it. The Metro was about 100m down the road and that could not have been any easier to use. On our return from our days (and nights) out we would ask for Tea (being British we still have Tiffin) and it was never too much effort for them to arrange it. The rooms have Sky which with a few channels in English and the lobby has a PC with internet we expected to pay for, but were not charged even after 15 minutes use. I had managed to email the hotel before we went out to arrange transport from the airport and they replied very promptly stating our driver would be at the airport waiting, and he was (the private transfer was 60 Euros and a normal cab is about 50, so it is worth it). I had also asked for good rooms as it was my wife’s birthday, which they did, but most surprisingly was on her actual birthday they left chilled bottle of wine and four glasses with a note wishing my wife a happy birthday, it finished the day off for her wonderfully We could not fault this hotel no matter how we tried and not only would we recommend it, but if we ever go back we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: babyfishm0uth
Reviews.Content: We loved Re di Roma. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, the decor, fixtures, and amenities were modern, and the space in the room and bathroom was ample for two people. The front desk staff was available 24/7 and, while they weren't brimming with travel advice or tourist tips, they were always courteous and helpful with any of our requests (bottled water, Internet use, wake-up call, etc.) We found the breakfast to be great -- cute breakfast room with warm bread and croissants, meats, cheeses, cereal, yogurt, fruit, juice, tea, and coffee -- a hearty continental breakfast. Sadly, we missed breakfast the first day, b/c there was no alarm clock in the room, and we couldn't figure out how to call the front desk for a wake up call on the first night (the room was so dark from the blackout curtains and quiet we slept late!), but the second day, we really enjoyed the breakfast and wished we had it the first day. The common areas included a little bar area with a computer available for internet use, the breakfast room, and a cozy sitting area. Our room had a comfortable king size bed (two twins that easily pushed together) with crisp white linens, a small desk and cupboard with a mini-fridge, safe, and rod for hanging clothes, a full-length mirror, bench, flat panel tv with lots of channels (including a few in English), and a cute balcony with a bistro table and two chairs. Our bathroom had a decent-sized shower and tub, sink, toilet, bidet, and plenty of fluffy towels. The only weird thing about the bathroom was the lack of shower curtain/shower door. There was a half wall, but even by holding the shower handle in your hand, it was next to impossible not to spray water into the rest of the bathroom. So we spread some of the towels out to try to absorb the water that went everywhere, but it still left the bathroom a bit wet. This was a minor inconvenience, but not a huge deal. The Re di Roma is not in the heart of the city, but it is literally a 2 minute walk to a Metro stop -- and that stop is a 10-15 minute ride to the main city attractions. We bought the Roma Pass for 20 euros which allowed us to travel unlimited by bus or train for three days (plus 2 free museum entry fees!), and so we hopped on and off the Metro for most of our travel. Be careful if you are staying out late though, b/c the Metro stops running around 10, and then you'll have to find a bus or cab back to the hotel (which is no big deal, but is good to know). Overall, we thought the Re di Roma was great. Spacious for a European hotel, clean, modern, and well worth the affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with modern style”
Reviews.Author: aahk
Reviews.Content: I like the modern style decoration and the excellent service. The bed is comfortable. We were given a room with balcony! The bathroom is very nice, temperature of shower water is good. Very close to metro station, but a bit quite near the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern, close to metro, knowledgable + multi-lingual staff”
Reviews.Author: nguyenntvu
Reviews.Content: Based on tripadvisor reviews, we booked this hotel from booking.com 2 days before our arrival. The rate was 99EUR/night all inclusive for a double room. There were actually two twin beds. So the honeymooners might want to ask for an actual full or queen bed:). The decor for both exterior and interior was sleek and modern. The room was well maintained and thus very clean. A huge wide window allowed plenty of sunshine. There was a flat screen TV with 500+ channels in all different languages. Shower stall was a bit small but functional. Linea-A Metro station was just a few steps away though this line only runs until 9PM daily but there's always the bus. The front desk staffs were friendly and fluent in French, English and of course Italian. They gave us a map with checks of places to see and good restaurants to try out and we were good to go! This hotel ranks highly on my list and definitely deserves a return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short stay in Rome. This was our first visit to Rome and it was made all the more memorable by the staff of this hotel. Despite arriving rather early we were checked in straight away and was given a lovely room with a big balcony. The room was clean, immaculate and had a flat screen tv with lots of English speaking channels. My husband and I have travelled a lot to the States, Far East and Europe and we have never come across a hotel with such a high level of personal service. For example, we had problems withdrawing money from ATMs on arrival at Rome airport. Mariano (the hotel manager) was helpful to the extent of calling up Visa to resolve our problems. He was also very helpful in giving us tips and directions to all the tourist sites. Eugenio, who looked after the reception in the afternoon, was very hospitable and always had time to talk to us. We found that the staff of this hotel were genuinely happy to help us. Incidently, everyone at the reception speak excellent English. The hotel has been recently renovated and is in a good location, only about 2 minutes walk from the Re Di Roma metro station. It is also easily accessible by the FM1 train from Fiumicino Airport (Rome). The train journey costs 5.50 Euros only and it takes about 35 minutes to get to Tuscolana. From Tuscolana it is a 5-minute walk to the hotel. This is faster, easier and cheaper then the alternative route of taking the express train to Termini followed by a metro ride. . All in all, a great hotel in a good location with a friendly and dedicated staff. We would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Rome and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: KimTin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a week ago. The Place is more than we expected in everyway. The staff where attentive and all of them were very friendly and gave good tips on everything we asked. Special thanks to front office's Eugenio and Mariano! The rooms are spacious and well equipped. Quite good sound isolation and the rooms are kept very clean. The hotel is less than 10 minutes away from the metro stops closest to Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Piazza Navona. So actually the hotels location does not cause any problem. The included breakfast was quite adequate and filled it's purpouse well. Big thanks to the waitress whom made us delicious cappucinos every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, courteous and very very clean”
Reviews.Author: mumandgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Re di Roma with my 10 year old daughter. We arrived very late in the evening and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. The next morning we were delighted to see that we had a small private balcony. The breakfast room was very pleasant and there was a good selection of fresh food - the breads and croissants were especially tasty. Although its a little way out of the centre, the metro station is only a few minutes away from the hotel, and the system is very easy to use - we also used the trams and buses, which we caught from San Giovanni. There is a good supermarket near the metro station, which we used for picnic supplies. This has to be the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in - our room was spotless. The beds were large and comfortable, the air conditioning was unobtrusive and the blackout curtains were very effective. It was lovely and quiet outside at night, which meant we both had a good nights sleep. It was very nice to have a bathtub as well as a shower. There were some nice touches I hadn't expected, like bathing toiletries and a very inexpensive minibar which was replenished every day. The staff were all pleasant at all times - my daughter was very happy here and has made me promise that if we go back to Rome we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B-Travlin
Reviews.Content: Even after reading the rave reviews of this hotel, I thought that nothing in Rome could be that great with such a good price. I was wrong! The only downside to our stay was the difficulty we had in finding the hotel the night of our arrival. Due to two flight delays in getting to Rome, we arrived at the Termini Station after 10 pm, when the subway closes, so we had to find our way to the hotel without benefit of the subway as described on the website directions. The directions on the website need to be a little more exact and complete, especially for those arriving after 10 pm. Also, the hotel doesn't have any kind of signage indicating that it is the hotel and it is in a residential area which makes it an unlikely place for a hotel. We walked for quite awhile before we finally found it. Once we got checked in, however, we were pleasantly surprised when the manager took us to our room and showed us how everything worked and where everything was. Being as we were so tired, we really appreciated his help. Although our room looked nothing like the pictures on their website, the room where we stayed had great air conditioning, great beds, great pillows and a large bathroom. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. Although the room wasn't large, we would stay there again. Our room also had a balcony that was fun to go out on to relax and the location of the hotel is great. I would suggest anyone going to Rome to check out this hotel, I don't think you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: ash108
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the nice clean modern hotel. The hotel itself is relatively small and fairly new and very clean. The staff were very cheerful and helpful. Its located a lttle bit from the main tourist attractions but the metro station is only across the road so getting around is easy. Would definetly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eliazabeth
Reviews.Content: Mt teenage daughter and I visited Rome 3rd-6th June to do some sightseeing and chose this hotel back in Jan when only reviews were in other languages - so pleased we took a chance! Hotel is clean, modern and very comfortable. We had a room with a balcony which was nice, good size bathroom with shower, the air con is quiet and the room had good blackout curtains plus we were so tired every night we both slept very well! Breakfast is a good selection of cereals, yoghurt, croissants etc, plenty there if you are late to breakfast(7-10). The staff at the hotel speak good English and are very helpful - ask about the open bus trip around Rome - it costs 16 euros and they can sell you tickets there. The metro is very close and will connect you to a lot of the tourist sights, be warned they closed the main line at 9pm one evening and we had to get a taxi back to the hotel - was very reasonable anyway (cost 13 euros from spanish steps)and was a lovely way to see Rome at night! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria01Manchester
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a friend and I to stay in for 3 nights in April this year. I'd read the other reviews and, based on these, chose this one over lots of others in Rome! I am pleased to say that this little hotel was great. Clean, new fittings (I think the hotel is relatively new), modern furnishings, balcony, nice big windows, lovely bathroom etc. The only downside was that the breakfast (buffet) could have been improved but this is only a slight thing. The reception staff were also brilliant. If you are travelling to the hotel then the easiest way is to get on the Underground Line A towards Anagnina and get off at the Re Di Roma stop (about 4 stops from Termini). Walk through the underground station until you get to the exit for Via Vercelli. The metro stop is at the bottom of the road for the hotel so if you come out this exit you cant go wrong. Once out of the underground just walk straight up the road and the hotel is on your left. Please note, the hotel does not have an external sign so you need to check out the pictures on the website to ensure you know what it looks like! The hotel is 30 mins walk from the Coliseum, and 45 mins from Trevvi. You can easily use the Metro stops for the Vatican/Spanish Steps etc as these are quite a walk away. Lastly - there is a lovely little restaurant two streets away but sadly i cant remember the name! Walk out of the hotel to the right and go to the main road heading towards the Coliseum (Giovani something) then look for a red sign advertising the restaurant. It is a real gem, serves all the locals, excellent food and very friendly service. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Re di Roma - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jayesse
Reviews.Content: We've just got home from a five night stay at the Hotel Re di Roma. I can honestly say it's the best mid sized, mid priced, city hotel I have ever stayed in.The hotel, which is family owned, opened in October 2007. The building which houses the hotel has had many former uses, including once being a school, and has now been extensively and lovingly rennovated and restored to create this lovely hotel - stylishly modern but incredibly welcoming and comfortable in every respect.We had room with a balcony and a huge double bed (at least king size!) which was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was just fabulous, and we had a bath tub as well as a very strong power shower. Although there wasn't any cooked food at breakfast, there was a wide buffet selection and everything was very fresh. You could eat as much as you liked and there were kitchen staff on hand constantly re-filling the croissants and bread and happy to make a capuccino if you preferred this to the tea and coffee in the urns.Everything was spotlessly clean and of course is still looking very fresh and new. The staff on reception were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them - they went out of their way to be helpful, looking up train times on the internet and printing maps off for us.I had a haircut at the hairdressers across the road from the hotel by Maria. She has magic scissors and I am delighted with the result - the perfect excuse to go back to the Re di Roma as soon as possible, when it's time for a trim! Judi, Brighton

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Granville27
Reviews.Content: I can add to the positive reviews below. We stayed here for 4 nights and were very impressed with the hotel. It's pretty new and the rooms are lovely with great bathrooms. The staff are exceptionally friendly and were very helpful with any questions we had. The hotel itself is just outside the 'downtown' Rome area but don't let this put you off. The Metro is 200m away and will whisk you into the center in a few minutes. The local area has a few restaurants and there is a great ice cream parlor nearby. Overall I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in Rome for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for a stylish and weloming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzie-must-travel
Reviews.Content: I will write a detailed review as when I booked this hotel there wasn’t any written in English. My partner and I arrived at the Termini at approximately 10.30pm. We were hoping to get the metro to Re Di Roma but unfortunately it was closed so we got a licensed taxi to the hotel which cost 12 euros. It took a few minutes to establish where the hotel was as there wasn’t a sign outside but when we did enter we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were welcoming and spoke perfect English. They showed us to our double room which was fantastic. I had expected it to be very small but was pleasantly surprised. The décor was modern with dark wood. The double bed was massive and very comfortable. There were lots of English speaking news channels on the TV. The mini bar did not contain alcohol but had very reasonably priced light refreshments. We did try to find a bar on our first night but there were only restaurants in the surrounding area and they were all fully booked at 11pm with local people. We went back to the hotel and bought a lovely bottle of wine from reception which we consumed in the room. Breakfast was a little disappointing. Unfortunately the lady serving was not quick enough to fill up the buffet and when we arrived there was a lack of bread and croissant. After a great hot shower we decided to walk to the coliseum but got totally lost as we are rubbish at map reading. It would have been a lot less stressful to get the metro. It is not too far if you can read maps! After a fantastic day seeing the sites, we returned to our well tidied room. The maid had hung our coats up and cleaned round. We ventured out around 9pm and headed down the main road and beyond the piazza. We found a great little restaurant/pizzeria that was sign posted off the main road. No one could speak English and we could not speak Italian but that did not matter, the staff were amazing and helped us with sign language and lots of laughs. The bill for two, with starters, mains, deserts and a bottle wine came to only 26 euros! All in all the hotel Re di Roma is great if you don’t want tourist heaven. It is not in an area where you will be ripped off but you do have to get metro, taxi or walk quite far if you want to spend time in the centre. The metro only costs 1 euro to get into the centre and only takes a few minutes. I will definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend it to anyone who likes to break from the mould.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonApm
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! My partner and I had never been to Rome, and so I simply booked a hotel which was affordable and purely by chance it was the Re di Roma. Having travelled to Italy with a fourteen month old, we took nothing for granted. I phoned the hotel and asked for a transfer from the airport, and sure enough we were greeted at the arrival gate by a smart driver in a brand new Mercedes people carrier. OK, 60 Euros isn't cheap, but the reassurance of being transported quickly and efficiently with our assorted bags, stroller etc, made us book the return journey. On arrival at the hotel we found that we didn't have a travel cot in the room - no problem, within 10 minutes the attentive staff had ensured that it arrived and was put up for us. The room and bathroom were clean and modern with comfortable furnishings and plenty of storage space. In terms of location, the hotel may look as if it is on the periphery of the city. However, the actual walking time between major sites was less than half an hour, and with a metro stop a few metres away longer trips, e.g. the vatican, were easy to organise. On the downside, our neighbours decided to listen to their TV at full blast, and the coffee at breakfast wasn't great (just ask for an espresso instead). These are trivial matters however, and should not detract from the fact that the hotel is a great place to stay, with friendly staff and an excellent location from which to enjoy the eternal city!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly no fuss”
Reviews.Author: vincent78
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at this small new hotel. Although it is not in anyway luxurious it is a pleasant and comfortable hotel.
