Above all we found the owner/manager and his small number of staff to be delightfully friendly and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. There is a very relaxed hassle free atmosphere. You can not eat there in the evening but they will recommend excellent local eating places. The hotel is close to the Metro and therefore a good base from which "to do the sites".

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Sasi_Attili
Reviews.Content: Booked on Opodo.com- Double room for 2 @ 50£/night for 4 nights- feb 2008. I am a budget traveller and this was a romantic 4 day getaway with my wife who loved this place. Amazing bath attached to the room with satellite TV showing english channels! (believe me -after a week in Italy you would be longing to hear spoken english) Nice and quiet location. Just a few mins walk from the Re di Roma station which is only a few minutes away from the main attractions by tube. The hotel itself is only 10 miles from the Ciampino airport which costs 30-40Euros by Taxi. But beware - we were charged 80 Euros by the Taxi guy who was running on a meter!!! So never get on a taxi unless you know how much it costs from A--> B. Eugenio who recieved us was our local tour guide. He made our trip entirely worth it. Gave us all the local info we needed. Also gave me a CD to copy my photos. The PC downstairs has internet access but I wasn't charged for using the PC to download pics from my camera into my mem stick. But the best thing abount our stay was Eugenio's hospitality. Having said that the rest of the staff are very helpful too. Amazing breakfast...esp. the croissants. Very good room service. Very clean rooms and linen changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “Re Di Roma - mama mia, how beautiful!! :D”
Reviews.Author: srodrigues
Reviews.Content: Hi! me and my boyfriend decided to go on a trip to Rome on January 22nd. We stayed at Re Di Roma, in Rome and we enjoyed a lot the hotel :). The staff was very nice, the hotel is brand new and extremely well cared. The design is very pleasant, the reading room is really nice, the bar is also nice and the breakfast room is really nice. The rooms are small, but very clean, with nice colors and pleasant furniture. Simple but classy :). We stayed at the 502, and we had a small terrace, which is not a common feature for all the rooms :). The TV stays at the wall, a black flat TV, and all the electric system works with a card, which is provived with the romm keys. They display several channels, but the SKY package is paid, only one or two channels are free. However, the offer is large and you can pick any tipy of channel you want. No english speaking films, everything is italian spoken :S...The bathroom is great: very clean, the design is simple but nice, the bath is good size...I liked the breakfast, despite some people says is not enough: croissants, bread, tea, milk, cereals, toasts, coffee( you can ask for an expresso or a cappucino to the lady, if you don't like the coffe :)) and much more...we always got place easily in the room, so, it´s easy to catch a place... Enjoy it! Rome is BEAUTIFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: aclampkin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are looking for an inexpensive place that is neat and clean. The rooms are very small, but very adequate. Lots of US television stations. The rooms were very clean and new. We arrive at 930am and they were nice enough to let us check in early. It is less than 100m from train station. My husband and I both had one suit case and a shoulder bag. No problem getting from airport to hotel. The hotel is in a very good location. There is a supermarket just a few blocks away. Lots of good places to eat and shop. Rome is not a very large city, so once we got to one spot, other attractions were just a short walk away. The breakfast is very modest, consisting of just salami, ham, swiss cheese, canned fruit, fresh fruit, 2 types of cereal, yogurt, juice, breads and coffee. Very typical in Europe. I am a Marriott's Reward Member and i normally stay there, but this hotel's proximity to the train station was the deciding factor. I'm glad I chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: GUSKRH
Reviews.Content: Ι was in doubt about this hotel due to few reviews on internet. But we found out that it was because the hotel is brand new (2-3 months). Very close to the Re Di Roma metro station (200m) in a quiet road, close to many stores. Helpful staff , good breakfast , nice modern decorated rooms, lcd tv with free satellite channels. We had booked 3 rooms and we all are more than satisfied. All in all a pleasant surprise, a super value for money....

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Re di Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vercelli 21, 00182 Rome, Italy
